story:
PLAY THE FREE DEMO!

Clicking on the image above will take you to the Steam page where you can download and play the free demo!

 

 

 

 

 

We're bringing turn based strategy and roguelikes together to create a unique and endlessly replayable strategy experience!

Delve into the easy to learn hard to master Behavior System! Inspired by the idea of bringing the fun of programming to a video game, the Behavior System offers you a simplified way to program and automate your bot's behaviours by mixing and matching 3 types of commands. The Behavior System offers tons of unique complexity in an easy to use, simple package!

 

 

Build and upgrade your robot army with specialized bot upgrades, weapons, and items! By combining different bots with different kinds of gear, you can create powerful combinations! Want to use the Focus Beam, a weapon that deals more damage the further it is from it's target, to it's maximum potential? Give it to a Fast Bot with the Keep At Range command. Now you have a powerful bot who can quickly move far away to deal a bunch of damage!

   

 

Every playthrough is different, with random bots, equipment, and behavior unlocks! Discover AI Cores throughout your game and unlock powerful commands, bots, equipment, and items! If you're lucky, you may even find some ultra-rare 'Hax'!

 

 

Turn the tides of battle by gaining control of Stations; key locations that provide powerful bonuses and large scale effects! Make sure to capture all the Stations you can, as they provide a variety of effects like deadly Auto-Turrets, Teleporters, and 3D Printers for building more bots!

   

 

All of the aliens use the same Behavior and Squad System as you! Outsmart your enemies by learning and exploiting their behaviors!

   

 

Explore randomly generated ships with unique layouts and loot to find!

 

 

Discover legendary robots that bring powerful and unique abilities!

 

 

Play through the Campaign Mode, which has you progress through multiple stages to defeat the invaders!

 

 

Overcome a variety of 'Curve Balls' and 'Finales'; boss-like encounters that are a true test of your strategy skills!

   

 

 

 

Bot Net: Ramshackle Robotics takes place part way into an interstellar war between the Human Worlds Alliance (HWA) and a shadowy conglomerate of alien species called The Galactic Legion (The Legion for short). The Legion has conquered many species and forced them to fight in their armies, so in the full game you will run into many kinds of aliens.

 

 

You play as an IT guy aboard a human spaceship that has been defeated by The Legion. The ship is dead in the water, alien soldiers have boarded and have killed everyone they could find. You are locked in your office with a few janitor bots and a 3d printer you can use to build stuff with. You can't fight, but you can program these robots to fight for you. So, you start 3d printing as many as you can, send them out into the ship to gather supplies, and fight to take the ship back. If you can get control of the ship’s generators and the bridge, you just might be able to warp jump to safety...

 

 

 

 

In a typical game, you will be building and outfitting a whole bunch of robots, programming their behaviors using Bot Net’s unique Behavior System, and sending them off to explore and recapture control of the ship.

The game is based in a grid of grids; the ship is divided into a grid of rooms and each room has its own grid of floor tiles. When programming your bots, you’re designing how they will behave within a room, and you move bots into rooms using squad waypoints. Essentially you are assigning a squad of bots a room waypoint and programming how they will behave against enemies once they’re in that room.

 

 

The room based gameplay also plays into how you progress throughout a game. Within each room, there can be points of interest called Stations. These Stations can provide a variety of benefits like Auto-Turrets or Teleporter nodes and also include the primary objectives of the game. In order to gain control of a Station, you need to gain control of the room it’s located in. Room control is gained by clearing out the room of enemies and having at least one of your units in the room. This is a two-way street though, as the aliens can retake rooms through the same rules.

 

Throughout a game, you will have a bar at the top of your screen representing the ship’s generator integrity. This bar will deplete each turn that the enemies control the ship’s generator objectives. But, if you retake a generator, your generator integrity will start to repair itself. If the generator integrity reaches zero, you lose the game. In order to win a game, you must gain control of all the generators and the control room.

 

 

On your way to achieving the main objectives, you'll run into what we call 'Curve Balls'. These are randomized events that mix up the gameplay by throwing tough challenges or secondary objectives at you. Curve Balls can take the form of a variety of things, such as a group of tougher and smarter elite enemies or a fire that's spreading throughout the ship that needs to be dealt with.

 

 

When you're nearing the end of a game, you'll encounter a 'Finale'. Finales are similar to the Curve Balls only much bigger and more challenging. These essentially act as a final boss for a game. Like the Curve Balls, they can also take the form of a variety of things, not necessarily a typical boss fight but not exclusive to that either. Finales will be the ultimate test of your skills, where only the best of the best will succeed!

 

 

In order to deal with all these challenges, you're going to need to master the Behavior System. The Behavior System is how you program your bot's actions in Bot Net: Ramshackle Robotics. When creating your bots, or at anytime during your turn, you will be able to give your bots 3 types of commands.

 

 

The first command type is what we call a Movement Command. This describes how you would like to move in relation to a target. This could be as simple as our ‘Move To’ command, which means to move directly towards your target, or something as complex as our ‘Spread Out’ command, which will prioritize moving to the best spot within range of your target that has the least amount of friendly units nearby.

The second command type is what we call an Action Command. This command type describes when, or if, you would like to use the bot’s equipment on your turn. Examples of this would be the ‘Run And Gun’ Action Command, which has your bot always perform it’s movement before using it’s equipment, or the ‘Assault’ Action Command, which has your bot only move if it couldn’t use it’s equipment from it’s current position.

The third command type is what we call a Target Command. This command type describes how to prioritize the available targets in a room. The Target Command ‘Pristine Enemies’ will prioritize enemies with the most current health, whereas the Target Command ‘Injured Enemies’ will prioritize in the opposite order; prioritizing enemies with the lowest current health.

When you combine one command from each of these categories, you get a full behaviour. A unit with the commands ‘Move To’, ‘Run And Gun’, ‘Pristine Enemies’, will first move towards the enemy in range with the highest current health and then attack with it’s equipment. In contrast, a unit with the commands ‘Spread Out’, ‘Assault’, ‘Injured Enemies’, will first try to attack from it’s current position, and if there are no valid targets, will move to a spot in the room in range of the enemy with the lowest current health that has the least number of friendly units nearby.

 

 

What kind of Behavior you decide to give your bot will usually depend on what kind of bot you've made. When making a bot, you get to decide it's bot type, equipment, and optionally an item.

 

 

A bot's type affects what the bot's base stats are. Which bot type you choose will depend on what kind of strategy you're going for. Need a tank bot that will soak up lots of damage? The Tough Bot will be great for that job! Need to get your bot somewhere quickly? The Fast Bot is an excellent choice for that job! In the full game, there will be a large variety of bots from a number of rarities to choose from for several kinds of situations, including, but not limited to, the following:

  • Janitor Bot: Standard issue janitor robot. Moderate stats across the board.
  • Maintenance Bot: Has a really nice and fancy wrench, recovers health each turn.
  • Tough Bot: Outfitted with armor plating, has improved health.
  • Fast Bot: Equipped with a rocket pack and roller skates, has improved movement.
  • Handy Bot: Built with an additional arm, can hold a second item.
  • Observant Bot: Has binoculars for eyes, has improved range with equipment.
  • Careful Bot: Coated with a layer of bubble wrap, has a chance to save an item on use.
  • Teleporter Bot: Has a teleporter beacon on it's back, can be used as an end node for your teleporters.

 

 

A bot's equipment is what they will be using to fight the aliens. You'll want to make sure you pair your bots with equipment that suits their abilities. Like bot types, there will be a large variety of equipment available, including the following:

  • Welding Torch: Normally used for welding sheets of metal together, the Welding Torch is a simple but effective weapon.
  • Rivet Gun: A nail gun type tool normally used in construction. It fires bolts of heated spikes, used to bind metal sheets. It's not built for combat, but certainly capable of it!
  • Pulse Repeater: A powerful ranged weapon, the F-103 Pulse Repeater is the standard issue assault rifle for Marines of the Human Worlds Alliance.
  • Scatter Array: An extremely deadly shotgun-like weapon. The X-12 Scatter Array is your best friend in a tight spot.
  • Focus Beam: The L-42 Focus Beam is a devastating ranged weapon used by the HWA special forces. It fires an accelerating particle beam that inflicts large damage the further away the target is.
  • Solar Flare: The RA-23 Antimaterial Cannon (nicknamed the 'Solar Flare') is a prototype weapon that fires a fusion blast, destroying everything in it's path. Requires SPF 5,000 sunscreen to use safely.
  • Arc Conduit: Cobbled together from various electrical equipment, the Arc Conduit fires a laser that ionizes the air around it creating bolts of electricity that arc to everything nearby.
  • Concussion Cannon: The Protocorp Crowd Dispersal Tool, less formally known as the Concussion Cannon, is a tool often used during civil unrest. It fires a large shockwave, knocking back anything in it's way.
  • Containment Rifle: Developed by Protocorp's 'Civilian Friendly' weapons branch, the Containment Rifle fires a stream of thick foam that holds anything it touches in place.

 

 

Optionally, you can choose to equip your bot with an Item. Items provide single use effects that are generally activated manually by the player. These will often provide a rather powerful effect at a an efficient cost. Some examples of Items that will be available are as follows:

  • Repair Kit: A simple bot repair kit, will heal your bot on use.
  • Battery Pack: A portable battery pack, will recharge and overcharge your bot on use.
  • Backup Core: A spare bot power core, is automatically consumed on bot death, preventing death and healing the bot.
  • Portable Turret: A miniature auto-turret that can be placed on the ground to defend an area.
  • Shield Generator: When used, creates a temporary, stationary, energy shield that can only be fired through from the inside.
  • Landmine: A remotely activated landmine. Place it on the ground in a choke-point and activate it when the enemies are least expecting!
  • Active Camouflage: Can be use to render the user completely invisible for a short duration
  • Teleportation Grenade: A portable teleporter node that can be thrown at a target to instantly teleport it to a controlled teleporter.

 

 

Now that you know how to make your bots, you'll need to know a bit about the enemies you're going up against! All of the enemies in Bot Net: Ramshackle Robotics use the same Behavior System that you do.  Understanding your enemy's tactics is critical to your success. We have a good variety of enemies planned for the game, including the following:

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The Swarm is a insect race that is too dangerous to be controlled, even by the Galactic Legion. The Galactic Legion will keep Larval Matriarchs (The infant form of a Swarm Queen) frozen on ice, only to be deployed as a biological weapon of mass destruction in emergency situations. Once released The Swarm will consume everything in it's wake. In order to contain the inevitable chaos that unleashing The Swarm causes, The Galactic Legion has genetically modified the DNA of The Swarm in a way that will cause all of it's members to expire after a certain period of time.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Bot Net: Ramshackle Robotics will be available for Windows, MacOS, and Linux on Steam. We also have plans to broaden our list of platforms in the future!

 

 

 

To start, Bot Net; Ramshackle Robotics will be available in English. We plan to bring it to as many languages as possible before and after release though! We'll be prioritizing each language based on the demand we have for that translation, so please let us know what languages you'd like us to translate to!

 

 

 

 

 

 

CaffeineWare is owned and run by both Brea Parker and Nic Gardner. So far this project has been funded entirely through investment from our friends and family, as well as personal investments. We plan to complete Bot Net: Ramshackle Robotics whether this crowdfunding campaign succeeds or not, with the difference being how long it will take for us to complete the game. This is the reason behind us choosing a flexible goal for the campaign. Because of this, every pledge to the campaign helps us bring the game to you sooner than later!

Our crowdfunding goal for Bot Net: Ramshackle Robotics is $42500 CAD. This goal was chosen as the minimum amount of funding we would need to be able to work full time on the game so we can deliver it by this fall. The breakdown of what this money will be going towards is as follows:

Indiegogo Fees: $2125 CAD. This is for Indiegogo's cut of the campaign.

Art and Sound Assets: $15000 CAD. This budget will allow us to continue paying our freelance artist and composer for the fantastic quality assets they've created so far. What's available in the demo is only a small taste of what's to come!

Supplementing Cost of Living: $10000 CAD. This budget is what's needed to be able to work full time on the game from now until launch. For two people, we live on a pretty small budget of $2500 CAD per month.  Overall it will cost us around $25000 CAD from now until launch in living expenses. We have the rest of this budget already figured out, but will need the additional funds from the campaign to cover this cost.

Equipment and Software: $2000 CAD. This budget will be going toward any software fees, along with equipment needed to develop and bring the game to other platforms.

Localization: $2500 CAD. This will be our initial budget for localizing the game to a second language.

Marketing: $10875 CAD. The remainder of the budget will be going towards marketing costs. This includes payments to our marketing team and an advertisement budget.

 

 

 

In the case that our crowdfunding goes even better than hoped for, we've planned out some exciting stretch goals for you!

 

$60000 CAD:  Additional Content and Localization

If we make it to $60000 CAD, we'll use that extra budget to design and develop more of the regular content (Enemies, Bots, Weapons, etc.) along with some of our secondary feature ideas and additional localization to requested languages. Some examples of extra features we'd be interested in are:

  • Challenge Mode: The challenge mode would be a special kind of game where a pre-existing board state would already be setup for you and your goal would be to figure out how to win the game in a limited amount of time. This could come paired with it's own achievements and unlocks.
  • Theater: The theater would be a feature where you could playback game replays and share them with your friends. We plan on building this feature to be quite robust and have it allow you to stop the replay at any moment, move the camera around, and click on things in the game to check additional info.
  • Level Editor: Pretty straight forward, this would be a tool for making your own levels for the game. We would ideally pair this with the ability to share your levels with your friends.
  • Multiplayer: We've played around with the idea of multiplayer games. This could work in the way of each player building bots to fight each other or, another idea being, one player gets to act as the aliens and on the bots. We think there's some interesting potential for multiplayer so we'll think a lot more about this idea should we reach this goal.

This list could also include possible ideas the community has and is interested in as well. If we reach this goal, we'll evaluate how many and which features we could work on and let the community decide which option is the favorite.

 

$100000 CAD: Free DLC for All Backers

This would be phenomenal if we were able to raise this much! In the event that this somehow happens, we plan to develop an expansion for the game which would include any extra features we weren't able to get into the base game, along with a bunch of additional regular content, and a new campaign mode. We'll also make this expansion free for everyone who helped us reach this goal! We'd also take this opportunity to bring additional localization and work on bringing the game to consoles.

 

 

This campaign is promoted by IndieBros - "Helping Indie developers do what they do best!"

Level Editor: Pretty straight forward, this would be a tool for making your own levels for the game. We would ideally pair this with the ability to share your levels with your friends.

Multiplayer: We've played around with the idea of multiplayer games. This could work in the way of each player building bots to fight each other or, another idea being, one player gets to act as the aliens and on the bots. We think there's some interesting potential for multiplayer so we'll think a lot more about this idea should we reach this goal.
This list could also include possible ideas the community has and is interested in as well. If we reach this goal, we'll evaluate how many and which features we could work on and let the community decide which option is the favorite. $100000 CAD: Free DLC for All BackersThis would be phenomenal if we were able to raise this much! In the event that this somehow happens, we plan to develop an expansion for the game which would include any extra features we weren't able to get into the base game, along with a bunch of additional regular content, and a new campaign mode. We'll also make this expansion free for everyone who helped us reach this goal! We'd also take this opportunity to bring additional localization and work on bringing the game to consoles.  This campaign is promoted by IndieBros - "Helping Indie developers do what they do best!"

story:
The Game

Hyperventila is a narrative-driven open world RPG set in the Hyperventila galaxy. A world of disreputable space bars, rogue traders and totalitarian space empires.

Fans of the classic 70s and 80s era of science fiction films would find themselves right at home in this universe. Jump in your spacecraft and immerse yourself among the stars.

Hyperventila will become playable on Steam and other online retailers, January 2021.

 

           

 

Mechanics

Faction dynamics allow you to manipulate and influence factions to shift the source of power in the galaxy.

You can talk to NPCs and will be given several dialogue options to steer the conversation.

You are able to interact with items, bring items onboard your ship and transport them to any destination.

Use your personal scanner to get more information from your surroundings.

 

You can customize your load-out by equipping items at your personal ship station, and equip ship attachments at the shipyard.

Use your hyperdrive to jump from one solar system to another.

In order to enter stations and other ships in space, you will have to manually dock your ship.

You can navigate the Galaxy using your NAV-CON, there you can select destinations, scan stellar objects and track other ships.

 

Doors inside your ship can be controlled from your interior ship console on the bridge. Doors and consoles that do not belong to you can also be hacked if you have a hacking PDA.

 

You can receive messages from anywhere in the galaxy using the GAL-COM system and hail ships using your DIR-COM at your ship command station.

 

The Galaxy

The Hyperventila Galaxy is a place rich with the potential for adventure. Even with the technology to jump almost anywhere in the galaxy, it remains largely unexplored.

From the dark outer rim to the inner turbulent regions of The Vex, the Hyperventila galaxy is the place to go for a determined space captain.

     
   

Playable Species

You will be able to select from a large variety of humanoid species when starting the game.

Each with their own skills, traits and characteristics.

They could be the adventurous human Landers...

...the noble Echron...

...or the small but fierce Praat.

 

The Factions

Each corner of the galaxy has been claimed by a specific faction. Be it the proud Cespians or the free pirates or the entitled Coalition... when in their space your relationship with this faction better be in good standing.

 

    Galactic Coalition

                                                     

  

 

This faction considers itself the only legitimate government of the galaxy and does not recognize the autonomy of the pirate alliance (FPA).

 
    Free Pirate Alliance

                                                                                                                  

  

 

Comprised of what were previously smaller groups of traders and brigands, the free pirate alliance was created to put an end to the extreme levels of lawlessness that existed in the part of the galaxy known as “The Vex”. 

 
    Cespian Space Empire

                                                                                      

  

 

A powerful authoritarian space empire that controls a quarter of the galaxy. An autonomous government in the galaxy that retains their imperial and social traditions from the past.

 
    The Echron Collective

                                                                                                            

  

 

A secluded authoritarian institution that isn’t welcoming to outsiders. It became autonomous after the collapse of the first galactic government but still has a representative in the galactic coalition chamber.
 
   

Perks!

By backing this campaign you can get some exclusive perks:

  • Name in the credits - you will be listed as a backer in the credits of the game, along with other backers in your reward tier
  • Digital Codex - a guide to the Hyperventila Galaxy with information about the planets and ships and factions
  • Digital Artbook - an arranged collection of designs from the game in high resolution, with comments by the developer
  • Digital Soundtrack - a downloadable soundtrack with the atmospheric tracks by composer Arbre Noir
  • Extra Copy of Hyperventila - get an extra copy of the game to gift to a friend (you will recieve an extra Steam key along with your own)
  • Hyperventila T-Shirt - show off to your fellow space captains with your own Hyperventila T-Shirt
  • Personalized Ship - work with the developer and influence the design of one of the official ships (Limited offer, 4/5 Claimed)

Artwork

All artwork for the game has been made with a great attention to detail to ensure the look and feel of the game stays true to the era of classic science fiction.

 

The ships have been made with a fully designed interior for the player to explore. The cargo areas will allow you to store cargo as you transport it across the galaxy.

 

 

About The Developer

 Tymen Muller is a passionate game designer with more than a decade of experience in 3D graphics, 3D printing and illustration.

He has designed products that have gone into mass production, top rated Steam workshop content and detailed spacecraft illustrations for many years.

His passion for physical model design and classic science fiction films are what inspired him to make this game. Three years ago he quit his job as a 3D printing engineer and started pursuing his dreams full-time. Hyperventila is his most ambitious project so far. With drive and passion he continues to work on it every day and the completion of the project is now in sight.

 

Where does the money go?

I want you to feel assured that every penny of the campaign will be spent on Hyperventila, to build and grow the game.

Some of the biggest challenges in these uncertain times is the cost of living. The money will support the developer until the game comes out and the rest will go towards promotion.

Another big challenge these days is simply getting noticed and therefore I have allocated a chunk of the campaign income to promotion and marketing.

On top of that there are various taxes and fees that come into play, both from this website and the various countries where payments need to be processed.

 

If not all the goals are reached, the funds will still go towards development but some features may need to be cut in the future, the promotional budget may also be smaller.

All backers that pledged will get what they were promised in their packages.

 

Follow and Share

To guarantee success, follow and share Hyperventila across the web! Find other people who share your interests and let them know about the game:

story:
Dimday Red is a roleplaying game about choice and consequence, living and dying, hope and despair. In the game, as in the actual world, lives come to crossroads and follow directions depending on the choices, big or small, that we make.

The world, characters and their stories evolve and branch many times before coming to one of the nine possible endings in the digital game. But the story doen't end there. You can continue playing the tabletop version until the last day of human kind!

The narrative of Dimday Red could be seen as a metaphor for human existence. As each of us go through our lives, conscious of our impending mortality, the world in DDR must face its inevitable collision with the Sun and decide how to live the last years of humanity.

What would you do if the world ended in 52 years?





The Earth's orbit has been perturbed, causing the planet to slowly move closer and closer towards the sun for the past 47 of years. As a result, its axis has tilted and its rotation around itself has slowed, making days last longer and in some places night never comes anymore. 

The phenomenon was originally named Terrestrial Orbit Lapse, but is widely called the Lapse.

Scientists estimate it will take around 52 years for the Earth to come so close to the sun that life will be no longer sustainable.

Because of Earth’s new position, some places have already been deemed inhabitable. Most of the northern hemisphere is under constant heat. All major cities in the United States, European Union, Republic of China and Russia are mostly lifeless concrete deserts.

Everything has changed on the Fireball, as Earth came to be called after the Lapse. The structure of human society is on the bring of collapse. The only ones keeping some kind of order are powerful corporations that battle for authority and influence until the end. They control the army and the police and have created authoritarian regimes in most developed cities. Democracy is a concept of times past, dismantled for the “benefit of the people”.

The immense heat has created enormous waves of environmental refuges that try to reach safety. Former super power counties have annexed their southern neighbors, sometimes peacefully but on most occasions not.

 



People on the Fireball, would be normal dysfunctional human beings, like all of us, but they are not. Most of them have been born after the Lapse and all they have known is an authoritarian society that stubbornly fights for survival, in a world that knows it won't survive. Some of them choose chaos, some choose order and some follow their hearts.

One thing is certain. No one is equal under the sun anymore.

 

Castes

After the initial chaos subsided, a new kind of social order has developed. It consists of the following classes:

  • Subhumans - Beings living outside society, with no rules or humanity left.
  • Dirt - The lowest level of citizens in organized society. Most of them work for the black markets and commodity factories. They are not part of the Corporate Rule.
  • Red Collar - Middle-class workers, the basic workforce for the corporation ecosystem.
  • Black Collar - Management personnel in the corporation ecosystem.
  • Luminaries - They are the corporation bosses. The Luminaries comprise eight families based around the world.
  • Pax Deorum - It is composed of three people no one actually knows. There is speculation that its members are heads of the Luminaries, but the families deny that. 

 

Mutations

Due to continuous exposure to the sun, many of the children born after the Lapse develop cancer related mutations, sometimes powerful, but always deadly.

  • Marble Eyes - They have developed heat vision, being capable of seeing at night and behind objects. They see a merge of normal and heat sensitive images buy they can’t recognize colors any more. 
  • Hard Skins - Because of overexposure, a type of cancer has covered their skin, deeming it very hard, almost impenetrable.
  • Controllers - Children born after the Lapse. It is still undefined what causes their abilities. They were sought early by Corporations and were mainly working for them.
  • Zealots - The have developed a brain tumor that impacts their memory and cognitive abilities. They have a 9 minute memory span.
  • Aqualungs - Because of continuous use underwater, their lungs keep swelling, making them able to hold their breath for over 30 minutes. 

 

 

​

You can play Dimday Red in your PC or Mac. You play as Eric, the marble-eyed hitman, whose goal is to find your place in this ever warmer world. The game is story driven, and your choices, represented as cards, will make a enormous impact on its outcome.
 




Like real life, Eric's choices won't always lead to the results he would hope for, so the unraveling of the story becomes unexpected and mysterious. The world of Dimday Red is not a friendly place and danger lurks in his every move. 
 

​
 

To make your decisions on key points of the story, you will use Choice Cards, which will be available depending on your character's attribute stats. Your choices will impact the story, but also Eric's psyche and physique, and they will mark his future abilities.
 


You will also have to choose how Eric converses with other characters. Most of the times, this won't have a dramatic effect on the story, but it will affect his stats and as a result his future interactions. 

As you progress, you will build your character's attributes, and they will determine how he will interact with other characters and situations.
 



If you find the world of Dimday Red intriguing, you can continue the story with the Tabletop Role Playing Game. It contains 1 Rule Book, 1 Campaign, 1 Deck with 84 cards, and 1 set of Dice. Take your story telling to the next level while the world burns around you! Two to six can play.
 



 

The game deck is made by Character, Choice, and Ending cards. In addition, 7 Deadly Sins and 7 Heavenly Virtues cards are used to affect the character's attributes. All cards are mat laminated,  Sins and Virtues cards are also gold printed.

The game deck is common for both the digital and physical game and consists of the following cards:

 

Dimday Red is created to provide a unique storytelling experience. It is not supposed to be just another game, and although choice based games have been around for a while, the choices you make in DDR, won't always deliver what you expect.

DDR's goal is to emerge the player into its world and let them feel how it is to live in the last days of the world!
 

  84 digital & physical cards

  Heading-straight-to-the-apocalypse story

  Your choices will shape the future

  9 different endings to the main story

  Discover & unlock side quests and stories 

  Great re-playability value

  Immersive card & environment artwork

  Original soundtrack

  Mat laminated physical cards

  Continue the story with the tabletop storytelling RPG

 

Dimday Red is not about one story, that has a beginning and an ending. Its metaphor about human existence and mortality can be branched in so many ways, as it does real life. To find the best tools and techniques to convey that message and bring it to as many people as possible, is very important.

Stretch goals are the steps for the evolution of the basic game. The higher we go, the more complete the experience will be. And you can be a part of it!

 

Add-ons are especially designed items that you can add to your perks. They are all limited editions created for our campaign supporters!

 

Hardback Art Book

If you love the game's art, this is the book you need! All character, environment and card illustrations, together with Dimday Red world's story. The book will be printed in a limited edition on eco friendly paper.


 

Short Stories Collection

Signed, limited edition paperback book, with short stories from the Dimday Red world.


Original Soundtrack

Original music is written by the amazing Dimitris Bouzanis, and is provided in a limited edition physical CD and case.


Limited Edition Art Print

Poster printed with eco friendly, long-lasting inks in handmade paper. Signed limited edition only for the campaign supporters!


Limited Edition T-Shirts

Direct on Fabric printed T- Shirts in a limited number of copies.

 

Although Dimday Red is a personal project by 1 Sick Puppy (read more below), it wouldn't be half as interesting without the talents of some extraordinary people.

 

 


 

My name is Spiros Drakatos and by now I have been a designer for more years than not! Since the beginning it was all about telling stories, or at least making people think about them. Illustration, design and art have all served as tools to enable me to tell these stories. Sometimes the results were digital, sometimes physical but in the end new characters where created, and new worlds came to life.
 



1 Sick Puppy is my alias for this one-man-band project and resulting games. Creating the world of Dimday Red world and the people who live in it, has been in the works for about a year now, and a lot longer in my head!

I really appreciate you reading this far and considering supporting this project. I hope it becomes as rewarding for you as it has been for me!

Many thanks,

Spiros

story: ...

A 3d printed medium Dross


Derelict is a squad-based tactical real time strategy game built for mobile devices and tablets, including the iPad.

We have already completed more than forty levels with engaging art, skilled soldiers and among the most persistent and challenging enemies you can encounter in game play.

See our work here:   http://www.slidedb.com/games/derelict-ios


We are asking for your support to help us complete the remaining levels and to finish our game.

We require time for final development, artwork and programing, contract work and ongoing software licensing (Maya, Mudbox, Photoshop, Unity Pro iOS, etc.). We are making an original game for iPad, i.e., one that is not a port.

Just who are Team Derelict?

We are a team of two hard working individuals:

• Alex Zimich - Artist, Designer, The Art Institute of Vancouver graduate.

• Alex Hird - Programmer, The Art Institute of Vancouver graduate.

Why fund us?

Team Derelict is comprised of two ambitious young game developers. We believe that our project is innovative, imaginative and engaging, and can be brought fully to life through the direct support of people like you!

We are aiming for a game that is truly different from the rest. There are many quality “shoot-‘em-up” types of games available on the market. Our game Derelict is different: your opponent adapts and this keeps players thinking and challenged throughout each level.

With your support Derelict can be a more complete and immersive game that will be more challenging and enjoyable for the player. Help fund us and get an inside look as our project comes to life, as you help us create a more original game.

In order to complete our game to the standard we are aiming for we wish to maintain complete control over our project. We need funding to help us with on-going software licensing fees and to contract work such as sound effects. Your support will give us the time we need to complete our game polished to our high standards, and released in a timely manner.

What are we asking for?

We want to continue to make the game we set out to make. No shortcuts and no compromises. We are almost finished, and ask for your help.


What is Derelict, the game?

Derelict is a squad-based real-time strategy game, requiring a sophisticated mobile defence strategy for objective success. The objective of the game is to get your soldiers from one side of the derelict space-ship to the other, moving from one airlock to the next. There you rest, refuel, reload and prepare to meet your opponents in the next level.

The ship in question is the Wing of Icarus. It was exploring uncharted space and has been infested with the Dross. Dross are like a mutated ant/spider creatures and are fearless, deadly and relentless. The walls of the ship are now covered in biomass, and with spores that come up from the floor and spawn the Dross. They are invasive and can quickly saturate all areas the ship, thriving in this dark environment and quickly converting the ship into their hive.

You are the commanding officer of the squad of elite space soldiers, in charge of repatriating the ship and eliminating the Dross infestation. Your squad must fight hard and fast through the Dross defences and clear the way for re-enforcements. Will a direct forward offensive be successful? Or is it better to hunker down in a strongly-defended location and let the Dross come to you? Or perhaps you can find a safe route to take your squad through with minimal opposition? You must evaluate a changing situation and adapt quickly, because you enemy certain will!

Play the role of the Commander. Reclaim the Derelict. Rescue survivors. Eradicate the Dross.

Derelict is much, much more than a point and click game. It has real time gameplay and constant action. Your opponent continually adapts to the situation and you must, too.

Derelict plays similar to the moving across maps to safe houses in Left4Dead. The atmosphere is similar the movie Alien 2. The game plays with a desktop tower defence and an item system like The Last of Us. x5! Our ecology of the environment and the infesting aliens is realistic and believable, and is designed for the player to fully engage with the game.

What do backers get?

What if we surpass our goal?

Who are the main characters?

Dross. These alien creatures once inhabited the planet and now they are taking over the spaceship. Biomass and spores are growing at a tremendous rate, constantly spawning more and more Dross. These bugs consume anything and convert it into more biomass to spawn more Dross.

Soldiers. An squad of elite mercenaries are hired to reclaim the Derelict spaceship.

Commander. You are the commanding officer of this squad of soldiers.

Core Gameplay

Select your squads gear. Spend your earned points on: 
  • Armor 
  • Pistols, rifles, flame-thowers, etc. 
  • Higher ranks 
  • Customize the soldiers’ appearance

Review the layout of the derelict ship and decide your strategy. Enter the level and proceed to the airlock: 
  • Control where the soldiers move and aim 
  • Defend your soldiers from the attacking Dross 
  • Take and hold key positions across the map of the spaceship 
  • Open and close doors 
  • Activate consoles 
  • Use the layout of the level to your advantage 
  • The mission is complete when your soldiers are at the exit

Your final grade is based on how intact your squad is by the end of the level.

The Story begins . . .

In the quest to discover new worlds, space travel has taken the human race to many new habitable planets. One such planet is X

This planet, rich in its natural resources, was once harvested for its valuable treasures. Specimens of unique and unusual plants, animals and minerals were collected and stored.

One animal specimen taken was the Dross. 

The Dross, an aggressive, insect-like race, has built a nest and infested the entire ship. Your mission is to take back the Derelict.

Features of Derelict

Sophisticated and complex Ai: 
  • The Dross are intelligent and will evaluate options to take the best route. 
  • The Dross adapt and learn from their mistakes, and from yours!

Story driven gameplay: 
  • 40+ original levels of play 
  • Varied environments inside of the space ship

Arcade levels: 
  • Stand-alone levels 
  • Hone and increase skills 
  • Quick game play 
  • Hours of additional gameplay 
  • Separate level-up system 
  • Rewards for story mode

Emergent gameplay: 
  • “Herding” Dross 
  • Manipulate the doors 
  • Control short range radio

These bugs will take the best route around fire and around locked doors:
  • Capable of breaking through the doors and avoiding combat/gunfire 
  • Flank and sneak around the soldiers to attack from behind

Immersive environment: 
  • Lighting and shadows 
  • Flickering lights 
  • Individual corridor lights 
  • Minimal HUD

Gear & Guns 
There are different weapons for different purposes. Each weapon has its strengths and weaknesses. Players will use more powerful weapons as the game progresses.

Once you select your weapon, you need to consider what armor the soldier should wear, as it isn’t always the best idea to use the heaviest armor.

Be on the look-out for more powerful weapons and gear for the soldiers in updates.

How does the game play?

Derelict is a tactical thinking game: challenging yet fair; random yet predictable.

The soldiers must work as a team, using their strengths and protecting their weaknesses.

  • Fortify, defend, lure, advance 
  • Rake the corridors and the rooms, hold positions 
  • Reinforce your troops and don’t get too far ahead 
  • Make decisions quickly and adapt to the changing situation 
  • You are only as strong as your weakest team-mate 
  • Consider frontal attacks vs flanking attacks 
  • Strategize and execute a plan of attack and of defence 
  • Equip your soldiers with a variety of powerful gear 
  • Keep your guns facing forward and protect one another

Game plays smoothly on iPad 2 and above. Controls are smooth, responsive and intuitive.

Unique storyline full of suspense, intrigue and plot twists that break conventions. There are bonus levels that add to the game.


Have more questions?

Come experience a sample of what the Dross are like at http://www.slidedb.com/games/derelict-ios

Contact us @ Alex.Zimich@gmail.com, or through indieGoGo

Thank you for your support!

Risks and challenges

The primary risks we face are all associated with the addition of extended and completely new features introduced by our stretch goals. Each addition feature carries the risk of introducing new bugs to the system. To help minimize this risk, a new technical design encompassing all new and old features will be created to map out how all the parts of the game work and interact together. This allows us to have a high level view of the entire project and make changes before encountering problems that would otherwise arise. Furthermore, as features are being completed they will undergo substantial playtesting to help identify potential bugs. Which once identified can then be addressed and fixed.

story:
Grimore: Vengeance

We decided to do a crowdfunding project because we need the funds to finish our game project Grimore: Vengeance. We're a small team but we have the skills necessary to deliver a great immersive experience!


    Grimore: Vengeance is a singleplayer Hack'N'Slash first person game which has been in planning for a little over a year now. We are really eager to start, and if everything goes well, the game should be completed in  a year or so. This is when we'll publish the game on Steam.

    All of our members will be financially secure while the project is going. We just need these funds to finish the game. We are extremely ambitious, have tons of initiative,and have the drive and dedication necessary to see this game through! We just need a sum of funds to get this project really going.

Above: The entrance to the starting village. Below: our snow system.

 

    If you have a passion for fantasy/medieval RPG hack'n'slash games, this is where it's at! in first person! Combat and story immersion will be our primary focus, and we will keep open minds to what our backers have to say about the project! :)

Here's a link to our site on IndieDB: http://www.indiedb.com/games/grimore-vengeance

We need your help!

We've come a long way with the technology, but now need your help in finishing this game. What initially started as a 6 month project has quickly turned into a 2 year  project. Instead of just accepting nothing is perfect and going ahead and publishing the game on Steam, we realized the fact that we were making a potentially truly immersive game, and we decided to proceed in order to make the game that we knew we could make. We are extremely grateful for any funding we might receive from anyone and we also have some pretty good perks to go along with the funding as a reward to our backers! Its your chance to be part of this great game and experience the fun for yourself! 

The funds:

The funds will be used for several things like the following; Professional quality character models, full rigged, animated and textured. Pro licenses allowing us to improve several components in the game and giving us access to more engine features. Copyrights. Acquiring additional help for models, audio, music and other professional grade assets.

Our fans:

Even if you cant back us in the form of money, you could still spread the word around about this project and the game! Remember, we want what YOU want!

story:
Изменить язык: Русский

 

About the game

The game is a virtual social state, in which each player is a citizen of this gaming universe on device - iOs and Android. We support both most popular mobile operation system. Any act, committed in the game, will have an effect in a varying degree on all the participants. Making decisions is a major driving point of the game. Everything will depend on your decisions.

You will not lose, but find out one of several endings. It’s all because of the events from the outside will influence your game in its course, and it will be impossible to predict them – you can only change their probability.

Ranks will be represented by the career ladder: you will start with an office worker. Thanks to your decisions, you will climb up the ranks. Each player is in one of the ranks and he solves the problems of the current level. For example: being a party activist you will try to bring people together for a common goal, at the same time, becoming a minister you will solve the issues of national importance. The higher your level - the more authority and responsibility are on your shoulders.

In order to reach the prized level 10, you need to earn the respect of the population of the state, which is achieved only due to your decisions. There is business in the game that you can develop to a global scale, which will let you secure the purchase of an armored car of high-quality and a mansion with day and night surveillance. The property is necessary for protecting you from attacks and armed robberies, because there are greedy and evil people everywhere.

An expensive car will improve your safety, but not everyone will like the fact, that its value is higher than the average annual salary. In this case it will be more complicated to achieve a high position.

From an office worker and up to the president you can live in a dormitory, but then your security is in doubt because no one knows who lives next room. The head of the state shouldn’t risk, because it’s always a tragedy for a country to lose its leader. In your own mansion you can be unalarmed about your property and health. 

We have provided non-linear storyline through the base of players: everyone contributes to the development of the gaming universe, so it will be impossible to predict the end. 


Supergoals

We plan to develop the project, so if the demand for our project will be higher than we expect, we will embody:


Financing

To ensure the life of the project we need to attract about 1,000 people at the start. Only with the player base we can create conditions for an interesting and non-linear game. At any time the game remains conditionally command, and it requires much effort to win the trust of the first players. We understand that it’s strange to include the sum of money on advertising to our expenses, but without the involvement of people at the start we can not ensure the development of the universe, because it depends entirely on the players.

The first version of the game will be released in February 2016! 

Since a game at any time is command, we need to keep server capacity overnight. We have included it in the list of expenses for the first time.

The game is built in the genre of text quests to brighten it and compete with games with a nice picture - we need to do a lot of work on the visual part withprofessionals in this field.

We plan to attract players all over the world, and localization for 15 languages ​​is also included in the expenses.

We would like to spell out the necessary expenses to the penny, but we can count only approximately.


About team

We are a young team of developers. Our acquaintance happened 6 years ago. And even that time we have already been united by the idea to create our projects together. One needs much experience for ambitious projects. Over these years we have brushed up on our skills and become a close knit team. 

The idea to take on "Life of Politician" came a year ago. We wanted to create a gaming universe that will be developing under the laws of the players and in which every action affects the whole system.


Thank you!

We would be grateful if you tell your friends about our project. Our success depends on you!


Check our latest projects here!

Pixe 'em' All

Hi! My name is Sergey. I'm from Russia.
This is the Pixel Fodder, download it and try.
No so far i worked in huge audit company, and now i decide - **** em all! I want to make awesome GAMES!
I really love games! I huge fan of Cannon Fodder, Coretex Commander and other, and othe.
So. Now  - i making Pixe Fodder! It is a classic 8-bit platformer with a destructible world, large choice of characters and incredible dynamics. Use all the pixel force to eliminate the bad guys! 

Food & Games

Development takes really a lot of time. And i must to choose - build game, or look for a job. If you wish to see final version of the game - u can support me, i will buy a food, u will get cool game - fair :)

My target is 1900$ - it will another for a 3-5 month of deep game development. If i will focus on development - game will be ready in time.

If i dont entire goal - i'll keep game development. I will try anyway.


Whant to help?

Just download free version of Pixel Fodder for Android 

Vote on Greenlight 

Tell friends!

story:
Did you ever take the time to look back and wonder what it takes now a days to deliver the message of love and support? Is it a text message? An email? If you buy the occasional card, how long does it take you to select one? Is it a significant thought or is it something purchased on the run?

Our lives have greatly improved over the last decade... We're experiencing self driving cars, streaming movies out of thin air, video messaging between our smartphones, but when it comes to telling friends and loved ones how much we care about them on a physical card, we're constantly limited to just the few preassigned lines of text placed on a stock card... that shouldn't be 'enough' to convey our important message, nor should we settle for that just because it's viewed as a standard. It's time to revolutionize the card!

What makes Cloud Cards even more unique? The greeting card turns into a digital picture frame that will last forever. Update it from your smartphone via the wireless adapter at anytime with new pictures or videos. Keep the battery charged or the card plugged into an outlet for endless memories.

The innovation of Cloud Cards and quality of work is definitely something to talk about... and the word is spreading fast! Cloud Cards are featured on these networks, their affiliates and many other publications. 


 
What makes this campaign stress free for us is the fact that our creative process isn't just a theory with hopes and dreams of manifesting into reality. The manufacturing of the card is complete - and it's a success. Cloud Cards are ready NOW. They are FCC/CE/RoHs compliant and are imminent to hold a patent for their uniqueness in hardware & software operation. 



In a world governed by the need of instant gratification and more importantly easement in functionality, Cloud Cards seem to have the simplest answer:

  • Our Cards are manufactured with built-in wireless adapter for data transfers. It allows instant connection to the smartphone device with your stored video recording and animation, so it can be transferred to the card. No internet or data usage is required for video upload. Talk about ease of access.
  • With just a couple of clicks on your smartphone you can start recording your message of love and support via our free app.
  • Customize your card even further by easily selecting one of our high end animations to really wow your recipient. 
  • That's it. You're done. Sign it, put it in an envelope and watch the jaw drop!
  • The card is fully rechargeable and can last for years.
  • The sleek, traditional design of the card is about the same thickness or thinner than majority of the 'musical' cards available on the market today.
  • The perforated edge of the card allows for conversion of your gift into a lasting digital photo frame, that your recipient can update with new data at their convenience.
  • For those of our customers, sentimental to the traditional ways of the card, please note that the inside of Cloud Cards is left unfiltered, so hand written additions are supported, not to mention encouraged. 



The different designs and countless animations that are available with all Cloud Cards are created by students across the country (US) and purchased by Cloud Cards in support of their education and hard work. Each published contributor is given full credit directly on the card for their hard work and can use this opportunity to build up their creative portfolio. We believe in helping others, from all walks of life. That's why we are involved in many social and community projects that in the future will be tied directly to retail profits of Cloud Cards: 

  • Our immediate goal is to start working with as many schools and universities in the United States as we can. We'd like to extend our contributors program to students looking to test their skill and add Cloud Cards as their additional source of income, helping them offset the ever rising cost of education.
  • Our community projects will encourage each of our membership based users to help support a charity of their choice. Partial proceeds from our retail and online sales will be matched with our members donations for a stronger impact. 

  • We are also striving to become the most environmentally friendly option for the Greeting Card Industry. The company is creating a recycling program for our products that pays for the return of no longer used cards, instead of discarding them into trash. Almost 85% of a Cloud Card can be refurbished and reused through this program.


Right now, we are turning to you, for help reaching our startup goal. It's important to understand that our campaign is not about bringing a concept to life. This capital is intended to cover the costs of further research and development of the Cloud Cards app - on all platforms. It is intended to help us cut down manufacturing cost and pass all savings on the customer. It will help get our company up and running and most importantly, it will contribute to the development of our Recycling Project, to encourage our customers to recycle their cloud cards for credit, instead of disposing them onto landfills.


Just as smartphones and fast computers have become something that we expect and not something that we ogle, so too will Cloud Cards in time. Let’s bring our message of support into the future. It's been a long time waiting.

We understand not everyone has the desire to order products online, or maybe is not set on the structure of our perks... Please accept our gratitude for stopping by and giving us the time of day, and if you have it in you... Please use the social media buttons included on here to help us spread the word. We can't make this all that it could be without your help. We hope you can join us!

story:
"Hey, Look up!" is an all-new type of mission based endless runner game about "Text-walkers".

In "Hey, Look up!" you can control them but make sure to avoid collision with other text-walkers and street obstacles.

Now try this...in order to unlock characters or climb the leaderboard, first you have to collect FOLLOWERS....and how do you do that? No...you cannot buy them with the coins or gems you would find on the street. :) You have to work hard to earn your followers by
-taking as many Instagram SELFIES as you can #duckface4ever
-sending Twitter TWEETS until your finger bleeds
-and shoot YouTube VIDEOS like there is no 2morrow
...and that is how you became VIRTUALLY FAMOUS!
#heylookup

Where shall we start?
How about in the middle of the city. Yeah,...that will be nice :)

Your goal is to complete missions while collecting followers.
More missions you complete more NEW locations you unlock. Like the TUBE map.


Keep on completing missions to UNLOCK the BEACH map.

Three maps is good but five (or more) would be better. Your support will allow us to create more maps (mall, airport...etc).

We didn't want to make a game where you would collect bunch of coins, stars, gems or even bananas lying around on the streets. We wanted something more original than that. The subject of the game gave us the answer. As you play as a text-walker you will have to collect FOLLOWERS in the game. And, you do that in the same way you would in real life...by building up your SOCIAL NETWORKS.

There will be three main ways to build your social networks and GAIN FOLLOWERS.

Once you collected a "Power-up", better be ready because you have got only couple of seconds to take the Instagram selfies, send the Twitter tweets or pack action into your YouTube video.




Meet Jesse:
Jesse just arrived to the city. She has got a lot of catching up to do...but don't worry about her. She is a smart girl with a smart-phone.
And, that is all she needs to become VIRTUALLY FAMOUS. :)


Meet Stone:
Stone is a celebrity. Already has got thousands of followers and counting. He needs to say fit and strong to live up to his name. This take a lot of discipline, exercise and protein :)
He is on the way to the gym for the 3rd time today...and this has to go up on to his Instagram.


Meet Nina:
Nina is a lead singer of a Thai rock-band. They are just about to release their very first album. She must use every opportunity to satisfy the fans by taking lots of selfies and keep them up to date with Twitter tweets wherever she goes...


Meet Stu:
Stu is ...as you probably noticed a "geek". You could never guess who is his favorite TV-show character :)
He is going to the Comic-Con dressed just like him.
This is an event he must share with his cyber friends.


Meet Sabrina:
Sabrina is coming from a very wealthy family. Her dad owns the world most famous hotel chain. She has got thousands of followers. Not because of her family...but because of her sense of fashion. However this requires day and night  tweeting and sharing selfies.



You're probably thinking: "Why this game doesn't come out on PC, Linux or at least Mac"? The game originally has been designed for mobiles, tablets and it delivers the best experience when players are using their fingers to control characters.


One of the words you could describe our team is "small". That is correct. We knew this from the very beginning. However that could never stop us to create "Hey, Look up!" the way it looks today. We are very passionate about the game and have got everything we need to create something truly AMAZING. We all proud to "Think different" :) and to be DRAGONS. However,...reaching our stretch goals means that we will have more dragons joining the team :)
























Risks & Challenges

Although Draco Intra is an unheard of studio, we have the utmost confidence in our vision. Also, we've built a highly experienced team that can work through every obstacle.
That being said, game development comes with inevitable speedbumps including surprise costs and delays.
Our biggest challenge will be to port the game to lots of different platforms and reach new audiences. A challenge we cannot wait to face.

Please help us to spread the word and use Indiegogo social sharing tools.

Thank you :)

story:
The Elements Story

Summer is the CEO of Everyday Games, LLC. She is a former Executive Director of both an adult literacy and a family literacy program. Her familiarity with the struggles of people who cannot read fluently is one of the reasons she started her game company.  She hopes that children will begin to learn math and reading skills at an early age, in part, by playing board games with their family members. 

Summer operates the firm with her nine-year old granddaughter, Amara.  The two began playing games when Amara was two.  Because Amara couldn’t read yet, they created new rules for the games that Amara found in her grandmother’s toy chest.  Creating their own versions of established games, led to the decision to create their own game and finally, a game company.  Elements© is their first game, due to be released in late fall of 2016.

Our Campaign

In this day of RPG’s and video games, you’re probably wondering why a board game?  Gaming is a tough market to crack with lots of new game designers entering the field.  So why are we going so low tech?

Remember your favorite board game?  Chances are it’s one of our favorites as well.  You probably remembered hot, lazy summer days playing a board game with a friend. If you were lucky, maybe you played with a parent.  Everyday Games is trying to recreate those moments of building memories.  If you hadn’t had a board game in your life at an early age, you probably wouldn’t be interested in games as an adult.

Elements© is a board game for up to 5 preschoolers, aged 2-5.  There are not many games made specifically for preschoolers, who can’t read and play more complicated games.  Our game is quick to play, less than five minutes, for busy parents, and easy to play, for the preschoolers.  Players will learn beginning math skills such as sorting and shapes as well as colors.

Children learn so much from games, beyond basic literacy skills.  They learn to take turns, and to accept rewards and consequences, a skill that is difficult for many adults.  While playing, kids can learn to follow directions and cooperate with others.  The bonus is that through play, they are learning to be social and interact with others, a skill that is not exercised while playing solo video games.

You have the opportunity to help us create a beautifully illustrated game that not only teaching beginning math skills, but helps families create memories.

How Elements© is Played

Your child will love Elements©,  as it is quick and easy to learn and to play!  You as a parent, will love how quickly a game is played.  It's the perfect choice for busy parents who still want one-on-one time with their favorite adventurer.

Players select a color from the board.  Remove only the shape cards that relate to those colors.  Shuffle the cards and place face down on the table.  Select a little adventurer player to go first.  The player selects a card and matches it to the same color and shape of an object on the board.  When he has placed his card correctly, it is the next player's turn to select, match and place his card.  Play continues until a player completes a row of shapes in his color, and wins the game.  Wild cards can be played on any shape to help a player complete a row faster, and win. 

Elements© features alternate ways to play.  A single child can play the game alone.  Players can also complete a column of shapes instead of rows. 

Elements© has a bonus matching game, with illustrations by Sherry Neidigh, a children's book illustrator, included!

Risks and Challenges

All of our pre-production costs are paid for, including the beautiful illustration of our game board.  We have the marketing and management background and skills to successfully market Elements©.

We have selected a manufacturer that requires a small initial printing of 1,000 games, to keep our manufacturing costs low.  The game concept is simple, with low cost game pieces.  The game is ready to be sent to the printer, with manufacturing to be completed before the end of the year.

We hope you will help us achieve our goal of fully funding Elements© and maybe play it with your child soon.

Other Ways You Can Help

Amara and I would love to have your financial support.  We’ve made our levels small enough ($1.00) so every our youngest friends can participate. We understand if you can’t help us financially at this time.  But don’t despair, you can still help!  Whether or not you can donate today, sharing our page is an important way for our Elements© Game campaign to become fully funded. Here are a few ways that you can help us spread the word:

Get talking!  Word of mouth is still one of the best ways to get the word out.  Talk to your coworkers, friends, relatives and neighbors.  Let them join in the excitement as our campaign builds to successfully and fully funded.

Share!  Use all of your social media outlets to help us spread the word.  Challenge yourself to use as many outlets as you can.  Like us on Facebook and share it with all of your contacts, and ask them to share our campaign with their contacts.  Get the Tweets out.

Write about us!  Unleash your inner blogger.  Talk about your fond memories of playing games as a child or your favorite board game and include our link on your blog.  If you have contacts in the media, feel free to share our story.

We're so grateful for your help!

Amara and I are so glad you took the time to learn more about our campaign.  We hope to see Elements© in your local toy stores soon.  Thanks so much for your support!

Elements© 2015

story:
Hey there Indiegogo  , we are team of Boldo McDoldo. We are a group of five people whose goal is to make the best arcade game you’ve ever seen. Everyone has their own job and responsibilities. We have two great artists, two scenario authors and a fantastic technical producer.  



Artists

As we mentioned we have two talented and young artists. Their names are Ardis and Ralph. Ardis is  not only a good friend and a funny guy ,but  a precise and accurate drawer. And then there is Ralph, he comes up with creative and crazy ideas that lead to  original artworks. And together they are an excellent duo.


Technical producer

This job is  responsible, not everyone can take the weight on their shoulders. And luckily we have a great and responsible guy who can do all the work by himself. His name is Matiss. He films and edits our videos, is responsible for the social media, websites.Overall a great person to work with.


Scenario authors


Now it’s time to introduce ourselves, the persons behind the text. Our names are  Kristaps and Eddie. Our job is to prepare speeches, game storylines and video scenarios. Although our job is responsible and not easy at all, we spend a great time preparing them. We correct each others mistakes so the scenario becomes as good as possibe.



 Keep in mind that our group contains people from -  15-17 years old students, but there are good persons that help us  bring our game to life.

  Eva a woman who found our idea interesting when everybody else called us fools. If  not her we wouldn't be writing to you right now . She was the one who told us about indiegogo, she’s the one who  runs the campaign. The other person, Vladimir is the programmer who saw a potential and believed in us. Help us to show that he wasn’t wrong!


Have you ever wondered how hard a life of a clown can be? Well we did. It all started with a trip to thecircus. It was an usual, great performance, nobody expected that something would go wrong, but suddenly,the clown who was trying to walk on a rope high above the ground, unexpectedly started to sway. The clownfell in the peak of the performance ,it  was ruined in matter of seconds. Instead of help and support he gotbooed off stage. And at this moment we understood how terrible can a life of a clown really be.  We want to create this game so no other clown would have to go through these shameful series of events.The goal of the game is to help Boldo get from the blasting point to the ending platform. Now it may soundeasy but there will be a lot of obstacles set for him to make the performance more interesting. In the start ofevery level there will be certain amount of different props you can use to make a course easier for him. Atthe end of the level you will receive a certain amount of score points which will be based on the amount ofprops used. He started as a simple clown, performing in countryside, after every successful performance hemoved on to performing in huge city circuses.After every finished performance, the clown Boldo McDoldo was introduced to a larger  portion of crowd and fame.


It takes more than just an idea to create an awesome arcade game. There are the game developers, graphic artists, animators, voice over talent, editors and unfortunately that doesn't come for free that's why we need YOU!

Every cent donated will help the production of the game and all of the money goes directly into the game development and the awesome perks you get for helping us out. As we mentioned every cent and penny helps the process. We know that there are people that can’t help financially but you can always tell your friends and spread the idea to the world, every little thing helps. We’re not doing this to become rich and earn a lot of money, our main goal is to create an awesome arcade game for you guys.




Donating 10$ you get - Boldo McDoldo background and special thanks by e-mail.

Donating 24$ you get - Free game + Exclusive skin (type 1 - changes clowns outfit) .

Donating 51$ you get - Free game + exclusive skin ( type 2 - changes clowns outfit and cannon).

Donatin 77$ you get - Free game + exclusive skin (  Type 3 - changes clowns outfit, cannon and particle effects ).

Donating 101$ you get - Get free game + special donators level pack + previous perks. 

Donating 202$ you get - Boldos special design card deck + previous perks.

including previous.

Donating 500$ you get - 100cm x 60cm Boldos poster signed especially for you by us + all previous perks + previous perks.

Donating 1000$ you get - Design your own skin that will be in-game later on. Everyone else will be able to buy it in game's store! + previous perks

Donating 3500$ you get - Big, stuffed Boldo McDoldo toy  with your name on it + signature. + previous perks

Donating 10000$ you get - Get a chance to visit Boldos native country (Riga/Latvia). You will get :

-Return ticket

-1 night in hotel (⋆⋆⋆⋆)

-Taste latvian traditional food with us.

-And one more surprise ...



Nowadays, it’s hard to find a genre of game that doesn't exist, but we want to give it a try we want to create a game with unseen gameplay mechanics.

Make sure to follow us on social networks and visit our website:

https://www.twitter.com/boldomcdoldo

https://www.facebook.com/boldomcdoldo2015

http://www.boldomcdoldo.com/

story:
Our Dream is to Release this New Sci-Fi Action Adventure RPG: NeonStar ~ Battle for RiftVerse!
(For Oculus Rift VR)

NeonStar has been in production for 4 years by solo developer Kris Bux, with help from friends in India and Tokyo, Japan.

We are aiming to complete a new sci-fi action/adventure video game - set for release in 2015

NeonStar is...

NeonStar is 3 games in one,  You star as the main character, and can:

+ go on quests, explore and battle (first person shooter mode)
+ race 'hover cars' (race mode)
+ and fly (space-navi mode)

We need you to help us speed up the games completion!
The game is part RPG, part action/adventure where the goal is to acquire the ultimate power: Time Travel!


'NeonStar' for regular PC/Mac gamers is being made by Kris Bux (the Toronto, Canada "team" with our tiny mailbox office 'HollywoodGames'), and three designer friends I met in Tokyo, Japan 3 years ago.  The 'NeonStar VR' part is being built by Ronak and his awesome team, working for free in India. We love the VR, CG, Anime and Sci-Fi, and want to share our passion with you!

Our goal is simple: Get our upcoming game demo 'NeonStar' with an Oculus Rift component so gamers can experience it in Virtual Reality as 'NeonStarVR'!

You'll be supporting the VR version, and help push forward the actual game completion as well! And for that we want to give you the best perks we can: getting the VR game at 50% off!, or being an Official NeonStar Oculus-Rift Beta-Tester!


Games' Story:

NeonStar is an epic tale of YOU - fighting for control of the city, the world and RiftVerse! 
Choose a faction: either the Cell (militia), or the Lek (dark enforcers)!

Build up your characters arsenal of weapons, gadgets and skills:


In NeonStar, you can get missions at the local cafe:

There is also an 'explore' mode where you can visit clubs, shops, talk with characters to get insight into the 'Battle for RiftVerse' and more!

Jump into a hover car, chase your enemies and bring them down:


With weapon mods and custom skins, Fly the NeonStar Ship through massive DM-12 City or into space:



BIGGEST PERK:

Get the Game & Oculus Rift!

Get NeonStarVR ~ built with Oculus Rift and VR! Join or development team, we will send you a Brand New Oculus Rift SDK2 and Official NeonStar Beta Testers Kit and Question Sheet.  Test out the game, send us your feedback, and enjoy a true 360° Cinematic Sci-Fi CG/Anime Game world!

Sample of Flight perspective:

Sample of Racing and 3rd Person View:

Sample of 'Explore' and First Person View:



Campaign Goal:

The Main Goal is Simple: $350 for Oculus Rift SDK2 (We have the old SDK1)
Second Simple Goal: Speed up VR production of the game with an Extra $1150 for the extra programming work,design and extra characters.

Again we just need to order the Oculus Rift SDK2 ($350) and ideally: hire a second programmer ($350), an Interface designer ($375), a 3-D character modeler ($425).


Who we are:

  • Kris Bux – A game developer and has been developing NeonStar for almost 4 years mainly by himself

  • A small team of Programmers and Designers in India who are working for free until we get funding ~Update: They just got a big contract - so are unavailable for now :(

  • A Product Designer and another Designer both from Tokyo helping Kris with object modeling and products

Risks/Challenges:

The biggest risk is not getting the game finished ever, after 4 years of blood, sweat and tears.

  • If we can't release the VR Version we will try to release the regular PC and Mac version next year, as an Indie Developer - We want to give you the game now though

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't select a perk right now, then keep in touch, and Sign Up for the Beta!
  • Sign-Up for the Beta Test at: http://myuniverz.com/ns_signup.php
  • Like, Follow, and tell your friends! http://facebook.com/NeonStar.Official
  • Check out the Blog and Site at: http://NeonStar.tv
  • ...and Share this via IndieGoGo's tools to send this to friends that want to be a Game Character or Try Oculus Rift!



We Can't Wait to Show You!

We can't wait to show you this awesome Cinematic Sci-Fi CG/Anime Game, so Grab the VR Testers Kit, so we can launch NeonStar ~ Battle for RiftVerse in Virtual Reality!
