Hacker Experience 2 is a massively multiplayer real time hacking simulation. You play the role of a hacker living in a dystopian world controlled by megacorps.

The game brings location-based strategy to a persistent virtual open world enduring a digital war. Claim and guard your territory against hackers and factions.

Hack servers, eavesdrop connections, upgrade hardware, research software, steal bank accounts, install viruses. All while trying not to be traced by the FBI - or others.

A virtual world just like ours

Hacker Experience 2 is based on a virtual reality of our worldwith thousands of simulated entities. They are persistent virtual citizens living around virtual buildings.

Virtual citizens have name, home, family, job, bank account and even criminal records. Best part of all, they are hackable. Turn them into a millionaire overnight, or frame and jail them.

Thanks to data from OpenStreetMap, we have virtual buildings located exactly where they really are. Think hotels, business, banks, parks, schools and more. And of course they are hackable :-)

You can interact with buildings to hack the world around you! For example, the City Hall and prison may contain valuable data about virtual citizens from that city.

Mind-blowing missions

Get paid to do dirty jobs for the megacorps. Join lonewolf or team missions of industrial espionage, sabotage, capture-the-flag and many others.

Frame virtual citizens or fellow hackers for fun and profit. Watch them get caught on an international news system.

Access the Deep Web and join a wild PvP world of user-generated missions.

Tailored gameplay

Hacker Experience 2 offers a profound and endless gameplay with several ramifications tailored by your character's decisions.

Choose your strategy: attack all the way, fortify yourself and counter-attack or be stealthy and cover your tracks. There are special game modes for each one.

Play good cop/bad cop or, in this world, be a white hat or black hat hacker. Fight the system or play by the rules. Your actions shape your honor, and the game is presented to you accordingly.

Dominate your city

Gather influence over your block, city or country. Every remote action rewards you influence at the location it happened. Become the best hacker in your region.

Engage into massive factions war

Form alliances and develop your own team strategy. Engage into exciting wars against multiple factions to conquer new territories and assert your power.

Moving targets

Play from your WP/iOS/Android phone and use mobility as your strategy. While connected, your server is mapped in real time to your location and you can hunt nearby targets or access local missions.

Another source of mobile attacks are virtual drones. Buy one and point them to a location to scan for targets. But if someone hacks the drone they might trace you!

Play on your terminal

Play natively on your own terminal with CLI, shell and ncurses-based interfaces. Use the tools you already love - awk, sed, grep and pipe - for blazingly fast actions.

Play it over MOSH, SSH or, dare I say, telnet.

The above image is from a library from Yaron Naveh with the purpose of creating terminal-like interfaces. It is NOT part of the game, but a prototype terminal would be very similar to the one above, and we'll likely use this library.

Create your own world

Customize the interface shown to you. Try user-uploaded or official modifications in a click.

Matrix theme


Tron theme

Both designs above are part of Patricio's work for Mapzen.

Customizing is dead easy

Really. With Tangram's Play, you can do it interactively.

Computer Science education

We want to spread Computer Science education to young students around the world, with the ultimate goal of getting them interested in Computer Science.

Within the game

Within the game, non-technical players get gradually introduced to concepts of computer networks, operating systems and security.

By exploiting unsecure connections and seeing how virtual citizen's data is fragile, we hope to show how our own privacy is at risk. We try to encourage the use of VPN, proxies, encryption and secure connections. The FBI will probably hate us for that.

In the future we plan to launch a special version/modification to bring programming languages to the game. The player would be able to extend his software, automate tasks and engage into "coding wars". And of course, learn while having fun.

And outside it

Back to the real world, we aim to motivate non-technical players and students to contribute for the first time with projects like Let's build a game.

Having the opportunity to submit a small improvement to a game that person actually plays can have a tremendous effect. Seeing the change being rolled out to others brings a great feeling that, we hope, will motivate further contributions.

We believe this practical experience will get more students interested in Computer Science, computer programming and open source projects.

A game for everyone

We want to create a game for everyone, including those with disabilities. With help from the community, we plan to develop special interfaces crafted for them.

Ultimately, we want to provide HE2 to people like Jemil and James.

See more

Find out more about the principles and objectives that powers HE2 development.

Free and open source software

Hacker Experience 2 is a free and open source software being developed openly. This means the entire codebase that powers HE2 is public. As the user, you have the freedom to run, copy, distribute, study, change and improve the software.

Take action!

We are more than happy to welcome community contributions. Ever dreamed of making a game? Now you have no excuses, come with us ;-)

This is also a great opportunity for you to take the first step on programming. It's not that hard, and with some motivation and help from the community, you can definitely do it! Simply choose what you enjoy doing and follow our resources.

Let's build a game

Contributing to a project tends to be hard and intimidating, specially for first-time contributors. Let's build a game tries to change that reality.

Helping an open project shouldn't be hard. And it shouldn't be exclusive to geeks.

Visit Let's build a game for detailed instructions on how you can help, no matter which skills you have. Help us translate, test, develop and launch HE2!

You!

The most amazing person in our team is you. Come build HE2 with us!

This is a tentative timeline. You can see it in more details at https://letsbuildagame.org

The breakdown below includes the bare minimum of all expenses required to the final game release.

* Indiegogo's fees are approximate and may be more or less depending on a few factors. We also have no idea how much taxes we have to pay, so 10% is a rough estimation and we could be way off here.

Game development expenses

Take a look at the chart below for a breakdown of the game development expenses, which totals 65% of the raised amount. We'd like to invest 100% in it, but unfortunately there are taxes and other expenses that we must pay for.

* If we hit the goal, we plan to hire at least one person to help on each of these tasks. This additional help is required to meet the expected schedule (Q4 2016).

Monthly expenses report

Our team looks forward to total transparency. We will share each month how we are using the money raised here, with a detailed expenses breakdown.

For our own safety, we won't share publicly how much each developer earns. Instead, we'll report the total sum of wages.

Democratic & open development

Hacker Experience 2 is an open game, and you have a say on what it becomes. Vote for or against new features or decisions in the game-making process. Learn more about our contribution & voting guidelines.


Here's an easy way to figure out what you'd receive based on your contribution.

We are committed to implementing all of the following features as the game development progresses, however this could take years. If we manage to meet the goal requirements, we'll work hard to include these features with the public game release, scheduled to December 2016.

The price gap between one goal and the next one is the amount we feel is required in order to fully develop, test and release that feature.

Schedule & delays

One of the biggest challenges any software project faces are delays, and its no different for us. We ourselves made a few time estimation mistakes in the past, but we've learned our lesson.

The way we plan to minimize the chances of having the project delayed is, among other alternatives, to be very specific about features and project scope, define the right success metrics and have constant feedback between developers and users.

Software quality

Having a below-expectations release is common among software, and handing you a low-quality game is the last thing we want.

The previous mitigation techniques described previously also apply for software quality. Constant feedback with the community is key here. An additional factor here is developer quality. And even though we are young, we are confident that our knowledge is more than enough to develop and manage a project of this size.

Open source trumps them all

Hacker Experience 2 is being developed in the open. You can see what we are working on, and the actual code that is being written. This increases overall confidence and allows for constant feedback between players, contributors and developers, a key aspect on mitigating all those risks.

The open license of Hacker Experience 2 gives you an additional benefit. If we fail to deliver the project, for whatever reason, the community can pick up from where we left off and finish it. Rest assured that's not something we plan for, but it is good to know that the worst-case scenario isn't total loss.

How to participate

Tracking your referrals

There is an easy way to know how you are doing with the referrals. On the top right of Indiegogo's website, click on your name, then My Profile and then on referrals.

Now you will be able to see your current referral status, including how many people backed the project through your link, and the total contributed funds.

Terms

  1. Self-referral is not allowed.
  2. Refunded pre-orders will not count towards total referred amount.
  3. This referral program and contest closes when the Indiegogo campaign ends.
  4. You are not allowed to divide by zero.

Notes

  • Make sure you are logged in to your Indiegogo account when generating the link, otherwise there is no way to link the referral to you.
  • Share and spread the word, but don't spam. Everyone hates that.
  • Don't worry, a new referral program will be launched after the campaign ends.
  • Good luck!

Below is a list of common questions. If you are still uncertain about something, don't hesitate to shoot us an email at contact@hackerexperience.com.

I'd tell you to call us but we are socially awkward and run away from ringing phones.

    General

  1. Do I need to have any technical knowledge in order to play HE2?
    2. No. Hacker Experience 2 is designed from scratch to be an inclusive game. You don't need any specific knowledge about computers, and you will end up learning some stuff about them.
  2. Is it illegal? Am I hacking real servers?
    3. No. The whole game is virtual and you will be hacking "made up" servers from other players.
  3. What will I learn while playing HE2?
    4. You will grasp concepts of computer networks, operating systems and computer security. Stuff like VPN, Proxy, HTTPS, DNS and encryption won't have an obscure meaning anymore. By eavesdropping data from virtual people, you will probably get more worried about your real privacy. You won't learn how to hack a computer in real life.
  4. Can you hack this facebook account? Pretty please?
    5. No, we can't. And this is a frequent question. Sigh.
  5. What are the main game features?
    6. This is quite an answer. Please visit hackerexperience.com for the full set of features.
  6. Will the game be translated to other languages?
    7. Yes. We will provide official support for English and Portuguese, and we welcome community translations. If you want to help us translate the game to your language, or improve existing translations, please visit letsbuildagame.org for more information.
  7. Is Hacker Experience 2 a "pay-to-win" game?
    8. No, and it will never be. Everyone plays by the same rules, with strategy, tactics and skill being the game-defining factors. It is possible to buy custom themes for the game, but nothing that provides tactical advantages over others.
  8. What is HEOnline?
    9. HEOnline is the official game server provided by Neoart Labs, the company sponsoring Hacker Experience. It allows you to play online against thousands of other players.
  9. Is HEOnline subscription based?
    10. You can choose whichever is best for you: pay monthly or only once for your HEOnline account.
  10. How much does HEOnline cost?
    11. For the final release we expect to have a monthly subscription of $5 and a lifetime account for $30. Prices may vary slightly if we have unexpected servers and taxes expenses (or savings). Preorder and crowdfunding prices are much lower given the risk and early access factors.
  11. Can I get an HEOnline account for free?
    12. Yes. We are quite generous to contributors, so a nice way to get an HEOnline account for free is by helping us build HE2. Sounds a great deal, right? Check letsbuildagame.org for more information on how you can help. We also plan to add "play-to-pay" in the future. This means you can extend your subscription by paying in-game money.

    Development

  12. Can I help with HE2 development?
    13. Yes, please! You can help even if you have no idea how a computer works. Please visit letsbuildagame.org for more information.
  13. What is "Let's build a game"?
    14. Let's Build a Game is a project to bring collaborators and players together to work on creating a collaborative game. We want to provide a low barrier to entry project for first-time contributors. Please visit letsbuildagame.org for more information.
  14. What programming languages do you use in HE2?
    15. HE2 is made of several different software, which include languages like Elixir, Python, Ruby, Elm, F#, Bash and PL/pgSQL. We also rely on tools like Postgres, PostGIS, Mapserver, nginx, Elasticsearch, Mnesia, Apache Kafka, Apache Samza, Docker, Aerospike and many others.
  15. What is HE2 software license?
    16. HE2 is made of several software. The core (server) and all client interfaces are released under the AGPLv3 license. All supporting libraries created by us are either MIT or MPL-licensed.
  16. Is HE2 a free software?
    17. Yes, HE2 is a free software, as defined by the Free Software Foundation (FSF). You have the freedom to run, copy, distribute, study, change and improve the software. Please notice that the free in "free software" means freedom, not necessarily gratis.
  17. Is it possible to play HE2 for free?
    18. Yes, you can play HE2 without paying a dime. In order to be able to play for free, you must host the server software yourself. It's not as technically challenging as it seems, and we are still here to help you :) However, it does require a relatively powerful computer. As an alternative, you can use HEOnline to play against thousands of other players without worrying about setup.

    Crowdfunding

  18. Why flexible funding?
    19. Reaching the funding goal is great because it allow us to hire additional people and provide a higher-quality game under a tight schedule. However, we are working openly on Hacker Experience 2 and have plans to keep doing so even if the campaign fails. In that case, it would mean it will take longer to finish the game, but it won't stop us from working on it. Therefore, an all-or-nothing funding isn't the best alternative, since the "nothing" part is not an option for us :-)
  19. Why $50,000? Why not more, or less?
    20. We feel the $50,000 goal is a balanced option that gives our team enough stability to keep working full time on HE2. It also allow us to hire additional people to help us meet the expected schedule. Less money is able to keep our current team working on the game, but not to hire new people. This delays the project, but it still exists, hence flexible funding. More money gives us more security about the schedule and game quality. It would be great, but it is not essential.
  20. Why don't you offer physical rewards?
    21. We are a small team with an already busy schedule. We believe it's better to focus on actually building HE2 instead of having shipping and production headaches. Though we agree swag merchandise would be awesome...

    Systems Requirements

  21. Does it run on... ?
    22. Yes! Ubiquity is one of the principles that powers the game. You can run it on your Windows, Mac or Linux operating system. You can also play it on most modern browsers. A native app is coming for WP, iOS and Android devices. You can even play it over telnet! In the future we want to support a wider set of systems, including VR gear and videogame consoles.
  22. What are the hardware requirements?
    23. It's too soon to tell with accuracy the final hardware requirements, but given that the entire game logic runs on the server, your computer will probably handle the game smoothly.
  23. How about iOS/Android versions?
    24. We still don't know for sure which versions will be supported :-(

    Hacker Experience 1 (Legacy)

  24. What is Hacker Experience 1?
    25. Hacker Experience 1 (HE1) is the first version of Hacker Experience, released in 2014. It currently has around 500,000 players and is quite addictive, according to some people. You can play it for free at legacy.hackerexperience.com.
  25. Will HE1 live alongside HE2?
    26. We have plans to support both versions. Once HE2 gets released, HE1 code will be made open source. We (Neoart Labs) will keep the servers running. We'll also assign to the project a couple of maintainers, who will accept community patches to fix bugs or release new features. Once HE1 gets open sourced we will remove all ads and premium will no longer exist.
  26. I have a premium account on HE1. Does it apply to HE2?
    27. Yes. If you bought a lifetime premium account on HE1, you will have a lifetime account on HE2 (HEOnline). If you bought 1 month of premium on HE1, you will have 1 month of HEOnline (HE2) subscription, and so on. This also applies to those who were awarded a premium account. Once HE2 gets released, if you still haven't received an access code, please send us an email.
  27. Can I use my HE1 account on HE2?
    28. No. Given the differences between both systems, you'd need to create a new account. We also can't guarantee that your HE1 username will be available on HE2.

        something, don't hesitate to shoot us an email at contact@hackerexperience.com.
      
I'd tell you to call us but we are socially awkward and run away from ringing phones.
      

General
Do I need to have any technical knowledge in order to play HE2?
              
No. Hacker Experience 2 is designed from scratch to be an inclusive game. You don't need any specific knowledge about computers, and you will end up learning some stuff about them.
Is it illegal? Am I hacking real servers?
              
No. The whole game is virtual and you will be hacking "made up" servers from other players.
What will I learn while playing HE2?
              
You will grasp concepts of computer networks, operating systems and computer security. Stuff like VPN, Proxy, HTTPS, DNS and encryption won't have an obscure meaning anymore. By eavesdropping data from virtual people, you will probably get more worried about your real privacy. You won't learn how to hack a computer in real life.
Can you hack this facebook account? Pretty please?
              
No, we can't. And this is a frequent question. Sigh.
What are the main game features?
              
This is quite an answer. Please visit hackerexperience.com for the full set of features.
Will the game be translated to other languages?
              
Yes. We will provide official support for English and Portuguese, and we welcome community translations. If you want to help us translate the game to your language, or improve existing translations, please visit letsbuildagame.org for more information.
Is Hacker Experience 2 a "pay-to-win" game?
              
No, and it will never be. Everyone plays by the same rules, with strategy, tactics and skill being the game-defining factors. It is possible to buy custom themes for the game, but nothing that provides tactical advantages over others.
What is HEOnline?
              
HEOnline is the official game server provided by Neoart Labs, the company sponsoring Hacker Experience. It allows you to play online against thousands of other players.
Is HEOnline subscription based?
              
You can choose whichever is best for you: pay monthly or only once for your HEOnline account.
How much does HEOnline cost?
              
For the final release we expect to have a monthly subscription of $5 and a lifetime account for $30. Prices may vary slightly if we have unexpected servers and taxes expenses (or savings). Preorder and crowdfunding prices are much lower given the risk and early access factors.
Can I get an HEOnline account for free?
              
Yes. We are quite generous to contributors, so a nice way to get an HEOnline account for free is by helping us build HE2. Sounds a great deal, right? Check letsbuildagame.org for more information on how you can help. We also plan to add "play-to-pay" in the future. This means you can extend your subscription by paying in-game money.
Development
Can I help with HE2 development?
              
Yes, please! You can help even if you have no idea how a computer works. Please visit letsbuildagame.org for more information.
What is "Let's build a game"?
              
Let's Build a Game is a project to bring collaborators and players together to work on creating a collaborative game. We want to provide a low barrier to entry project for first-time contributors. Please visit letsbuildagame.org for more information.
What programming languages do you use in HE2?
              
HE2 is made of several different software, which include languages like Elixir, Python, Ruby, Elm, F#, Bash and PL/pgSQL. We also rely on tools like Postgres, PostGIS, Mapserver, nginx, Elasticsearch, Mnesia, Apache Kafka, Apache Samza, Docker, Aerospike and many others.
What is HE2 software license?
              
HE2 is made of several software. The core (server) and all client interfaces are released under the AGPLv3 license. All supporting libraries created by us are either MIT or MPL-licensed.
Is HE2 a free software?
              
Yes, HE2 is a free software, as defined by the Free Software Foundation (FSF). You have the freedom to run, copy, distribute, study, change and improve the software. Please notice that the free in "free software" means freedom, not necessarily gratis.
Is it possible to play HE2 for free?
              
Yes, you can play HE2 without paying a dime. In order to be able to play for free, you must host the server software yourself. It's not as technically challenging as it seems, and we are still here to help you :) However, it does require a relatively powerful computer. As an alternative, you can use HEOnline to play against thousands of other players without worrying about setup.
Crowdfunding
Why flexible funding?
              
Reaching the funding goal is great because it allow us to hire additional people and provide a higher-quality game under a tight schedule. However, we are working openly on Hacker Experience 2 and have plans to keep doing so even if the campaign fails. In that case, it would mean it will take longer to finish the game, but it won't stop us from working on it. Therefore, an all-or-nothing funding isn't the best alternative, since the "nothing" part is not an option for us :-)
Why $50,000? Why not more, or less?
              
We feel the $50,000 goal is a balanced option that gives our team enough stability to keep working full time on HE2. It also allow us to hire additional people to help us meet the expected schedule. Less money is able to keep our current team working on the game, but not to hire new people. This delays the project, but it still exists, hence flexible funding. More money gives us more security about the schedule and game quality. It would be great, but it is not essential.
Why don't you offer physical rewards?
              
We are a small team with an already busy schedule. We believe it's better to focus on actually building HE2 instead of having shipping and production headaches. Though we agree swag merchandise would be awesome...
Systems Requirements
Does it run on... ?
              
Yes! Ubiquity is one of the principles that powers the game. You can run it on your Windows, Mac or Linux operating system. You can also play it on most modern browsers. A native app is coming for WP, iOS and Android devices. You can even play it over telnet! In the future we want to support a wider set of systems, including VR gear and videogame consoles.
What are the hardware requirements?
              
It's too soon to tell with accuracy the final hardware requirements, but given that the entire game logic runs on the server, your computer will probably handle the game smoothly.
How about iOS/Android versions?
              
We still don't know for sure which versions will be supported :-(
Hacker Experience 1 (Legacy)
What is Hacker Experience 1?
              
Hacker Experience 1 (HE1) is the first version of Hacker Experience, released in 2014. It currently has around 500,000 players and is quite addictive, according to some people. You can play it for free at legacy.hackerexperience.com.
Will HE1 live alongside HE2?
              
We have plans to support both versions. Once HE2 gets released, HE1 code will be made open source. We (Neoart Labs) will keep the servers running. We'll also assign to the project a couple of maintainers, who will accept community patches to fix bugs or release new features. Once HE1 gets open sourced we will remove all ads and premium will no longer exist.
I have a premium account on HE1. Does it apply to HE2?
              
Yes. If you bought a lifetime premium account on HE1, you will have a lifetime account on HE2 (HEOnline). If you bought 1 month of premium on HE1, you will have 1 month of HEOnline (HE2) subscription, and so on. This also applies to those who were awarded a premium account. Once HE2 gets released, if you still haven't received an access code, please send us an email.
Can I use my HE1 account on HE2?
              
No. Given the differences between both systems, you'd need to create a new account. We also can't guarantee that your HE1 username will be available on HE2.

story:
Overview

Koko Monsters is an action-based fitness RPG on mobile which encourages players to exercise regularly while being on an adventure. Available in both online and offline modes, players travel between real world locations and the virtual world of Koko Monsters to battle against monsters. Collect hundreds of monsters and form your dream team through training, evolution, and trading!

The Story

A portal in the world of Koko Monsters has opened up, allowing monsters to freely access the human world. However, not all monsters are friendly. As the protector of both realms, you must battle against destructive Boss Monsters and subdue them to bring peace again.

 


Your Character

Choose between 6 different characters to represent yourself.

Your character will differ in size based on the amount of exercise you complete in the real world. We're talking about sit-ups, push-ups, walking and running! Our game is able to track your exercise status (using a co-processor of your phone) and reward you accordingly.

So keep fit and your monsters will gain better stats! We currently have 4 designated exercises, but we are open to making changes to accommodate our players' preferences. 


The Monsters

Start off the game by selecting a starter monster, and begin to explore the real world and virtual world to complete missions. Through missions, you are able to capture and train monsters, and collect items. You can evolve your team using specific items.

There is over a hundred monsters to be discovered and captured. Each monster has its unique set of skills from one of 5 elements: Light, Fire, Water, Grass, and Dark.


The Virtual World


The Virtual World consists of 5 lands representing each of the 5 elements. In these lands, you can complete different missions to obtain monsters and items.


Our current story spans 3 chapters. In each chapter, you will explore the 5 lands, and complete 10 stages within each land.


Each stage will have at least 5 rounds of battle. You are able to catch or fight the monsters you encounter here. The shorter the time taken to complete each stage, the greater the rewards you gain. 

Battle Screens:


*** You are able to play in the virtual world without any network connection.

Bonus!

We have plans for a special Evil Land in the Virtual World. where more Boss monsters reside. However, depending on the funding outcome, we will decide on whether to release it in the upcoming version. 

* Below are screenshots of an older version of the game.


The Real World

Go on an epic adventure in the world you are most familiar with - your own! You are presented with a GPS map to explore cities and towns of where you live and even around the globe. Capture as many monsters as you can; certain monsters reside exclusively in the real world.



As you move around, you can click the Radar icon to scan your surroundings for monsters. Venture to interesting places, such as museums and monuments, where you can collect rare items.
Some monsters will only appear in certain places. For example, some Fire-type monsters appear only in tropical countries. 

Although you don't have to be physically present in most areas to encounter monsters (yes, you can search for monsters in France even while you are in Singapore!), our game requires you to be physically present in key areas, such as Golden Gate Bridge in San Francisco, to meet exotic monsters. You can also use the chance to convert your steps walked into precious coins in the game!

So remember to keep an eye out while travelling overseas!

Fitness

Our game on your mobile phone (iPhone/Android) can track your exercises such as Sit-ups, Push-ups and Running. In the training gym, you are able to train and increase your monsters' stats by doing the exercises. 

*Below are screenshots of an older version of the gym.



Also, as walking is a simple yet effective exercise, the game will be using the data of iPhone's co-processor or Android's Step Sensor to convert your steps into coins and experience points. 

(*Recommended to use iPhone 5s and above, Android Samsung S3 or Nexus for best performance in calculating your steps.)


How will your contributions be used? 


A majority of the initial $50,000 will go into developing the game, with the exception of the 8% we need to pay Indiegogo and PayPal, and 25% to fulfil merchandising rewards. We will be using the funds to complete other areas of production, such as creating assets, QA and localization.
After accounting for pre-production and ramp-up time, the full budget will support a spending rate of around $10,000/man-month - this includes employee salaries, benefits, office rent, utilities, equipment, legal costs, and all other business overhead. 

The Alpha Version

We began working on the alpha version of the game in Nov 2015. Between salaries for the core staff, art contracting, programming costs with core processor, we spent around USD 55,000 which was provided by an angel investor. 

With this amount of money, we made an abstract game idea more concrete for backers, but there is still a lot we’d like to accomplish in the final game that we weren’t able to do in this version:

  • Game balance
  • Creation of environments and characters
  • Music and sound effects
  • Animation of game assets, and skill effects
  • Social (PvP and Guild) features 

Staffing

We are a tiny team and we need all the help we can get to hire more programmers and artists to bring the game to completion.

Timeline


At Kookoo Studios, we not only build engaging mobile applications, but we are committed to advocating healthy lifestyles. We gamify fitness to make exercise a little less boring and a lot more fun!
Find out more about us and the apps we have created here!


Refer to the table below for a quick comparison!


Merchandise

(1) Avatar/ Monster Keychains (Sample)


* Standard Keychain: We select a starter monster or default avatar for you. 
* Custom Keychain: Any monster/avatar of your choice. You can decide on the monster/avatar after playing the game. For perks with Custom Avatar, you have the option to make it into a Keychain.
*We will send a catalogue to your email for your reference 
on the last day of the campaign (6/25/2016).


(2) Monster Plush Toys (Sample)

* Standard Plush Toy: Starter monster of your choice.
* Custom Plush Toy: Any monster of your choice. You can decide on the monster after playing the game.
*We will send a catalogue to your email for your reference 
on the last day of the campaign (6/25/2016).

(3) T-Shirt (Kookoo Studios / Custom)For Backers with Kookoo Studios T-Shirt reward, kindly indicate your preferred size (in your country measurement), and design preference. 
Top Row: Black Design 1, White Design 1
Bottom Row: Black Design 2, White Design 2

* Custom T-Shirt: Print a monster/avatar of your choice on the shirt. You can decide on the monster/avatar after playing the game. For perks with Custom Avatar, you can choose to print it on the T-shirt.
*We will send a catalogue to your email for your reference
on the last day of the campaign (6/25/2016). 

Once you have indicate your preference of the Keychain and/or T-shirt and/or Plush Toy, starting from 6/25/2016, they will be shipped to you within 1 month.
*We have found a sponsor for the shipping fees, so don't worry about that :)


In-game Rewards

(4) Gems

Gems are premium in-game currency that a player has to purchase using real world money. Gems can be used to buy premium in-game items such increasing chance rates of encountering rare monsters, drawing premium eggs or unlocking extra features, such as inventory space. ( 10 gems is equivalent to $0.99.)


(5) VIP Status

Our VIP Program rewards gem spenders by offering them exclusive perks of the game that is only available to VIP members. It is an accumulative system whereby it tracks the gems expenditure of a player and rewards them according to the VIP Tier they belong to. Each subsequent level gets the player more perks such as reducing energy refill time, increase of number of coins and crystals awarded daily, increase of storage and bag capacity, and more!


(6) In Game Rewards - Avatar/Monster

* In-Game Custom Avatar:  Get yourself featured in our game! - Send us a photo,  and we will design a customized Avatar specially for you! 

* In-Game Starter Monster: Get all 3 Starter Monsters instantly in the game, and they will auto-evolve without using any items! (Note: Support Tier contributors will only get 3 starter monsters, without the auto-evolve function.)


(7) Exclusive Custom Monster (Sample)


Tell us what kind of monsters you prefer, the element of the monster, colour preference, and  name of the monster. For e.g. Unicorn, Fire Type, Red, Uniclaus.
 Feel free to send a sketch to us as well! Note that the monsters we design will have to fit into our game. We will design your monster and deliver it to your game inbox. Estimated delivery: 2-4 weeks after the game has been launched. 

* Country Monster: We'll design a custom Country monster for you - even after trading away this monster, you'll always retain an Egg of it.
* Global Monster: We'll design a custom Global monster for you - even after trading away this monster, you'll always retain an Egg of it.


Perks

$5 Toe-Dipper
Show your support, and we'll give you a set of beautiful wallpapers to decorate your desktop with,
75 Gems, and VIP Level 1 (benefits vary according to VIP level).

$15 Donor
Get 1 Set of Desktop Wallpapers,
1 Standard Keychain (we will pick a random Starter Monster/Avatar for you),
200 Gems, and VIP Level 1 (benefits vary according to VIP level).

1 Standard Keychain (pick a Starter Monster/ Avatar of your choice),
 1 T-Shirt (Kookoo Studios),
400 Gems, and VIP Level 2 (benefits vary according to VIP level).

$60 Contributor

3 Standard Keychains,
 1 T-shirt (Kookoo Studios),

1 T-Shirt (Kookoo Studios), 1 Custom T-Shirt,

1 T-Shirt (Kookoo Studios), 1 Custom T-Shirt,

1 Custom Avatar, In-Game Starter Monsters without auto-evolve.

$175 Booster
Get 3 sets of Desktop Wallpapers, 2 Sets of Custom Wallpapers,
 3 Standard Keychains, 3 Custom Keychains,
1 T-Shirt(Kookoo Studios), 2 Custom T-Shirts,
2500 Gems, and VIP Level 5 (benefits vary according to VIP level), 
1 Custom Avatar, In-Game Starter Monsters.

$250 Advocate
Get 3 sets of Desktop Wallpapers, 2 Sets of Custom Wallpapers,
3 Standard Keychains,  3 Custom Keychains,
1 T-Shirt (Kookoo Studios), 2 Custom T-Shirts, 
4000 Gems and VIP Level 5 (benefits vary according to VIP level), 
1 Custom Avatar, In-Game Starter Monsters.
In addition, get 1 Standard Plush Toy.

$350 Benefactor
Get 3 sets of Desktop Wallpapers, 2 Sets of Custom Wallpapers,
3 Standard Keychains , 3 Custom Keychains,
1 T-Shirt (Kookoo Studios), 2 Custom T-Shirts, 
7000 Gems, and VIP Level 6 (benefits vary according to VIP level), 
1 Custom Avatar, In-Game Starter Monsters.
In addition, get 1 Standard Plush Toy, and 1 Custom Plush Toy.

$500 Patron
Get 3 sets of Desktop Wallpapers, 2 Sets of Custom Wallpapers,
3 Standard Keychains , 3 Custom Keychains,
1 T-Shirt (Kookoo Studios), 2 Custom T-Shirts,
10, 000 Gems, and VIP Level 6 (benefits vary according to VIP level), 
1 Custom Avatar. In-Game Starter Monsters,
In addition, get 1 Standard Plush Toy, and 1 Custom Plush Toy.
Get 1 Unique Monster in your country.

Get 3 sets of Desktop Wallpapers, 2 Sets of Custom Wallpapers,

 1 T-Shirt (Kookoo Studios), 2 Custom T-Shirts,

$10,000 Divinity
Get 15 sets of Desktop Wallpapers, 10 Sets of Custom Wallpapers,
15 Standard Keychains, 15 Custom Keychains,
5 T-Shirts (Kookoo Studios), 10 Custom T-Shirts,

In addition, get 5 Standard Plush Toys, and 10 Custom Plush Toys.

Get 5 Unique Global Monsters.
Get 1 Unique Boss Monster. 
Also, gain access to our lab to meet with the team!

$20,000 Universal
Secret Perk! If you are interested, kindly contact us via our Indiegogo page.


Any Questions?

Feel free to contact us, and we will address your concerns promptly.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like what we are doing, share this campaign with your friends! We would greatly appreciate it :)

story:
The Banned Cup #1

Bloodline Champions Picks and Bans Tournament

Story

Bloodline Champions never featured a Map Ban or Bloodline Ban system. For the first time ever, see what it's like to have bans in a Bloodline Champions tournament. 

Teams

The tournament fill feature many of the top teams BLC has to offer
  1. we dem bois - bewz/critster/bloods4ssin
  2. The Opposing Team: Xaynox , UnclePaul , RandlerSVK
  3. mom confirmed mvp - KlernY, ptx, trolldracii
  4. The best epic players that has ever played this game again (forever) -lsak/Wumpah/QuerSation
  5. asd - loreo, straculo, dea1
  6. pornteam - mahlah, SundbergarN, Gazhag
  7. Big Test Icicles - Bollar, Derns, vykoCZ
  8. Not in it to win it - Asasasas/Sakeoe/Sizen
  9. JustJackMenk - justanother/JackCarson/Menkii
  10. Dancing penguins - anticlone111, Bo4, kuo0 (CrazyLT)
  11. wsadCombo: Axter-Kvejgar-Quixik

Donations

100% of donations will go towards the prizepool. 
75% of total donations to 1st place and 25% to 2nd place.

Donor Rewards

Donating to the tournment offers many in game rewards.
Donating at least $3 will earn you the "Certified Donor" silver avatar.

The highest 3 donors will receive the "Top Donor" animated gold avatar.

See animated version here.(Note the in game version will look slower)

Additionally, the #1 donor will also receive an exclusive custom gold title. You can name it anything you want(as long as SLS approves).

Be sure to include your in game name somewhere on your indiegogo profile or in your donation comment. Donating multiple times is allowed and all donations will be totaled(just be sure not to accidentally donate anonymously). We will try our best to update everyone on which donors are in the Top 3.

Games will be streamed at http://www.twitch.tv/animalzlol/

story:
Happy Sweet Nightmares is an adaptation of a LARP event, in a village where all habitants are greatly affected by an economic crisis.

The town´s mayor, tired of looking to deliver a better life for its habitants, has no choice but to close a deal with a Chinese businessman, who will open Waterlife, a bottling water company where hi is hiring all the villagers. But there was only a condition, he want to make you do some strange experiments with its habitants.

Once closed the deal, and already launched the bottler, come by chance Dimitri and Agata, the protagonists of the game, they have an accident on the road, end up taking a bus that leaves them on the Village to be checked by a doctor. Here where the game begins. Dimitri and Agata, discovering strange part of the deal, end up locked in the village with no apparent way out, and discovering a series of events that threaten his life.
 

 

 

When you are developing any project like a movie or like a videogame the most important aspect  is the financial, most of all because you need a lot of hands. There are so many aspects and diferents specialities that you have to cover,  With amount of working hours far exceed any stipulated. 

This is why, we have decided to start a crowdfunding campaign support.

Our project started as a hobby, that slowly became a pasion, and then become more and more in a job that requires much of our time, which we are happy to invest. But as every project has to bear costs and our economic time is not adequate to achieve the goals that the project requires.

The funds raised in this campaign, we want to devote to the development of the project with greater involvement and ease.

Then we'll show you the relative cost of this project:

 

 

 

The game is developed with Unity Engine. The game takes place in a full 3D enviroment, with both indoors and outdoors scenarios, where you have to investigate and search for tools, objects and keys to move forward and discover what happens in this town.

It can be played with both first person and third person view. You can carry and use weapons to defend yourself when needed.

As the game progresses, some cutscenes will show up, giving you bits of the story, the characters and the world itself, to create a thrilling story that the player should discover by himself.

Each level has its own atmosphere, both integrated with the sound. This improves the immersion. Stay alert to every sound you hear, since it can sometimes help you to understand the meaning of certain moments and even guide you to the way you should go.

 

Is Happy Sweet Nightmares a multiplayer game?

No, you can control two different characters as the story progress, but it's a single player experience.

 

 

Agata Vasnev, a Spanish nationality woman who comes from Russian family. She is 45 years old, tall and dark haired.

She graduated from law school, but now she is unemployed. Her dream was always to be a mother, but unfortunately suffered two abortions. In the last one she was in an advanced stage of pregnancy, but due to a medical negligence, she lost her daughter.

She fell into a deep depression. That's why she suffers recurring nightmares, which will make her life even more difficult.

 

Dimitri Kasyanenko, Agata´s husband. Like Agata, he comes from a Russian family. They met in college. He is 42 years old, tall, dark haired and with an always well carried,  nicely groomed short beard.

He is an entrepreneur, and his hobby is hunting. When he have the chance he goes to practice his hobby, but lately, chances are few, because he has devoted to his wife trying to help her come out of depression. As Agata, one of his dreams was to be a father, but unlike her, he decided to move on and continue with their lives.

 

Our first actor Mr. Gustavo Guzman. He is Spanish 56 years old man. He is a tall with graying beard and shaved head. Also he is the mayor of Collsacreu.

He widowed 2 years ago. Because of this, he decided to turn over in their work and improve the lives of its fellow citizens. But now there's a sensitive issue at hand which must be taken care of, a matter related to Waterlife, costing him many sleepless nights.

 

Peter O'sullivan is a short and pudgy 52 years old mechanic, from North America. He is very friendly. He arrived at Collsacreu by chance years ago on a trip with his wife, and liked it so much that he decided to come back and live there with his family. He owns a workshop in the town, which is  well known and liked by all the neighbors.

 

We continue with Zun Wei. A tall, strong and dark haired man from China.  He wears a dense moustache.

He is 37 years old, but do not be fooled by their young age. Although he is young, our character is a billionaire businessman, who has several well-known companies, including Waterlife. Little is known about this man, but as the game progresses you will know more about him, and we assure you that he will not leave you indifferent.

 

 

The game is set in a walled town, so most of the game takes place in the town center and the nearby military base.
There are other scenarios that develop into Agata's Nightmares, and each has its environment.

 

.

 

 

 

Where can you find our game?

Sales will be made through the Steam platform, which in addition to providing powerful tools and services, it also have a great reach to the gaming community.

story:
OVERVIEW

Chicca Jump is an Arcade Adventure video-game in 2D art style. It is currently in development for Android and iOS.

Chicca Jump -- a fun game played in amazing fantasy lands that you can discover after winning at each level. Collect all nine gems to reveal the invisible portal. Fight against enemies, and collect valuable items to use later as you undertake various quests. Discover secret areas in which you can collect the gems in unpredictable ways.

Right now, we are releasing the open beta version for adventure mode, which mainly describes how to play.  

All the backers will have access to this open beta, with a lifetime in-game remove ads button.

The campaign mode, as well as merchandise, such as Chicca clothing, combs, backpack, weapons, and shields, are still under development.

 

 

In a fantasy jungle, there is an ancient myth about a magic gate through which you can pass to travel anywhere in that fantasy world. However, nobody believes in that myth--nobody, except a cute little chicken named Chicca.

One day he was walking by the river when suddenly he saw the gems flying up into the air from the river. Excitedly, he began to jump and chase the gems . . .  little did he know that there were Frozen Warriors tracking him.
 

• Dangerous obstacles to avoid (e.g the frozen warriors & their skills)
• Tricky platforms to jump on, which players can escape from by double tap
• 75+ missions to complete for rewards
• Global leaderboards
• Challenge your friend in a battle with winner takes all (coming soon)
• Friends can watch and bet who will win the match (coming soon)
• Customized campaign mode for the backers (*)


(*) From the legends level.

 

 

It is currently in development for Android and iOS. The development on PC, Mac, Linux, Xbox One, PS4 will be enabled when the 3rd Goal on this campaign is achieved. If we get the funds needed through Indiegogo, we will work with the outsourcing partners to make the console ports happen and bring a unique way to experience this fun game on other platforms, not just the smartphone.


So far, Chicca Jump has been developed to the stage that players can play adventure mode. This allows us to showcase different levels of the game with fine and smooth experiences, including game mechanics, enemies, and its features.
However, the 1vs1 mode and betting system are not released due to the lack of resources. Campaign mode is in developing stage which we are working on map designing, bosses, NPCs, items and Chicca’s skills.
Chicca Jump’s next steps are down to our hand and ready to be taken into action. That’s why we need to focus on development stage and the most important part is that we could make Chicca Jump our full-time job, so we could release the full version as soon as possible and take the game to its full potentials
Making Chicca Jump is quite fun but challenging, and now it comes to the stage that it will only be possible with your support. You have the power to bring Chicca Jump into real life.
Let’s make this campaign alive!
Get in touch through our social media channels and help us spread the word!


Twitter: https://twitter.com/ChiccaJump
Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SlGaykPjnZk
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/ChiccaJump/


Risks and challenges
Chicca Jump is a project by a small team – the two dreamers who are passionate about video game making. We have come this far by working constantly towards our goals, on our spare time, to create a unique and engaging game that could bring a lot of fun to all the people who love arcade games. We’re full of energy, but we are now lacking the triggers which are the supports from you.
By making the first adventure mode, we hope that the backers could experience how the game actually is through the trailer before joining us on this campaign. Moreover, we have a great network that we can bring our full campaign concept to life by outsourcing them.
In essence, Chicca Jump has been our life somehow, and we’ll never stop working on it until it releases the full mode.
Let’s bring the game to life and join the adventure together!

story:
WHAT IS NINE TO FIVE ABOUT?

Nine to Five is a game based off of regular, every day life. Located on a fictional US island called Santa Vida, the players will find themselves on the journey to build the life they want. Whether you want to buy a yacht, build your dream house, become famous, have a farm of cats, make pies, build a UFO on wheels, start a lawn mower racing group, or any other crazy, wonderful you can think of, you can live out your wildest dreams in Santa Vida. 

But to make those dreams come true, what do you need most? The resource the whole world is after. Money. Hence the name "Nine To Five". Because this game is all about the jobs you will have as you fund your dreams. But hey, sometimes the dream is all about the job anyways, right? 

So what kind of jobs do we offer? You can start as a deputy and work your way up through the police department, or you can be a criminal and rob your way to the top. That all sounds pretty familiar though, doesn't it? There are tons of cops and robbers game already 

 ...Good thing we aren't one of them! Some of the other jobs we will have include Firefighters, Coast Guard, Doctors & Nurses, Dentists, Chefs, Farmers, Vets, Pet Groomers, Zoo Keepers, Biologists, Marine Biologists, Mechanics, Hair Dressers, Fashion Designers, Mayors, Judges, US Marshals,Tattoo Artists, CSI's, and SO MANY MORE to come! Our goal is to try and bring as many possibilities as we can see in real life, into our game.  

CHARACTER CUSTOMIZATION

We don't stop at the job options. We are doing are best to ensure you can be as unique in our game as you are in real life. 

For example, our character creator has many morphing options so you can scale each part of your body to be the size and shape that you like. You can change your eye color, makeup, have a unique hair-color or hairstyle, choose from a large assortment of accessories including tattoos and piercings, and you will eventually be able to create your own custom clothes, accessories, make up and many other things with our included customization software - but more on that later! 

But we took it a step further. We are creating a system where you can actually make many facial expressions to react to the world! You will be able to chose which expressions you want to use and keymap them to your liking. You can smile, grimace, make a puke motion, blow a kiss, wink, and many more. This is personally one of our favorite features since many of the games we play are limited to a simple "wave".

HOUSE CUSTOMIZATION

Self-expression goes beyond your appearance. You will also be able to customize your house down to the very fine details. If you buy a house, you can change the layout, the trim, the walls, the windows, the floors, the roof, the yard and much more. You can even build a house from scratch! If you rent an apartment instead, you can change everything except the layout. Create a nice accent wall. Or go for a new hardwood floor. You can make your room have metal walls or even put grass on your floor. Who are we to tell you how to live? We will give you the tools, and you do you. 

JOB OPPORTUNITIES

You read above about all of the different job opportunities we plan to offer. But how do we plan on making them fun? We don't want any of these jobs to be just a title for the player accompanied by a few functions. We are going as in depth as possible with each job to replicate the functionality they have in real life along with giving the employee realistic tasks and realistic roles to fill. Things like "picking a lock" won't simply be a clickable option with a random % chance of success. It will require actual skill from you as the player, and your ability to follow prompts with your mouse and keyboard along with learning the right technique and the right combination to make certain things happen. Some tasks may almost feel like mini-games. The player will also be able to climb the chain and get promoted, earning unique skills on the way. Why do we do this? Because in real life, people have different skills and talents. Such as if you practice shooting your gun a lot, you will have better aim than someone who has just started doing it. We want to bring that level of realism and diversity to our game since it's all about real life. 

Skills

All players are not the same. This is why we are fans of the good ol' skill system, but it is much different than what you're used to! We plan to make each job equipped with unique skills that you can not obtain without climbing the ranks of that job. For example, say you are a police officer and you are investigating a murder. You know who did it, but you have no proof, so the guy is going to walk free. Unless you have evidence. 

Luckily, there will be a CSI job in this game (super stoked for this). A CSI of a certain level, can effectively get finger prints off of crime scenes. (Don't worry criminals, there will be ways to get around it, but you have to level up as a criminal too or your chance of success at hiding your tracks is low!) If you were to know of a CSI who had obtained the skill to dust for prints successfully, you would most likely catch your criminal.

Every way to make money will have parts where you could do better with someones help, but it is not required. There will be no need to grind to get skills because you can have a fulfilled experience without them, they are just a fun bonus!

HOW SERVERS WILL OPERATE

We will have a few different game versions, in the same way FPS's have different game modes. For them, they have gun game, team deathmatch, capture the flag, etc. Our game modes or "sever types" will be called Classic, Open RP, and Community RP.

Classic will be like GTA Online. It will have objectives , goals, skills, and be ran automatically and by AI. It will have a larger amount of players.

Then there is Open RP. It will be an RP server, but no one is running it. It is a "hop on and play" type of thing. No rules, no admins, nothing. The difference between this type and the classic type, is that this type has no objectives or structure. People will get on needing to get food, shelter, money, etc, and will have to Role Play in order to get it. Why? Because there are some things in this game that will require special skills to achieve. Skills that take time to acquire, as referenced above. We believe this will give the relaxed, fun environment with no rules while still providing structure.

Last is community Role Play. Most of us here now, are very familiar with this as it is what we all do already! Community RP is where you join a community, and have rules, stricter and more realistic RP, admins, support, application processes, elections for leaders, special events, and all of that other good stuff. This is not the type of game where you can land a helicopter on the highway or troll the police when they arrest you. These people mean business! 

We will have our own official servers but players may also host and run their own servers. Each server's combination of what is available will be up to each server owner and how they choose to customize their server. 

DEFINE "ROLEPLAY" or "RP"

Roleplay is a great type of game play. If you have never heard of Role Play or are new to it, let us better explain it to you. When you Roleplay, you are almost acting or improvising. Random encounters and interactions with other people come up and people "play along" with these actions essentially. 

Say you are driving down the highway and you hit a person crossing the road. In a normal online game, most of you would ignore it and keep driving. In RP, every action has a reaction. Jobs are played out as if you are doing them IRL, injuries are treated like they are painful, and criminals get caught and punished (sometimes). There is good RP and there is bad RP.

In an example of good RP, you would get out of your vehicle, see if the person was okay, and call an ambulance. They would most likely be making "oooh" and "owwww" noises as if they were hurt. They may decide to press charges on you in which case you would end up in court. This would lead to you needing to find a lawyer and make a good case for yourself. This kind of RP can be found on a Community RP server.

In an example of bad RP, you would after hitting the person, back up and hit them again. That would lead to them calling the police which would put you at the front of a huge pursuit. If you knew the person, they could identify you, resulting in a warrant for your arrest. If you ever got caught you would not stand a chance in court and would most likely do jail time for felony evasion and a hit and run. Then, most of your RP would be focused in a jail making shanks, trading favors for commissary items, and trying to make an escape. This is not necessarily "bad" RP, it is just more "troll-y" and many communities like to keep it more realistic. This is of course the server owners choice. This kind of RP can more commonly be found on an Open RP server.

RP can lead to some of the funnest gaming experiences you will ever have. If you want a lot of interaction with people, this is the way to go. If this isn't your thing? No worries! That is why we have classic mode where you play with AI's and objectives and have less heads on interaction with people, like GTA online. 

WHO ARE WE AS DEVELOPERS?

Most of our experience comes from what we have learned in college or university, and developing mods for Arma 3 servers, along with several little side projects. It involves the same type of map development, programming, animations, and scripting that you see in any other game, only it is much more limited due to Arma having very outdated tools and not being made to handle as much as we want it to. That is why we decided to make a standalone game. We have great ideas and plenty of talent to back them up, but we are too big for Arma and needed an engine that could handle all we had to offer. That is why we switched to UE4 and began making something new.

Do we work with other developers? Absolutely! There are a few modelers whose content we found in the UE4 marketplace that we use, and we love their models so much, we have reached out to them for some custom work as well. We have two modelers of our own as well, but if we see something we love and we can use it - you better believe we are buying it! That saves our modelers time so they can be working on something else. All of the models we have purchased are modular items. Meaning you buy building parts, but you still have to build you items brick by brick - literally. We have made some amazing things with the modular pieces we have purchased so far. We are also looking to work with an animator to make custom animations in a motion capture studio so that they can be as realistic and unique as possible.

These are the two main reasons why we require funding to continue much longer. To hire a great animator, and to be able to pay the modelers doing custom content to create new models for us! (Those, and of course keeping the ability to do this full time.) This is what is slowing us down the most right now! We feel we have come pretty far with funding it ourselves and getting what we couldn't make from the UE4 marketplace. But to continue, we'll need your help. 

We have spent the last 2 months showing you what we can do so you would not have to pledge blindly. (Project started on June 20th, 2018) Taking a look at what we have done so far, we have created a PD, hospital, zoo, aquarium, several furnished apartment buildings, a downtown shopping district, a custom morph character creator with both males and females, clothes made for each body type, made drive-able cars, made a police car with functioning lights and sirens, made all of the basic player movement abilities, animated all of our animals and fish, created dynamic materials that change with the weather, created a realistic day and night cycle, created a housing editor that allows you to change any material and the color of any material in your home, made a twitch plugin that works from any tv or pc screen, and we are still working on so much more right now. Again, two months. We did all of this in two months. We feel like this was a big accomplishment. Imagine what we will have done in two more months? Or by next summer? That is why we believe we can meet our estimated timelines. Good things take time. But they don't have to take 4 years if you work hard and love what you're doing. We don't quit when we're tired. We quit when we're done. (Screenshots of everything mentioned can be found in the progress tracker on our website as well as what we are working on right now.)

We post screenshots of completed work on our discord daily and answer every question we are asked. We know you have trust issues, but we won't hurt you. <3 You will be involved and updated every step of the way. We are so excited to show you what we have done that we couldn't keep it to ourselves even if we wanted to!

Thanks for hearing us out! If you'd like to back us, you can do so here! Thank you on behalf of all of us here at Nine to Five! Read more about us and what we are doing at out website ninetofiverpg.com and join our discord to stay up to date with what we are doing (Discord link) ! See you soon!

WHAT IS NINE TO FIVE ABOUT?
Nine to Five is a game based off of regular, every day life. Located on a fictional US island called Santa Vida, the players will find themselves on the journey to build the life they want. Whether you want to buy a yacht, build your dream house, become famous, have a farm of cats, make pies, build a UFO on wheels, start a lawn mower racing group, or any other crazy, wonderful you can think of, you can live out your wildest dreams in Santa Vida. 
But to make those dreams come true, what do you need most? The resource the whole world is after. Money. Hence the name "Nine To Five". Because this game is all about the jobs you will have as you fund your dreams. But hey, sometimes the dream is all about the job anyways, right? 
So what kind of jobs do we offer? You can start as a deputy and work your way up through the police department, or you can be a criminal and rob your way to the top. That all sounds pretty familiar though, doesn't it? There are tons of cops and robbers game already 
 ...Good thing we aren't one of them! Some of the other jobs we will have include Firefighters, Coast Guard, Doctors & Nurses, Dentists, Chefs, Farmers, Vets, Pet Groomers, Zoo Keepers, Biologists, Marine Biologists, Mechanics, Hair Dressers, Fashion Designers, Mayors, Judges, US Marshals,Tattoo Artists, CSI's, and SO MANY MORE to come! Our goal is to try and bring as many possibilities as we can see in real life, into our game.  


CHARACTER CUSTOMIZATION
We don't stop at the job options. We are doing are best to ensure you can be as unique in our game as you are in real life. 
For example, our character creator has many morphing options so you can scale each part of your body to be the size and shape that you like. You can change your eye color, makeup, have a unique hair-color or hairstyle, choose from a large assortment of accessories including tattoos and piercings, and you will eventually be able to create your own custom clothes, accessories, make up and many other things with our included customization software - but more on that later! 
But we took it a step further. We are creating a system where you can actually make many facial expressions to react to the world! You will be able to chose which expressions you want to use and keymap them to your liking. You can smile, grimace, make a puke motion, blow a kiss, wink, and many more. This is personally one of our favorite features since many of the games we play are limited to a simple "wave".


HOUSE CUSTOMIZATION
Self-expression goes beyond your appearance. You will also be able to customize your house down to the very fine details. If you buy a house, you can change the layout, the trim, the walls, the windows, the floors, the roof, the yard and much more. You can even build a house from scratch! If you rent an apartment instead, you can change everything except the layout. Create a nice accent wall. Or go for a new hardwood floor. You can make your room have metal walls or even put grass on your floor. Who are we to tell you how to live? We will give you the tools, and you do you. 


JOB OPPORTUNITIES
You read above about all of the different job opportunities we plan to offer. But how do we plan on making them fun? We don't want any of these jobs to be just a title for the player accompanied by a few functions. Things like "picking a lock" won't simply be a clickable option with a random % chance of success. It will require actual skill from you as the player, and your ability to follow prompts with your mouse and keyboard along with learning the right technique and the right combination to make certain things happen. Some tasks may almost feel like mini-games. The player will also be able to climb the chain and get promoted, earning unique skills on the way. Why do we do this? Because in real life, people have different skills and talents. Such as if you practice shooting your gun a lot, you will have better aim than someone who has just started doing it. We want to bring that level of realism and diversity to our game since it's all about real life.

story:
What is Blood Moon

Blood Moon is a classic RPG developed explicitly for mobile devices. This is a game designed to be played anywhere for a small amount of time(while waiting the bus, in a waiting room before an appointment, in the bathroom) or for as long as you feel like it.

When playing on a phone, you usually want to play a game that is easy to run, and that can be stopped when you need to; emulator's games are often an excellent choice. However, those games aren't designed for mobile, the menus are small, and you have to use some controller overlays that aren't intuitive.

The other option is playing newer games designed for mobiles. Those usually include gimmicks to keep you playing days after days like daily rewards of in-game resources, or energy system to limit the time you can play. Their primary objective is to make you pay micro-transactions to go around those limitations.

However, Blood Moon doesn't do that. It's a game that uses well-known mechanics that you already saw in other classic RPGs. You can play when you want, where you want, and save your game anywhere. The interface and controls are designed specifically for mobile. It's a good and simple game with a rich storyline and fluid gameplay.

Game Features  

Controls: Point and click movements and interactive environments  

Battles: Clickable buttons instead of small menus  

Classes: There are more than 20 classes in the game at the moment. You can change the classes of any playable character when you want, keeping your previous class progression. Each class has its own skillset and abilities.  

Sub-Class: You can choose one sub-class in addition to your main class allowing you to access its skillset. Sub-classes receive a reduced amount of XP and Job points in comparison to the character main class.  

Class Progression: You unlock additional classes by leveling up the ones already available, combining two of them together or with special events. You unlock other skills for your classes by spending Job Points and/or unique materials that you received for your current class.

Interactive Fighting: When using abilities or attacks you can improve the skills' effectiveness by using the reaction button at the right moment. You can reduce enemies' effectiveness in the same way.

Equipping skills: You can choose four abilities that you will bring in combat. Choosing which skills to bring along is a very tactical choice. You may equip skills from both your main and sub-class

Skills Type: There are three skills types. Battle skills are the basic abilities you can use in combat. Outburst skills are an ultimate ability your character can use less frequently. Passives skills improve your characters and add unique effects or powers.

Saving: You can save your game anywhere on the map, including dungeons. This allows you to stop playing whenever you feel like it. 

Story: Blood Moon's world is a rich story-driven universe that is also filled with many sub-plots and side-quests, so it feels alive and immersive.

 

The story 

Blood Moon is a quiet and peaceful world where most of the power is in the hands of politicians and wealthy merchants. But the discovery of Magic by one of its kingdom is reshaping the face of the world and the balance of powers. Green Vale was already a prosperous and wealthy side thanks to their natural resources but now they are the first one to have access to Magic. 

Many other sides are negotiating with them, trying to get a deal and convincing them to share what they have discovered. The unusual situation is creating frictions between the various kingdoms and the risk of losing control of the situation is high.

A lot of diplomatic missions and negotiations are taking place between all the kingdoms trying to maintain peace and gaining access to this promising and game-changing power.

Surprisingly Green Vale haven't come to an agreement yet with their closest allies, the kingdom of Worgard. The others are starting to wonder if Green Vale is even sincere in its negotiations or if they plan on keeping Magic exclusive to themselves.

Short Summary

Hello, My name is Cyntiria Loc, Co-founder of Visionary Studios Co. of Jacksonville, Florida. I'm responsible for the business management of The Catalyst Action Series. Over the past few years, I've witnessed my husband Vince Loc develop the series from inception to the concept presented to you today. We've gone to various conventions and pitch festivals across the country and have garnered interest from patrons to producers. With the level of feedback we have received, I believe now is the time to elevate our products. You can be the support needed to introduce the fresh content people crave. Ranging from written and graphic literature to gaming, with an extension to film and animation.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need you to push past the concept phase. Over the last couple of years, we've garnered interest from consumers on multiple platforms. We are looking to raise $50,000 with this campaign. This will allow us to complete the production of our audiobook for the existing novels, finish the artwork for our Graphic Novel, "Chronicle of The Grey,” and the Animation "Blurred Lines” trailer.  Completing these various projects sets us up to present The Catalyst as a viable franchise to shop licensing agreements for further development & merchandising. If we exceed our goal, we will be able to further pursue the development of our adventure video game, action figure toys, and enter preproduction on a film.

Our perks will include content from the story and merchandise we have designed to promote the series such as shirts, backpacks, poster prints, and other apparel.

When you help us reach our stretch goals we will be full steam ahead at completing each stage.
$55,000 - If we are able to reach $55,000, we will proceed with the creation of The Catalyst Exclusive Clothing line for people of all ages. This means T-shirts and Accessories that will feature characters from the series.

$65,000 - At this goal, we will allow us to move forward with producing a playable Demo of our adventure/fighting game. We already began development with independent game designers/developers that are excited about creating a unique gaming experience and we look forward to licensing our game to different companies for further development.

$100,000 - It is no secret that our ultimate goal is to get this concept as a Feature Film that can be enjoyed on the big screen. Reaching this stretch goal will allow us the opportunity to develop a Quality Sizzle Reel and Trailer of The Catalyst Series

$150,000 - If this stretch goal is met, at this stage we will start mass-producing our action figure lineup of The Catalyst Main Characters.

 

The Impact

What's special about The Catalyst is its diversity in stories and characters. It eliminates the stereotypical heroes versus villains story arcs of justice, vengeance, and plans of conquering the world. We establish characters of circumstance compelled by real-life situations that shape them. With your contribution, we will be able to provide diverse content and merchandise that is often overlooked by most major media and developer companies.

 

 

Risks & Challenges

Most of the Risk and Challenges we have already faced while building this proof of concept. We have aligned an array of reliable assets to make the development process seamless and efficient. With that being said, if Murphy's Law, ~"All things that can go wrong will,"~ we are prepared to address them swiftly and effectively. Our promise is to provide you with quality entertainment and satisfactory customer service. As you join us on this journey we will continue to keep you updated and informed of our progress and the status of your anxiously awaited goods.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Unfortunately, we are all forced to live in these challenging times. We understand some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. Your shares of this campaign on IndieGoGo and follows on our social media outlets will greatly increase the financial support we need to further secure contracts with production companies & distributors.
