story:
Laxidaze is a monster taming action RPG inspired by the classics; set in a cyber-funk future that features real time 3rd person combat (with a tactical mode) and social-sim gameplay. Recruit monsters and super powered bounty hunters in order to rebel against an oppressive government.

At its core, Laxidaze is re-imagined monster taming RPG that captures what made the classics fun while expanding on customization and inclusivity. As a role playing game, Laxidaze features a diverse cast and an expansive character creator in order to better represent the player and create a more immersive experience to a wider audience.

Hey everyone! 

We at Machine Elf Studios are committed to being transparent and honest with our supporters. So if you have any questions, send us a message or join our Discord server and ask us there! 

Laxidaze is set on Earth in the far future where city-states have replaced modern countries. Our story takes place in the region and city-state of Cascadia located on the Pacific Northwest of North America.

Hammocks City

Cascadia is governed and controlled by the largest corporation in the region, Nile Corp. Nile Corp is ruled by the seemingly benevolent but ruthless CEO, Mr. Baz and his ruthlessly cute Nanim, Zu.

Although it began as a logistics company, Nile Corp's largest source of revenue comes from its production and maintenance of Nanobytes, microscopic robots that can perform the functions of organic cells and increase the rate of evolution in any organic/ inorganic matter they infect.

 

The main character quits a soulless job at Nile Corp, in order to pursue something greater. They become a bounty hunter in the wasteland outskirts of Cascadia in order to fund a life for them and their friends. 

Chaos erupts when the extent of Nile Corp's abuses are revealed. Our heroes join the resistance against Nile Corp as the façade of their benevolence fades and their atrocities come to light.

Laxidaze will feature real time 3rd person ability based combat. Weapons will each have their own respective abilities/move sets and can be either ranged or melee. Players will have a basic attack that charges their Nano-Meter (ability meter) and the players use these charges to perform various abilities.

 

Real Time Mode

Engage in real time combat to take down your enemies by using your weapons and abilities.

Panzer Hunter using their "Accelerator" ability

Tactical Mode

Tactical Mode allows you to slow things down and think through your strategy even in the middle of combat. Entering Tactical Mode slows down time within the game and allows you to select your target and your move.

Engineer Class Hunter using Tactical Mode

Summoning

Summon Nanims to aid you in battle by using the Summoning Meter which gradually builds throughout the battle.

Summoning Dragmar

Switching Characters

Throughout the battle, you will be able to switch between your various Squad Mates and Nanims. When you control a different character you will have access to their full move set and combat will function the same.

 

Abilities

Hunters and Nanims will have access to ability "pools" based on their class and type, and both being able to learn and unlearn moves.

Nano Sync Abilities

These abilities are unique to each hunter and vary in function. 

The Player using their Nano Sync, "Blink" to dodge an enemy

Ultimate Abilities

Every Hunter and Nanim in the game has access to Ultimate Abilities which are powerful moves that can completely change the tide of battle.

Nanomancer using their Ultimate Ability, "Strike Down"

Boss Battle

While bounty hunting, you may come across incredibly powerful and rare Bounty Hunters and Nanims. These will be the hardest battles in the game, so you’ll need to make sure your team is ready by building the toughest hunter team you can.

Equipment

Hunters in Laxidaze will have armor sets and weapons that can be customized depending on your upgrade materials. You will be able to unlock new armors and weapons.

The Player selecting their equipment before a bounty

Rarity Levels

All Hunters, Nanims, armor sets, weapons, etc. will follow this rarity scale:

  • Common (White)
  • Rare (Blue)
  • Epic (Purple)
  • Legendary (Orange)
  • Mythic (Galaxy FX)

Recruit Nanims and other bounty hunters to grow your team and tackle harder bounties.

Hunter Classes

Every Hunter in Cascadia falls into one of below Hunter Classes, each with their own set of armors, equipment, weapons, and skill trees.

  • Protean: The jack-of-all-trades, few exist in the world of Cascadia. This class can use any of the armors, equipment, or weapons from any of the other classes. 
  • Nanim Master: “Beast Master” type class, they specialize in befriending and battling with Nanims.

​

  • Engineer: “Tech” type class, they specialize in technical abilities as well as tech-focused weapons.

​

  • Nanomancer: “Mage” type class, they focus on dealing elemental damage and excel at large area-of-effect attacks.
  • Panzer: “Tank” type class, they will have more defense-focused attributes while also being able to deal massive damage.
  • Phantom: “Assassin” type class, they specialize in stealth and high single target damage.

 

Here's an example of a skill tree for the Engineer Hunter Class.

 

Recruit Other Bounty Hunters

In your fight for Cascadia, you will need to expand your Hunter team to tackle harder bounties, help build up your community, and to aid you in freeing Cascadia. 

 

Basic and Special Types

There will be 6 basic types and 6 special types. The special types are themselves an evolution of the basic types (ice is an evolution of water). Cross types exist and have no restrictions, with a combination of flame and ice being possible.

Recruit Nanims

Nanims are intelligent creatures that can be recruited to your party to aid you in battle, help you explore Cascadia, and aid you in developing your community. Nanims, like Hunters, have a friendship link that can be used to unlock new abilities and to evolve them to their next form.

Use the profits from your bounties to manage and upgrade both your home and the community. Upgrading the community will allow you to access better equipment and unlock new areas. Hunters that have joined your team are available for community missions while they’re not currently part of your party. Community missions passively grant the player extra experience, money, and upgrades.

Use your bounty rewards to upgrade your Home Base!

Use your bounty rewards to help your community!

Bounty Hunting

As an independent Bounty hunter, you’re willing to take on even the oddest of jobs in order to make money and collect rare rewards. Bounties are generally created by the citizens of Cascadia when Nile Corp refuses to provide the help and protection they’ve promised. As such, the bounties will widely range from defeating dangerous Nanims and regional warlords, to exploring new and perilous trade routes, and helping the community grow.

Accept a Bounty from your Home Base!

Before leaving on a bounty mission, select your personal Nanim Summons and select your Hunter Squad Mates.

Select your Squad Mates and Nanims before a bounty!

Once you're ready, get in the taxi and head on out on your bounty!

On your bounty mission, you may come across helpful locals and maybe some not so helpful...

Engage with the locals of Cascadia during your bounties

Fight against dangerous Nanims throughout your bounty!

Recruit Nanims that you have defeated in battle!

Recruiting and befriending Stalag-Might

Cascadian Hunter League

The Cascadian Hunter League (CHL) officially certifies and ranks Hunters. Access to Bounties largely depends on your Hunter rank, which lets the people of Cascadia know how capable you are. You can increase your Hunter rank passively by completing Bounties but in order to progress to the next rank, you will need to compete in an official CHL tournament against the strongest Hunter in the region.

Join CHL Tournaments and fight against the top Hunters in regional tournaments to increase your Hunter rank.

Explore the urban and wild landscapes of Cascadia and discover its many towns, wacky citizens, and hidden secrets.

As you explore the many wild and dangerous areas of Cascadia, you will need to traverse its environments by climbing, swimming, ziplining, using Nanims, and solving puzzles to unlock new areas.

During your exploration, you will come across various important resources (certain plants, precious metals) that can be harvested and be used in either trade, upgrades, or for your own private farm.

In Laxidaze, our goal is create Nanims that are highly interactable, from bonding to fighting. Outside of battle, you will be able to ride, fly, and even pet Nanims!

 

Fly throughout the wilds of Cascadia! 

Fly in Laxidaze!

Ride Langskipper to long forgotten places in Cascadia!

Ride on Langskipper!

Ride on various Nanims in Laxidaze!

Ride on all types of Nanims!

 

Evolutions

Nanims can be evolved once they satisfy whatever requirement that specific Nanim has. Some Nanims only need experience to evolve, while others may require you to increase their friendship link or to complete a specific quest for the Nanim. 

Watch as your Nanim evolves!

Evolution paths vary across Nanims, with some Nanims having multiple evolutions, some having no evolutions, and some even having branching paths in their evolution.

Branching Evolution Path for Boomblast

Trading

There two main ways to trade Nanims and Hunters in Laxidaze, you will have the ability to trade with in-game NPCs, as well as being able to trade with friends through our online trading system.

 

Chromas (Shiny Nanims)

All Nanims will have color variations, typically based on the region you find them, which are called Chromas. Nanims can have more than one Chroma and each Chroma will have its own rarity level.

Lockle is a Water type!

Lockle and Chroma Lockle

Aeos is a Legendary Nanim with Voltaic and Air Types!

Aeos and Chroma Aeos

Dialogue System

In Laxidaze, there are multiple ways of interacting and speaking with the locals of Cascadia. The level of interaction that you have with each character will depend on the significance of each character.

For Squad Mates, you will have a wide range of interactions - from small, one line pieces of dialogue to fully voiced and animated conversations. Squad Mates will speak and interact with each other on missions, comment on mission objectives, and even engage in ongoing conversations as a third party.

Yuki jumping into an ongoing conversation!

For general interactions with NPCs, conversations will typically relate the NPC's mood and what they're thinking about, along with general Cascadia news and quest info.

Talk to the locals!

Squad Mates

In Laxidaze, you will encounter NPCs that you can recruit to your Hunter Team. Each recruitable NPC will have a specific skill that you can utilize to improve your home base and your community, ranging from farming improvements to upgrading your equipment.

NPCs each have a friendship link that you can level up. The main group of Squad Mates will have their own quest line that you will need to progress to level up the friendship, while the secondary group of Squad Mates will level up through various tasks/dialogue options that the player receives. As you level up your friendship link with your Squad Mates, several changes will occur: you will gain the option to hangout with them, you will be able to romance them, and the Squad Mate will unlock new abilities, passives, and equipment (this will result in visual changes as well).

 

Use the in game texting system to find out about upcoming Bounty missions and social hangouts!

Text your Squad Mates about bounties and hangouts!

Hangout with your Squad Mates to build your friendship links!

Relax by the bar after a long day!

Relax by the bar

Relax with your friends and have fun!

Have a dance party with your friends!

Dance with your friends!

Nanims

Since Nanims are recruitable Squad Mates, they also have friendship links that can be leveled up throughout the game. While all Nanims benefit from increasing their friendship links, some are able to evolve if their friendship link is high enough. 

Pet Luna!

Pet Fuegon

Pet Kapoki!

Laxidaze will feature Co-Op and multiplayer modes similar to other monster taming games.

PvE multiplayer Base Game

While in game, you will be able to join and fight alongside your friends while they’re out doing a bounty in Laxidaze’s Co-Op “dungeons”.

Co-Op Dungeon in Laxidaze!

Future State

While Co-Op dungeons are in the base game, Player vs Player (PvP) multiplayer modes will make it to Laxidaze by either reaching our stretch goal or through future updates as we’re committed to bringing multiplayer to Laxidaze.

Inspired by other RPGs, Laxidaze will feature a Calendar System that will control the day & night system and the flow of events. The Calendar System will affect things such as Nanim encounters, availability of missions, and random social encounters (hanging out or romancing squad mates).

In addition to riding Nanims, you will be able to use a collection of vehicles, such as a hoverboard.

Laxidaze will be composed by ZW Buckley. The soundtrack will be heavily influenced by acid jazz, lo-fi hip hop, and jazz. Check out Laxidaze's main theme, Summer Nights by ZW Buckley!

  • Summer Nights
  • Summer Nights (Late Night Edit)
    • Laxidaze will feature a day night cycle and the in-game music will change to reflect that. Each environment will have two associated themes, a daytime version and a nighttime version. The music that plays at night will be heavily influenced by genres like lofi hip hop, vaporwave, and synthwave.
 

Add Ons: Digital OST $15 | Extra Game Key $30

Legendary Nanim Egg $75 | Legendary Chromatic Nanim Egg $100 

 

All tiers include rewards from the previous tiers!

  • Pledge $15 or more
    • Digital Soundtrack!
      • Jam out to the game's music by getting a digital copy of the game's soundtrack!
  • Pledge $30 or more
    • Buy the Game!
      • Become a Hunter in Laxidaze! You'll get a digital copy of Laxidaze and your name in  in-game credits! You'll also get a "Squad Mate" Discord Title!
  • Pledge $45 or more
    • Beta Access!
      • Get access to the game's beta ahead of the game's full release!
  • Pledge $55 or more
    • Alpha Access!
      • Be the first to play Laxidaze by getting access to the Alpha!
  • Pledge $150 or more
    • Legendary Nanim Egg!
      • Receive a Legendary Nanim egg at the start of the game that will spawn a Legendary Nanim! You'll also get a "B Rank Hunter" Discord Title!
  • Pledge $200 or more
    • Legendary Chromatic Nanim Egg!
      • Start the game with a Legendary Chromatic Nanim Egg! Legendary Chromatics are Nanims that are born with a mutated chroma gene that alters their appearance in a special way, only 1 in 6,000 have this mutation. You'll also get an "A Rank Hunter" Discord Title!

Example of a Legendary Nanim, Aeos, and a Chromatic variant

  • Pledge $500 or more
    • Design an NPC!
      • Immortalize yourself in Laxidaze as an NPC, you get to design an NPC, their outfit, and dialogue! You'll also get an "S* Rank Hunter" Discord Title!
  • Pledge $1,000 or more
    • Design a Legendary Armor Set and Quest!
      • Work with the Dev team to design a quest and the reward at the end of the quest, a Legendary armor set! You'll also get a "Legendary Rank Hunter" Discord Title!
  • Pledge $2,500 or more
    • Design a Legendary Hunter!
      • Work with the Dev Team to design a Legendary Hunter in Laxidaze! You will get to design the Hunter's appearance, armor, weapon, Nano-Sync ability, and the bounty mission where you recruit the Hunter! You will also receive the "Legendary Rank Hunter" Discord Title!
  • Pledge $5,000 or more
    • Design a Legendary Nanim!
      • Work with the Dev Team to design a Legendary Nanim and their abilities! This will include designing the bounty mission where you recruit them! You will receive the "Legendary Rank Hunter" Discord Title!
  • Pledge $7,000 or more
    • Design a Legendary Hunter and Nanim!
      • Work with the Dev Team to design a recruitable Legendary Hunter and Nanim duo in Laxidaze! This will include designing the bounty mission where you recruit them! You will receive the "Legendary Rank Hunter" Discord Title!
  • Pledge $9,500 or more
    • Design a Dungeon
      • Work with the Dev Team to design a dungeon in Laxidaze! This will include designing the bounty mission where you find and explore the dungeons! You will get to design the Legendary Hunter and Nanim involved in this dungeon! You will receive the "Legendary Rank Hunter" Discord Title!

We want everyone to be able to play Laxidaze and it has been our intention from the beginning to bring Laxidaze to consoles. As such, we will bring Laxidaze to PC, PS5, Xbox Series X/S, and the Switch!

We plan on bringing Laxidaze to as many communities as possible, which includes English and Spanish to start and will expand as we get more funding.

We are Andrew and Michael, we’ve been best friends since grade school and bonded over a mutual love for video games. Whenever we played a game, we talked about what we liked and what we would change. We’re two Hispanics, who were born to immigrant parents. We grew up in the multi-ethnic culture of Miami, Florida; where flare, vibrant colors, and Latin music dominate and have become the defined social representation. 

We are trying to bring that look and feel into a largely homogenous gaming industry, we also wanted to showcase our love and appreciation for the games that have inspired us like Pokémon, Persona, and Monster Hunter. As a role playing game, having a diverse cast and an expansive character creator is important to us in order to better represent the player and create a more immersive experience to a wider audience.

We’re a small studio that is self funded and video games are expensive so in order to bring this to life, we need the help of our supporters. As we are software developers by trade, we’ve spent the last year developing the game’s core mechanics and systems and due to our lack of funding have been limited to small amounts of our own assets and we have had to rely on freelance work, as well as store bought assets. We’ve realized that in order to bring the art style and art direction that we want to life, we will need a dedicated art team with a bigger budget.

We are committed to being transparent with our amazing supporters and will keep everyone updated on our progress every step of the way. We hope to have a successful Kickstarter so we can continue making the best game we can. Please feel free to message us any questions or concerns you have and we will answer them as best as we can! 

  • Website
  • Discord
  • Twitter
  • Instagram
  • Facebook
  • Press Kit
  • Linktr.ee

The primary challenge is bringing an ambitious game to life with a small team. The scope of the game will expand as we secure more funding, and this isn’t limited to what we raise in the Kickstarter. We intend to continue adding to and updating the game even after release to bring some of the later stretch goals into the game. We are fully committed to Laxidaze and hope to bring it to life with the help of the community and you.

As such, the bounties will widely range from defeating dangerous Nanims and regional warlords, to exploring new and perilous trade routes, and helping the community grow.Accept a Bounty from your Home Base!Before leaving on a bounty mission, select your personal Nanim Summons and select your Hunter Squad Mates.Select your Squad Mates and Nanims before a bounty!Once you're ready, get in the taxi and head on out on your bounty!On your bounty mission, you may come across helpful locals and maybe some not so helpful...Engage with the locals of Cascadia during your bountiesFight against dangerous Nanims throughout your bounty!Recruit Nanims that you have defeated in battle!Recruiting and befriending Stalag-MightCascadian Hunter LeagueThe Cascadian Hunter League (CHL) officially certifies and ranks Hunters. Access to Bounties largely depends on your Hunter rank, which lets the people of Cascadia know how capable you are. You can increase your Hunter rank passively by completing Bounties but in order to progress to the next rank, you will need to compete in an official CHL tournament against the strongest Hunter in the region.Join CHL Tournaments and fight against the top Hunters in regional tournaments to increase your Hunter rank.Explore the urban and wild landscapes of Cascadia and discover its many towns, wacky citizens, and hidden secrets.As you explore the many wild and dangerous areas of Cascadia, you will need to traverse its environments by climbing, swimming, ziplining, using Nanims, and solving puzzles to unlock new areas.During your exploration, you will come across various important resources (certain plants, precious metals) that can be harvested and be used in either trade, upgrades, or for your own private farm.In Laxidaze, our goal is create Nanims that are highly interactable, from bonding to fighting. Outside of battle, you will be able to ride, fly, and even pet Nanims! Fly throughout the wilds of Cascadia! Fly in Laxidaze!Ride Langskipper to long forgotten places in Cascadia!Ride on Langskipper!Ride on various Nanims in Laxidaze!Ride on all types of Nanims! EvolutionsNanims can be evolved once they satisfy whatever requirement that specific Nanim has. Some Nanims only need experience to evolve, while others may require you to increase their friendship link or to complete a specific quest for the Nanim. Watch as your Nanim evolves!Evolution paths vary across Nanims, with some Nanims having multiple evolutions, some having no evolutions, and some even having branching paths in their evolution.Branching Evolution Path for BoomblastTradingThere two main ways to trade Nanims and Hunters in Laxidaze, you will have the ability to trade with in-game NPCs, as well as being able to trade with friends through our online trading system. Chromas (Shiny Nanims)All Nanims will have color variations, typically based on the region you find them, which are called Chromas. Nanims can have more than one Chroma and each Chroma will have its own rarity level.Lockle is a Water type!Lockle and Chroma LockleAeos is a Legendary Nanim with Voltaic and Air Types!Aeos and Chroma AeosDialogue SystemIn Laxidaze, there are multiple ways of interacting and speaking with the locals of Cascadia. The level of interaction that you have with each character will depend on the significance of each character.For Squad Mates, you will have a wide range of interactions - from small, one line pieces of dialogue to fully voiced and animated conversations. Squad Mates will speak and interact with each other on missions, comment on mission objectives, and even engage in ongoing conversations as a third party.Yuki jumping into an ongoing conversation!For general interactions with NPCs, conversations will typically relate the NPC's mood and what they're thinking about, along with general Cascadia news and quest info.Talk to the locals!Squad MatesIn Laxidaze, you will encounter NPCs that you can recruit to your Hunter Team. Each recruitable NPC will have a specific skill that you can utilize to improve your home base and your community, ranging from farming improvements to upgrading your equipment.NPCs each have a friendship link that you can level up. The main group of Squad Mates will have their own quest line that you will need to progress to level up the friendship, while the secondary group of Squad Mates will level up through various tasks/dialogue options that the player receives. As you level up your friendship link with your Squad Mates, several changes will occur: you will gain the option to hangout with them, you will be able to romance them, and the Squad Mate will unlock new abilities, passives, and equipment (this will result in visual changes as well). Use the in game texting system to find out about upcoming Bounty missions and social hangouts!Text your Squad Mates about bounties and hangouts!Hangout with your Squad Mates to build your friendship links!Relax by the bar after a long day!Relax by the barRelax with your friends and have fun!Have a dance party with your friends!Dance with your friends!NanimsSince Nanims are recruitable Squad Mates, they also have friendship links that can be leveled up throughout the game. While all Nanims benefit from increasing their friendship links, some are able to evolve if their friendship link is high enough. Pet Luna!Pet FuegonPet Kapoki!Laxidaze will feature Co-Op and multiplayer modes similar to other monster taming games.PvE multiplayer Base GameWhile in game, you will be able to join and fight alongside your friends while they’re out doing a bounty in Laxidaze’s Co-Op “dungeons”.Co-Op Dungeon in Laxidaze!Future StateWhile Co-Op dungeons are in the base game, Player vs Player (PvP) multiplayer modes will make it to Laxidaze by either reaching our stretch goal or through future updates as we’re committed to bringing multiplayer to Laxidaze.Inspired by other RPGs, Laxidaze will feature a Calendar System that will control the day & night system and the flow of events. The Calendar System will affect things such as Nanim encounters, availability of missions, and random social encounters (hanging out or romancing squad mates).In addition to riding Nanims, you will be able to use a collection of vehicles, such as a hoverboard.Laxidaze will be composed by ZW Buckley. The soundtrack will be heavily influenced by acid jazz, lo-fi hip hop, and jazz. Check out Laxidaze's main theme, Summer Nights by ZW Buckley!

Summer Nights

Summer Nights (Late Night Edit)Laxidaze will feature a day night cycle and the in-game music will change to reflect that. Each environment will have two associated themes, a daytime version and a nighttime version. The music that plays at night will be heavily influenced by genres like lofi hip hop, vaporwave, and synthwave.

We want everyone to be able to play Laxidaze and it has been our intention from the beginning to bring Laxidaze to consoles. As such, we will bring Laxidaze to PC, PS5, Xbox Series X/S, and the Switch!We plan on bringing Laxidaze to as many communities as possible, which includes English and Spanish to start and will expand as we get more funding.We are Andrew and Michael, we’ve been best friends since grade school and bonded over a mutual love for video games. Whenever we played a game, we talked about what we liked and what we would change. We’re two Hispanics, who were born to immigrant parents. We grew up in the multi-ethnic culture of Miami, Florida; where flare, vibrant colors, and Latin music dominate and have become the defined social representation. We are trying to bring that look and feel into a largely homogenous gaming industry, we also wanted to showcase our love and appreciation for the games that have inspired us like Pokémon, Persona, and Monster Hunter. As a role playing game, having a diverse cast and an expansive character creator is important to us in order to better represent the player and create a more immersive experience to a wider audience.We’re a small studio that is self funded and video games are expensive so in order to bring this to life, we need the help of our supporters. As we are software developers by trade, we’ve spent the last year developing the game’s core mechanics and systems and due to our lack of funding have been limited to small amounts of our own assets and we have had to rely on freelance work, as well as store bought assets. We’ve realized that in order to bring the art style and art direction that we want to life, we will need a dedicated art team with a bigger budget.We are committed to being transparent with our amazing supporters and will keep everyone updated on our progress every step of the way. We hope to have a successful Kickstarter so we can continue making the best game we can. Please feel free to message us any questions or concerns you have and we will answer them as best as we can!

story:
* UPDATES *

07/06/2015

I know I've been silent for a while now, I thought to clear up what's been happening and why the silence.

fyrecamp is not dead, nor has it been cancelled. Crowdfunding as I've mentioned earlier is heavily dependant on promotion and we've failed at promoting ourselves to as many people as possible :( Only 272 individuals saw our campaign (of which I'm sure about 100 are just friends or colleagues of ours :P). Regardless of how hard I tried to promote our campaign, only a few saw it. No where near enough people to impact the success of our campaign. Most successful campaigns see visits in the tens of thousands.

I've sent countless emails & posts to as many gamer related websites & persons of interest. Fansites & forums of eSport games like SMITE, League of Legends, Counter Strike, Heroes of the Storm, Hearthstone, etc. As well as well known and lesser known Youtube & Twitch personalities. Just by scrolling through my email sent folder I can see over 200+ emails sent & forums/website registrations and thread postings. But, unfortunately, luck wasn't on our side at all.

Most forums are pre-moderated and my posts were deleted with a notice stating that they do not accept Crowdfunding promotion since they get many such posts and it would turn their forum into a spam of people posting campaigns of games and game related projects. Understandable and reasonable, no hard feelings there from us :) We tried at least :D

As for Youtubers & Twitchers, well only 6 replied giving the same reasoning as above. The rest, well, I'm kind of disappointed that they didn't reply at all :( A simple 'no' would have sufficed or some kind of reply :)

So as you can see, for us it wasn't easy, I guess you have to be lucky to get as many people to see the campaign as possible to gain some sort of success.

So what now?

Considering that 272 is no where near enough people to tell us that our idea is good or bad, we've decided not to abandon the project yet. We're debating whether or not to release our project again on Indiegogo or Kickstarter but with a much smaller financial goal. We've also continued to go about looking through investors. We've put too much of our own time & money into this project to drop it.

Especially with fyrestore nearing completiion, which will be a big step forward in this project. Maybe we'll use profits gained from fyrestore to fund fyrecamp into reality. Maybe we'll land another investor, maybe our second attempt at Crowdfunding will be fruitful, who knows, we're not giving up :) Not yet.

What about the few that did support our campaign?

You are not forgotten, and you will be rewarded for your contribution. If not through fyrecamp, you'll be compensated with a bonus from our fyrestore :) We've got a few ideas on what may be of interest. fyrestore is a 100% sure to be completed project so no worries about us disappearing :) Look forward to us contacting you individually and compensating you. Thanks for those few who did support us. Big thank you ^^


fyrecamp is an easy-to-use platform designed to offer gamers amazing rewards for their achievements in competitive eSport Gaming. Our platform is for any gamer, casual or professional, beginner or veteran, as long as you play games such as League of Legends, DotA, Counter Strike, StarCraft, and other eSport games.

As gamers we felt that there could be better and more ways to reward gamers. It's nice to know I beat someone in a 1v1, it's nice to receive from time to time in-game items for beating an opponent... but... but what if you could feel like you're actually earning on your game-time? That you're getting something real for your achievements? Well... that's where fyrecamp delivers.

fyrecamp is powered by a virtual currency we created specifically for gamers.

Collect fyrecoins by simply playing the games you already play and use them to buy rewards from our shop such as gamer gear (Razer, Steelseries, Logitech, Corsair, etc.), PC components, games (Steam, GOG, etc), and many other gamer related items. Consider them as points you receive from your achievements in battle that can be exchanged for real rewards.

There will be tons of ways to earn fyrecoins in fyrecamp. We'll start with:

Battle other gamers as you normally would but with the addition of gaining fyrecoins. That's it, not much else changes in your gaming routine. Only a few quick clicks to setup a match and fight to win... or join a tournament and battle it out to win bigger prizes.You will be able to find matchups & tournaments based on your level and preferences. You are in control.

There will also be various tournaments for you to join. Tournaments will be available for every level of gamer in as many games as possible with many different prize pools to choose from. Aim to win the tournament and walk out with rewards like large fyrecoin pools, tokens, gamer gear, or games! Our system is setup in such a way that as long as you reach the quarter-finals you'll be walking out with part of the reward. Each tournament will have different requirements or conditions to enter, everyone will find a tournament suited for them.

Businesses will be able to create & manage their own tournaments with our tools. There are extra options to control tournaments with, such as setting conditions & requirements, more control over who can join, and prize pool management. We have many interesting development plans that will help you build your brand and connect with gamers and fans in fyrecamp! Contact us to find out how you will benefit from this.

There will only be 4 coins to choose from when battling for fyrecoins. 2, 5, 10, and 20. Only 1 coin can be chosen per matchup. To play, just create a match, choose a coin, and battle it out, whoever wins takes the loser's coin.

We decided to do things this way because otherwise malicious players would abuse the system and try to clean players out of their fyrecoins in a single Matchup. It just sucks when you lose everything anyway :( This way you just pick yourself up after a loss and fight to win your coins back!

Just keep on fighting! The more matchups & tournaments you join, the more fyrecoins you earn. The more you earn, the more rewards you get!

For the NA market this means that items in our shop will be converted based on the rate above (EU market will have it's own fyrecoin rate which should be similar to the above). For example, a gamer mouse that costs in stores $100 will be in our shop for 2000 (1:20). So once you collect 2000 you'll be able to buy the mouse from our shop and we'll send it to you :)

fyrecoins can be purchased at our store as well but there will also be ways to acquire them for free such as joining tournaments, events, using tokens, unlocking achievements, and more.

Both the EU and NA will have similar set rates once we launch fyrecamp. For this campaign we are using the USD:fyrecoin rate which is set for the NA market. EUR:fyrecoin rate hasn't been set yet, but don't worry, we're looking to keep all rates as close to market conditions as possible. For those in the EU, expect around €1 = 20. We will announce the rate prior to the launch of fyrecamp.

*JUST TO BE CLEAR*  Not to be confused with gambling. You can only fight for coins in your own matchup, you cannot bet on someone else's match. This isn't a gambling/betting platform. YOU fight for coins based on your own skills, strategy, and gameplay, and if you are good enough to beat your opponent, you will be rewarded. No unknown or risky variables.

Also this is NOT a Pay2Win platform. Someone with more fyrecoins does not have ANY advantages over someone with less coins. I personally dislike P2W. We will never have a P2W model as it doesn't work with our strategy at all nor does it benefit us in anyway. So you can relax now :D

Of course, we will be working on anti-cheat/hack systems and putting a lot of our effort and financial resources into creating a secure platform to ensure minimal malicious behaviour. No one likes cheats or smurfs right? :)

 

fyrecamp Explained - More in-depth video about how it works.

The whole idea is to make fyrecoins widely accessible with minimal burden, both physically & financially, so that anyone can play without feeling like their bank accounts are being cleaned out or they have to work super hard to earn them. This also creates a more relaxed approach to competing for fyrecoins. In the end, you want to be getting rewards, not losing them.

fyrecamp began over a year ago, but back then it was still a rough & unorganised idea. Over time, it began to develop into something more serious, something possible, something that we've began to invest our time & money into making a reality.

We began by building our fyrestore. At first we wanted to build a store that would sell Gamer Gear and other gamer related items and afterwards we'd implement the ability to buy stuff using fyrecoins. During this time we decided to look for investors and had the team develop a working concept to present and hope to gain financial support, however, it was difficult. Most investors I contacted had no idea about eSports, and since it is a relatively new market, albeit a rapidly growing one, they weren't sure about its future, and some even considered it a temporary trend. Most investors told us to find incubation programs to see whether this idea would even be accepted publically and then come back to them for financial support. They liked the idea, it made sense to them, but they just weren't sure enough about the eSports gaming market.

So, after a lot of discussion we decided that we should turn to Crowdfunding. 

Especially because it allows us to directly communicate with you. Your support will tell us whether or not we are onto something here, and you can help us prove these investors wrong, that this isn't a trend, that there is potential.

As of now we have invested our time & money into creating our fyrestore which should be available soon.

However, in order for fyrecamp to become a fully functioning platform we need to expand our team and obtain resources necessary to make it operational.

We need:

TEAM

  • Additional Programers & Developers
    • Back-end & Front-end Developers
    • Technical Developers
    • Graphic, UI/UX Designers
    • Quality Assurance Testers
  • Software & Services
    • Licenses for various software
    • Anti-Cheat tools/Security
  • fyrestore Sales Team
    • Shop management
  • Lawyers & Accountants

MATERIAL

  • Office Space
  • Office Supplies & Furnishing
  • Workstations
  • a HUGE Coffee Machine to pull all-nighters :P
  • Warehousing

Currently we're all working from home but if we expand fyrecamp's team we need to consider renting an office, this comes with additional costs. We also will have to pay for the dreaded taxes *shivers* and hire lawyers to ensure that everything is done by the book. We are not putting all the costs on you, we ourselves are covering whatever costs we can to get as much as possible done :)

I am a stickler for quality services, products, and talent. I apply this same aproach to our team. We don't want to build a half-assed product that will come with tons of holes and problems, we want to hire a talented team of quality specialists that will build a powerful quality platform. Luckily I have access to very talented people due to my original career but they come at a price. I would rather pay more, and have less problems, then vice-versa, for obvious reasons :)

This is why we need your support. Since we're directing our product at Gamers that play eSport games, we want you to be directly involved. Our goal...

 

$450,000 USD | 9,000,000

 

Reaching this goal would allow us to build a fyrecamp that will be worthy of your time. The beta version of Standard fyrecamp (Tier 1) will be available to you within 2-3 months after the end of this campaign, with the full version of Standard fyrecamp ready 1-2mths after that. Features and improvements will be added continuously as they are ready. Expect most features to be implemented within the first half a year after the end of this campaign. EU will be the first to get fyrecamp with North America shortly after. 

We chose flexible funding as development is split into 3 tiers. Each tier reached will deliver the product ready to use with the tier's features implemented. We really want to reach all 3 Tiers since it will turn fyrecamp into something you'll definitely like. Not just a standard eSport platform like most others out there, this is something more for you. Get ready to earn for your game-time! :D

We are IT Professionals that worked on much bigger projects (part of our careers from Design/Development/Interactive Agencies :D ) so we can ensure you we know what we're doing and we are ready to deliver.

Standard fyrecamp (Tier 1)

$140,000 | 2,800,000

Just reaching this will ensure you can use the fyrecoins & tokens from the perks. This will allow us to implement core features such as the fyrecoin system, reward exchange, matchups & tournaments (create, manage, and search), and basic business tools. Beta Testers will be invited during this stage to give feedback on the development of fyrecamp.

Advanced fyrecamp (Tier 2)

$320,000 | 6,400,000

Tier 2 will see the development of more powerful tools & features such as multi-stage and bracket tournament management, promotion, and caster tools, advanced profile & team management, tokens, friends lists, and messaging system. Businesses will get more powerful tools to give them more control and customisation of their tournaments including prize management capabilities.

Kick-ass fyrecamp (Tier 3)

$450,000 | 9,000,000

The final tier, or rather, the end of the first chapter will allow us to develop the fyrecoin API Payment system that will allow businesses to implement fyrecoins as a method of payment directly in their shops. Most importantly, we'll begin developing anti-cheat systems and security.

Tier 4 FIRST STRETCH GOAL

$600,000 | 12,000,000

We'll only unveil the first stretch goal for now to show you the future of fyrecamp. If we manage to reach this (and I sincerely hope we do) we'll be able to include Achievements. By unlocking achievements such as winning 10 1v1 matches in a row vs a Gold Rank you receive 20 or achieve Gold Rank in a game and get 40. Also you can get tokens through achievements. This stretch goal will also allow us to develop a more robust token system for added bonuses/boosts. Twitch & Feeds integration including notification panels.

There are plans to begin work on a mobile version of fyrecamp that will give you access to the latest news, events, exclusive deals, calendar, friends list, challenge notifications, matchups, and tournaments.

FYI - every amount that goes past our goal will also go towards speeding up and improving development as it will allow us to build a larger team.

FEATURE LIST WHEN WE REACH OUR MAIN GOAL

  • fyrecoin system - fyrecoin wallet, exchange (partially done, for concept purposes)
  • fyrecamp UI - User Interface of fyrecamp (Most of it is done, just to connect it all)
  • Reward Exchange - exchange fyrecoins at fyrestore
  • Tokens - abilitiy to add token boosts to your Matchup.
  • Profile Management - Solo & Team Profiles
  • Matchups & Tournaments - Create/Manage/Modify
  • Business Tools - Business Profiles, Tournament & Prize Management
  • fyrecoin Payment API - fyrecoin as a payment method
  • Anti-cheat/hack Systems - Security against malicious behaviour
  • News & Events - News archive, event, matchup & tournament calendar 

I know I've said this already, but we seriously appreciate any and all help that comes our way! We hope that the perks we've setup for you are fair and enticing :) Perks include fyrecoins, tokens, gear, access to unique tournaments, and other awesome stuff.

EACH perk (except $1) includes fyrecoins so that you can start battling it out to collect more, so you can get MORE rewards from our shop or just head over there to buy gear right away. You can even buy items from our shop by combining fyrecoins & any one of EUR/USD/CAD/PLN.

BADGES

If anyone has questions about any of the perks or just general questions about becoming a backer, contact us at backers@fyrecamp.com

 

OUR ULTIMATE PERK

ONE MILLION fyrecoin perk! Become one of the first millionaires on fyrecamp.

You will also be able to invite up to 10 friends! Each of the will get:

  • 1000
  • 1x Freebie Token
  • 1x Ghost Coin Token
  • 1x Double UP Token
  • 1x Grab 50 Token
  • 1x Grab 100 Token
  • Epic Badge - along with what comes with it.
I'll also be contacting you to ask you various things like what you feel about an idea we came up with and get your opinion directly or other more direct input :) You will be a part of the team.

Contact me at backers@fyrecamp.com for more information about this perk!

TOKENS

So what are tokens? Consider them as boosters for every matchup you battle in. When planning/setting up a Matchup, you can choose a token to "boost" various elements of the matchup (no no no :D don't worry, it doesn't give you an advantage over your opponent, it's not a P2W kind of thing, hear me out). By boosting various elements, I mean mostly the rewards you get from the matchup. For this campaign we've decided to release 5 different tokens for you to use during your matchups. Setup the match, choose a fyrecoin, and then, if you want, you can apply a token boost.

Let me explain what each of the 5 does (we'll be adding more tokens in the future):

  • " Freebie " Token
    • This token entitles you to a free matchup where the coin chosen for the Matchup = 2, 5, or 10. Whoever wins gets fyrecoins equal to the coins value for the given match. Consider this as a free coin from us to you so you can battle it out.
  • " Ghost Coin " Token
    • The Ghost Coin adds to the matchup a 3rd coin to the pot equal to the value of the match's set coin. For example, you setup a match for 20. Both you and your opponent put 20 each, making it 40 in the pot, this token adds a 3rd 20 to the matchup's pot. Whoever wins the match will walk out with 60. This token doesn't influence your wallet if you lose, it is only a bonus if you win.
  • " Double UP " Token
    • This DOUBLES the winnings of a given matchup. Let's say you and your opponent choose the 20 for your fight, there is now 40 to win, with this token boost it will DOUBLE that, making it 80 possible to win. This token doesn't influence your wallet if you lose, it is only a bonus if you win.
  • " Grab 50 " Token
    • Grab 50 token allows you to setup a match for free where the winnings = 50. You don't have to pay from your own coins to fight. Whoever wins, grabs 50. It's just a free 50 giveaway through a fight :D
  • " Grab 100 " Token
    • Just like the Grab 50, this time, the matchup is for 100! :O FREE! Whoever wins gets 100.
  • " Epic Gear " Campaign Only Token
    • This token entitles you to trade in your token for any gear from our shop up to $100 USD worth. Shipping not included.
  • " Ultimate Gear " Campaign Only Token
    • This token gets you ANY gear from our shop. Regardless of price. Shipping not included.

TEAM EDITIONS

Team editions are for 5 people, the perk bonuses are split amongst you and 4 others. You will be able to invite up to 4 friends. When you buy this perk, we'll contact you about which 4 friends you'd like to have join fyrecamp :)

BUSINESS EDITIONS

*MUST BE a gaming-related business :) As long as you are somehow involved in the gaming market then you can take advantage of our Business Perks.

As you are aware, businesses will play an influencial role in fyrecamp, you will be offering gamers ways to battle for amazing prizes that you have, prizes like fyrecoins, tokens, gamer gear, or products/services you have :) You will create & manage your own tournaments for gamers on fyrecamp.

We are also developing an API Payment Method that allows you to use fyrecoins as a method of payment for your services/products. Gamers will be able to go to your shop/service and buy whatever they can with fyrecoins they earn on fyrecamp :) We will have special rates available for businesses who purchase the " Business is Business " PERK.

These packages also include a tournament starter pack and your company Logo will be displayed on our page as a partner :)

Contact us at backers@fyrecamp.com for more information about what we have to offer companies and how the rates will work.

One of our main concerns right now is operating in various countries throughout the EU & NA. Each country has it's own laws & regulations and we'll need to adhere to them and at the same time ensure that our users will be able to smoothly access & use fyrecamp without hindrance. We'll be hiring the appropriate legal & financial teams necessary in order to allow smooth operation and to have everything done by the book. We've never had a multinational business before so it'll be a first for us ^^;

Cheaters & Hackers, unfortunately, in the world of eSport Gaming (and not only eSports) they are present. Many companies and businesses have been fighting against them and joining together to create alliances that would battle these malicious people. We want to join this fight and prevent them from causing you trouble. We'll be working closely with security teams & businesses to offer a secure platform. It isn't cheap to build a secure platform, and we don't know exactly how much it will be. It depends on how big your platform is and how many users use it. 

fyrecamp is based in the EU, in Warsaw, Poland.

story_txt:
* UPDATES *
07/06/2015I know I've been silent for a while now, I thought to clear up what's been happening and why the silence.fyrecamp is not dead, nor has it been cancelled. Crowdfunding as I've mentioned earlier is heavily dependant on promotion and we've failed at promoting ourselves to as many people as possible :( Only 272 individuals saw our campaign (of which I'm sure about 100 are just friends or colleagues of ours :P). Regardless of how hard I tried to promote our campaign, only a few saw it. No where near enough people to impact the success of our campaign. Most successful campaigns see visits in the tens of thousands.I've sent countless emails & posts to as many gamer related websites & persons of interest. Fansites & forums of eSport games like SMITE, League of Legends, Counter Strike, Heroes of the Storm, Hearthstone, etc. As well as well known and lesser known Youtube & Twitch personalities. Just by scrolling through my email sent folder I can see over 200+ emails sent & forums/website registrations and thread postings. But, unfortunately, luck wasn't on our side at all.Most forums are pre-moderated and my posts were deleted with a notice stating that they do not accept Crowdfunding promotion since they get many such posts and it would turn their forum into a spam of people posting campaigns of games and game related projects. Understandable and reasonable, no hard feelings there from us :) We tried at least :DAs for Youtubers & Twitchers, well only 6 replied giving the same reasoning as above. The rest, well, I'm kind of disappointed that they didn't reply at all :( A simple 'no' would have sufficed or some kind of reply :)So as you can see, for us it wasn't easy, I guess you have to be lucky to get as many people to see the campaign as possible to gain some sort of success.So what now?Considering that 272 is no where near enough people to tell us that our idea is good or bad, we've decided not to abandon the project yet. We're debating whether or not to release our project again on Indiegogo or Kickstarter but with a much smaller financial goal. We've also continued to go about looking through investors. We've put too much of our own time & money into this project to drop it.Especially with fyrestore nearing completiion, which will be a big step forward in this project. Maybe we'll use profits gained from fyrestore to fund fyrecamp into reality. Maybe we'll land another investor, maybe our second attempt at Crowdfunding will be fruitful, who knows, we're not giving up :) Not yet.What about the few that did support our campaign?You are not forgotten, and you will be rewarded for your contribution. If not through fyrecamp, you'll be compensated with a bonus from our fyrestore :) We've got a few ideas on what may be of interest. fyrestore is a 100% sure to be completed project so no worries about us disappearing :) Look forward to us contacting you individually and compensating you. Thanks for those few who did support us. Big thank you ^^

fyrecamp is an easy-to-use platform designed to offer gamers amazing rewards for their achievements in competitive eSport Gaming. Our platform is for any gamer, casual or professional, beginner or veteran, as long as you play games such as League of Legends, DotA, Counter Strike, StarCraft, and other eSport games.
As gamers we felt that there could be better and more ways to reward gamers. It's nice to know I beat someone in a 1v1, it's nice to receive from time to time in-game items for beating an opponent... but... but what if you could feel like you're actually earning on your game-time? That you're getting something real for your achievements? Well... that's where fyrecamp delivers.
fyrecamp is powered by a virtual currency we created specifically for gamers.

Collect fyrecoins by simply playing the games you already play and use them to buy rewards from our shop such as gamer gear (Razer, Steelseries, Logitech, Corsair, etc.), PC components, games (Steam, GOG, etc), and many other gamer related items. Consider them as points you receive from your achievements in battle that can be exchanged for real rewards.
There will be tons of ways to earn fyrecoins in fyrecamp. We'll start with:

Battle other gamers as you normally would but with the addition of gaining fyrecoins. That's it, not much else changes in your gaming routine. Only a few quick clicks to setup a match and fight to win... or join a tournament and battle it out to win bigger prizes.You will be able to find matchups & tournaments based on your level and preferences. You are in control.

There will also be various tournaments for you to join. Tournaments will be available for every level of gamer in as many games as possible with many different prize pools to choose from. Aim to win the tournament and walk out with rewards like large fyrecoin pools, tokens, gamer gear, or games! Our system is setup in such a way that as long as you reach the quarter-finals you'll be walking out with part of the reward. Each tournament will have different requirements or conditions to enter, everyone will find a tournament suited for them.

Businesses will be able to create & manage their own tournaments with our tools. There are extra options to control tournaments with, such as setting conditions & requirements, more control over who can join, and prize pool management. We have many interesting development plans that will help you build your brand and connect with gamers and fans in fyrecamp! Contact us to find out how you will benefit from this.

There will only be 4 coins to choose from when battling for fyrecoins. 2, 5, 10, and 20. Only 1 coin can be chosen per matchup. To play, just create a match, choose a coin, and battle it out, whoever wins takes the loser's coin.
We decided to do things this way because otherwise malicious players would abuse the system and try to clean players out of their fyrecoins in a single Matchup. It just sucks when you lose everything anyway :( This way you just pick yourself up after a loss and fight to win your coins back!Just keep on fighting! The more matchups & tournaments you join, the more fyrecoins you earn. The more you earn, the more rewards you get!

For the NA market this means that items in our shop will be converted based on the rate above (EU market will have it's own fyrecoin rate which should be similar to the above). For example, a gamer mouse that costs in stores $100 will be in our shop for 2000 (1:20). So once you collect 2000 you'll be able to buy the mouse from our shop and we'll send it to you :)
fyrecoins can be purchased at our store as well but there will also be ways to acquire them for free such as joining tournaments, events, using tokens, unlocking achievements, and more.
Both the EU and NA will have similar set rates once we launch fyrecamp. For this campaign we are using the USD:fyrecoin rate which is set for the NA market. EUR:fyrecoin rate hasn't been set yet, but don't worry, we're looking to keep all rates as close to market conditions as possible. For those in the EU, expect around €1 = 20. We will announce the rate prior to the launch of fyrecamp.
*JUST TO BE CLEAR*  Not to be confused with gambling. You can only fight for coins in your own matchup, you cannot bet on someone else's match. This isn't a gambling/betting platform. YOU fight for coins based on your own skills, strategy, and gameplay, and if you are good enough to beat your opponent, you will be rewarded. No unknown or risky variables.

Also this is NOT a Pay2Win platform. Someone with more fyrecoins does not have ANY advantages over someone with less coins. I personally dislike P2W. We will never have a P2W model as it doesn't work with our strategy at all nor does it benefit us in anyway. So you can relax now :D
Of course, we will be working on anti-cheat/hack systems and putting a lot of our effort and financial resources into creating a secure platform to ensure minimal malicious behaviour. No one likes cheats or smurfs right? :)
 

fyrecamp Explained - More in-depth video about how it works.
The whole idea is to make fyrecoins widely accessible with minimal burden, both physically & financially, so that anyone can play without feeling like their bank accounts are being cleaned out or they have to work super hard to earn them. This also creates a more relaxed approach to competing for fyrecoins. In the end, you want to be getting rewards, not losing them.

fyrecamp began over a year ago, but back then it was still a rough & unorganised idea. Over time, it began to develop into something more serious, something possible, something that we've began to invest our time & money into making a reality.
We began by building our fyrestore. At first we wanted to build a store that would sell Gamer Gear and other gamer related items and afterwards we'd implement the ability to buy stuff using fyrecoins. During this time we decided to look for investors and had the team develop a working concept to present and hope to gain financial support, however, it was difficult. Most investors I contacted had no idea about eSports, and since it is a relatively new market, albeit a rapidly growing one, they weren't sure about its future, and some even considered it a temporary trend. Most investors told us to find incubation programs to see whether this idea would even be accepted publically and then come back to them for financial support. They liked the idea, it made sense to them, but they just weren't sure enough about the eSports gaming market.
So, after a lot of discussion we decided that we should turn to Crowdfunding. 

Especially because it allows us to directly communicate with you. Your support will tell us whether or not we are onto something here, and you can help us prove these investors wrong, that this isn't a trend, that there is potential.

FYI - every amount that goes past our goal will also go towards speeding up and improving development as it will allow us to build a larger team.

The Ghost Coin adds to the matchup a 3rd coin to the pot equal to the value of the match's set coin.
