story:
Dear viewers,

We have closed the project and are currents working on a better version of the game. We will be launching a new campaign on Kickstarter in September.
Check back with us in a couple of weeks for more info.


                   PRESENTS


               

Exordium is a "Pen and Paper Role-play" game (PnPRPG) dedicated to boost gameplay experience through both explicit narration and an abundance of illustrations, allowing the players to be fully submerged into the world while they reenact the roles of sentient species of their choosing. Furthermore the book provides numerous game systems to enhance the role-playing experience: professions, character development, pseudo real-time battles, quick quest creator and so on.

A “Pen and Paper RPG” is a form of tabletop role-playing game in which the participants describe their characters' actions through speech. The players determine the actions of their characters based on their in-game personality and those actions succeed or fail according to a formal system of rules and guidelines. Within the rules, players have the freedom to improvise; their choices shape the direction and outcome of the game. Actions taken by the players are considered by the almighty Game Master and he or she determines an appropriate outcome.


MeKhanIX is an independent start-up company based in Silistra, Bulgaria. Our main goal is to design and develop alternative gameplay variants to Pen and Paper RPG as well as board games.

The MeKhanIX team currently consists of three people:

Volen "Will" Valentinov - Head of MeKhanIX, Lead game designer and writer of Exordium.

Nikolay "Nihon" Kalchev - Lead concept artist, digital sculptor and co-designer of Exordium.

Preslav "Valserp" Yordanov - Lead hard surface designer, specializing in lightening and rendering.

Since we strive for impeccable details on both our Core Manual and Miniatures, we have decided to keep the manufacturing local, which will help our small town’s economy as well. Outsourcing the game may lead to critical and irreversible mistakes. These mistakes can result in a lower quality product and we really cannot have that. Our manual will be printed by a local publisher and our plastics, injection molded by a local manufacturer.

For the miniatures we aim for high definition details, for that reason we chose 3D printing. But not any 3D printer can do HD quality. To fine print the miniatures as you see them below, we will be using SLA and MultiJet printing. These printers can produce details as low as 20 microns (0.02 mm/0.0008 in) to achieve even the smallest of details.

Outside our team, we will be closely working with Engineers, publishing, modeling and 3D printing professionals to ease the process and clarify any unknown factors and errors along the way.

Meticulously detailed chronicles of the world for total immersion.  Descriptions ranging from terrestrial biomes, landforms, territorial dominions, flora and fauna - down to behavior of species, culture and traditions, technologies and science.

Simple, quick quest generation. The Game Master section is equipped with lots of diverse quest templates to mix-and-match together engaging adventures in minutes. Also includes tips on how to create exciting and alluring campaigns.

Strategic battles. “Pseudo real-time” battles are achieved through an initial action phase to establish tactics for the turn and a simultaneous resolution of all actions in their speed order.

Tactical Miniature system with Miniature set included in the Collector’s edition. Specially designed to mimic real physical interaction between objects and give the players additional actions during combat.

Snap-on modular buildings included in the Collector’s edition. Modular inner and outer walls, and corners equipped with small magnets to conjoin together forming multilevel structures. “Cover” objects such as bricks, pipes and barriers are also included. 


              Check out our gallery for lager size images of our work:                     https://goo.gl/caq9LA


                                        

After many years of game testing various RPGs we have concluded that battles in a pen and paper game can get a bit (very) tedious. Because of this, a primary aim for us has always been a more trimmed and direct battle system. We recommend using the miniature figures and inanimate objects made by us to ease the process but they are not mandatory and can easily be substituted by drawn maps and simple game pieces. The “Exordium Core Manual + Dice” perk is all you need for that good-old, genuine “Pen and Paper” feeling.

For these reasons we have split the gameplay into 3 modes.

Role-playing in Scenario Mode

The scenario mode is the pure pen and paper experience. The game lets you dive into a world of endless wonders as one of six master species while having the freedom to decide your own fate. Exploring, evolving, gathering experience and equipment from tasks, quests and epic campaigns.

“Scenario” to “Combat”: Transition Mode

A system dedicated to converting scenario actions to combat actions and vice-versa, this is a simplified combat mode designed for all you true pen and paper lovers out there. This version of gameplay still uses the “pseudo real-time” battle system but is simplified and it does not require miniatures and a battlefield, just your character sheet and dice.

Battling in Combat mode

The lightweight battle system is designed for ease-of-use and puts rules and enforcement on action cards, freeing the Game Master from a lot of bookkeeping. However the GM still has control over the battle, as usual his or her word is law.

As hinted by the miniatures and terrain objects, the system is heavily reliant on true physical dimensions. All objects have number statistics - such as strength, endurance, weight etc. - and abilities - reflection, ricochet etc. - required for interactions.

Besides the interaction factor, our system depicts another rather simple yet very functional aspect. Strategies and actions are all dependent on split second, simultaneous turns, previously mentioned as the PR (pseudo real-time) system. How does that work, you wonder?

        

Here is how:

Step 1: At the beginning of each round every participant in the battle chooses their initial action.

Actions are represented by “action cards” , also included in the Core Manual as blank templates since actions change statistics and abilities as your character levels. Each action card has an initiative stat which represents a time span (0=Instant, 1-10=Normal, 11=Delayed).

Step 2: The action cards are then placed by initiative in ascending order (the lowest being the fastest to happen).

Step 3: The actions are then resolved in the order of initiative. A player can change their mind and choose another action depending on a few base rules:

If switching with another action card, the player must NOT have resolved his initial action yet.

If choosing a “reaction” action card, the rules on the card must be explicitly followed.

Other card types, such as control cards, split-second cards, and dodge cards are also available to use as long as their rules apply.

Step 4: Check for “delayed” actions.

Any action that requires over 10 initiative is considered delayed. The rules state that actions of up to 10 initiative can be resolved in a single round. Delayed actions take longer than that and must continue executing in the next one. For this reason the action is then placed again but this time its initiative is decreased by 10.

After resolving the delayed action the player can choose one more action to take that round. That action cannot be another delayed action and takes the +initiative as it is being slowed by the first action. (Tokens will be made to ease this process.)

Example:

A Madruk is reloading a Mortar but this is a delayed action with a “16” initiative value. The first 10 initiative from that action takes up the whole first round and the leftover 6 is carried to the next one.

As he completes his action, he decides to fire it, which is another 4 initiative (6+4). The fire action is placed on the 10 marker and then executed.

But wait, there’s more! The mortar is a formidable weapon, but a rather slow one. The “Fire Mortar” action card also has a secondary initiative stat, this time for reaching the target.

 Example:

The Mortar is fired in the air and it takes 2 more initiative to land. This places the blazing armament on the 2 initiative marker in the 3rd round. It is then resolved with the rest of the actions from that round.

Why is the system so deep in the timing aspect?

Timing is everything in battles. Species like the Wazur are incredibly fast and agile which makes them not only the quickest to act in battle, but are also able to execute two or even three actions in a single round.

Within the rules, the system actually allows for a lot of freedom. Actions interact with one another and can be executed in a combo or fused together to form a new one (an aspect we will talk about during play tests on our upcoming channel broadcasts at www.Twitch.tv/MeKhanIXtv ).

 No-Miss Factor

For efficient, quick battling, there is no missing due to a bad die roll, but it is still possible to miss. The “no-miss” rule applies only if the target is somehow immobilized or unwilling to move or dodge the attack.

How does this help the battle?

First, unnecessary die rolls are forfeit unless the action specifically calls for it. Secondly, many battles systems give you the opportunity to defend while your character is also in offence. Our systems rely on the logic that during execution of one (initial) action, say, a kick, you cannot also use dodge action unless the first action never happened OR the initial action has a built-in dodge ability.

In the gameplay, the actions string together and resolve in amazingly complex ways with endless tactical options. 

                                           

Classes

Classes in Exordium are split into 2 categories: Professions and Elite

Professions unlike Elite are a humble beginning for every character, Pilot, Engineer, Hunter, but even they can get a little strange - Bio Technician, Elementalist, Warrior, Druid, Monk, etc. 

Some elites however are more than just bizarre. The sentient creatures of this world go to great lengths for wisdom and power. By gathering excessive knowledge they have combined expertise and perpetually evolved into adepts of their own making.

The Elite classes are also species specific, which means that no two master species of the same Elite class shares the same appearance but only similarities.

                                                        Locus

                                                        Omega

                                                           Titan

                                                             Warmachine


Exordium is a fascinating new sci-fi realm with a pinch of fantasy, carefully designed to turn a new page in Pen and Paper RPGs.

The world is filled with amazing alternative life forms, incredible new minerals, mesmerizing landscapes and much more. Six master, sentient speciesrule the planet, but their existence is entangled in a deep, never ending war caused by lust for dominance, immeasurable cruelty and quite often a “behavior barrier”. But this is not the complete story, as this world has signs of love, compassion and kindness emerging from underneath the violence and hatred. 


Scientists of this world theorize that the planet was created by three separate fireballs; they inflamed celestial gas clouds which rapidly formed the hard planetary mass. This quick solidification relative to the chemical structure of the fireballs created uneven landmasses, some rich in crystallized minerals, others on metallic cinder. They also say the fireballs then collided shortly after, to form what is today the sun. Close observation of the sun backs this theory by revealing three district territories, burning in different colors.

The outer layer of this planet consists of sundry gasses in uneven quantities, creating a prism effect which leads to a difference in sunlight color around the globe.


“…Unlike religious and spiritual beliefs, Tan-Nak scientists theorize that even though the species are very diverse to the point where their base elements do not match, they share a common ancestor. Proof for this are similar physical conditions and disorders observed in each of the master species.”

Tan-Nak

Tangra’s first creations were the so called Universal Beings named after him. Tangra’s name is a compilation of 3 words “Tan, Nak, Ra” – “Universal, Being, God”. It is heavily debated on which word comes first, but the meaning “An almighty being of all that exists” is commonly accepted throughout the three species worshipping Tangra – Tan Nak, Brotta and Madruk.

The Tan-Nak are considered the first and foremost specie. Their body shape is what the manuscripts describe as inspiration for the lesser gods, a template for them to create from.

The Tan-Nak are mainly divided into two subspecies:

Civilians

The Tan-Nak are pretty much the default human race. Minor differences make them one of a kind.

They possess a thin white layer over their eyeballs which act as a brightness enhancer. It also hides their iris which is disconcerting for other species, who often accuse them of staring. Their body hair can change colors through the duration of their lives. The colors can be very bright and saturated.

High population rates, universal adaptability, regeneration and longevity have kept them from being obliterated by the Brotta for millennia.


A Tan-Nak can live for over half a millennium (militarized Tan-Nak live a third of that life span). On an average of a hundred years their bodies completely regenerate from an older exhausted version of themselves to a younger and more capable one. In this long process any defects are being mended and lost organs regrown; old teeth fall off and new ones erect.

Given enough time, a Tan-Nak can adapt to live in the throat a volcano, in the arctic tundra at sub-zero degree temperature without any clothing, and even underground without sunlight or sufficient breathable air. Furthermore, they are able to readapt again in a span of two decades.

Next-to-last in physical qualities, but first in population, the Tan-Nak can be found all over the world in all shapes and sizes. They are a force to be reckoned with.

Military

The Military Tan-Nak are modified to the point of no return. Their lifespan is limited in order to enhance their muscular system as well as their brain functionality. In their short lives, they undergo a chemical enhancement called “pumping” through which chemicals are introduced to induce development of additional muscular fibers and condition the brain to learn quickly by skipping short term memory, in theory. A brutal, intense breeding process leaves them underdeveloped. The majority of militaries have facial disfigurements, lack of eyelid and lips, missing nose cartilage. The “pumping” process leaves irreparable scars mostly on their backs. Tattooed indicators of chemicals around the scared areas are also common.


A mask, a coat and an exo-suit are the uniforms they wear while serving the military, until the day they expire. The masks purify air, supply additional chemicals if needed and detects harmful airborne substances.

The suit designs began as a mechanical exoskeleton but it was then deemed useless as it did not enforce further strength but rather superseded it, slowed down the wearer and, very often, got in the way of work. The new advanced carbon fiber exo-suit tightly enwraps the wearer and has direct skin contact. It acts as a nerve system enhancer allowing the wearer to use their full muscular potential. The coat top is made out of fire resistant fibers and has the strength of a bulletproof vest. The layout of the coat promotes freedom of movement and gives easy access to smaller equipment through “hook and loop” fasteners and pockets.

Brotta

The Brotta are a silicon-based life form. They have evolved and developed their culture in territories with high concentrations of pure mineral formations.

                                             

The Brotta are the supremeconquering force of this world. They are natural psychopaths and rarely care about the “why”. They do not feel remorse and have no interest in peaceful negotiations, unless they have a hidden agenda.

The Brotta are divided in three main subspecies. The shape of their brains and base skin color is what makes them different. A crystal-formed skeletal system is the base of their bodies. Their place in the hierarchy is determined by the several minerals from which their bones are made of. Royalty and power are especially reserved for those with a diamond-like skeleton.

They are the tallest known sentient life form.  They range from 3 to 3.7 meters (9 to 12 feet).

Their faces lackan oral cavity. Instead they have an air duct connected to a second pair of nostrils on the back of their neck for speech.

Crystal formations, superseding the chin area up to the nose, grow outwards and pierce through the skin. They form beard-like ornaments. Each Brotta has a unique set which is their version of a fingerprint.

                                           

Their arms are unusually long and their hands have not one but two opposable thumbs, which gives them a good tight grip, and an incision in the center of the palm. This triple split opening is surrounded by a soft tissue. The tissuesecretes compounds which dissolve hard minerals into liquid so that the sponge-like tissue can absorb it. The bulges on their arms, just under the shoulders, are small stomachs that process and distribute food.

Their legs are inverted and instead of feet they have hooves, each split in three parts, two frontal and one on the back. They act as three toes and help manage rough terrain.

The front of the torso isevenly covered by a rib-like, dense bone structure. That is the birthing chamber. The back is segmented and two rotation discs pivots allow lateral bending.

Since the Brotta liquidize their food, no excretory system is present but instead, sweat out inept liquids through their hoofs and vaporize gasses through their heads. It is not uncommon to see a Brotta with his scalp burning blue with fumes.

A specially developed organ in their chest resembles two rapidly beating hearts which are entangledwith one another. As the hearts beat out of rhythm, a gyroscopic effect takes place. This mechanism helps the Brotta to stand straight up and makes them hard to bring down, which makes their overly tall stature deceptively stable.

In terms of labor, the Brotta rarely use their own hands. Their hundreds of thousands of slaves do the work for them. From keeping up the land and growing crystal food, to manufacturing items of use for the Brotta. The only aspect they keep for themselves is their infamous mineral growing techniques. By molecularly engineering mineral growth patterns the Brotta are able to literally erect a building in under a month. Most of their technology, also kept in secret, is again grow in specific shapes resembling circuit boards.

Their weapons and vehicles use energy syphoned by the mineral deposits underneath their lands. Alas these technologies are useless outside their old boarders.

Madruk

The Madruk are the embodiment of toughness. Besides a thick skull, an overly muscular body, and a bad temper, they have shock absorbing cartilage pads embedded under their skin. Even the females have them to protect their more susceptible to pain body parts. Furthermore, their skin’s derma is thick and rubbery, almost bulletproof. The epidermis is rough and callous. 

The three breasted-body is the Madruk’s distinguishable earmark. Women birth children in instances of three. Their heads are bucket-shaped, and skull is unbreakable. Their teeth are wide enough to be used as secret compartments, while two opposing pairs of them extend outside the mouth. These teeth are razor sharp and are used to cut the tips of their cigars. Their hands have three pairs of fingers, each pair mimics one larger finger. Most Madruk never use these additional divisions. Enlarged feet plates and hard toesprotect an unusual organ which captures even the weakest of vibrations.

                                             

The common Madruk are hot-headed, violent, and usually very drunk. They are easily provoked and in rare occasions so much so that their inner temperature rises to a point where their derma starts to glow. While infuriated the Madruk are extremely dangerous but also very fragile as their derma becomes soft and easily damaged. This process is also called “Tempering” and is necessary to harden the cartilage pads of their younger offspring. 


                 

The Madruk faction in power is composed of paranoid anarchists and their ruling can only be compared to the late stages of communism and slavery. They drive colossal vehicles, which run on hard fuel, hauling tens of wagons which contain whole town establishments. This long caravan sets camp when needed, and the wagons form up a circular defensive perimeter around the settlement.

The fuel that drives their light escort motor vehicles, “Kiriya”, is produced from a special fruit mixed with the mineralization and purification of a moisture loving, pipe dwelling fungus. This liquid is also congestible and very intoxicating. The word “Kiriya” is from an old Madruk dialect and can mean not only “booze” but also – victory, a good trading deal, attack and loot. 


Another faction of Madruks, the “Highly Intellectual Society”, live in the cold territories far in the north. They have established their mechanically-advanced cities and factories away from the anarchists, but are being oppressed by them and forced to produce much of their arsenal.

                                        

The Madruk do celebrate a special day in the year when, they believe, Tangra gave them life. For this reason a large lone tree is chosen to be engulfed in fire and burns through the remainder of the night while the Madruks are gorging around vast tables.

Biomaton

Biomatons are a peculiar tribal race of bio-mechanoids. They were the first to create gunpowder and fireworks, but are not credited for it.

Their biological half has fused with a metallic mechanical harness to form an incredibly beneficial symbiosis. Stories told by the elders unveil how this happened to them.

It’s told that in the past the Biomaton were purely biological, a “Protomaton”. Their infant bodies grew outwards from a leathery egg and formed the limbs. The story goes that a protomaton female was running from an enemy tribe where her offspring was kidnapped to be sacrificed by a shaman. She hid him in an old scrap pile, which had fallen from the sky islands where the Cyionic reside. When she came back to feed the infant, it had already started fusing with the metallic components surrounding it, thus the first Biomaton was born. Since then the Biomaton have established strict regulation to what components a metallic harness can be comprised of, to enforce that no weaponry will be directly fused and concealed by the body.

Instead of hair they have segmented pipes which transfer nutrition to the brain and acidic fluid from it.

The metallically encased spine is and organ of an upmost curiosity and the central balancing part of their body. Its stable construction and flexibility allow the torso and arms to rest freely on top of it. Their ribcage is at float and requires no additional surrounding muscles.

The spine in males curves backward from the chest to form a hunch and it is attached on the rare of the pelvis. In females, it is quite the opposite: the spine arches forward through the chest and it isattached in the foremost part of the pelvis, forming a belly-like oval between the pair of egg-bearing breasts.

The males are formed with one almost completely mechanical arm and their body develops a biological counterpart which grows in size to balance out the weight for each side of the chest. The legs are double-jointed and excellent for jumping and running. Both male and female bodies are fully covered, even the metallic parts, by a transparentprotective skin layer.

From biological speaker-like organs to a mechanical hearing apparatus are what these Biomatons are made of. An incredible one-of-a-kind symbiosis, but not without its downsides. Their bodies produce two types of blood, one for the biological parts and one for the mechanical. This creates an abnormal acidity levels, mostly in the males which, if not cleansed properly, can cause acid-loving life forms to swarm all over their bodies. The acid is generated in the skull, transferred down the segmented hair, through the spineand finally extruded from two waste canals just above their heals  (too brotta or not?). The acidic liquid also neutralizes any foot prints or scents left by the Biomaton.

The male's pipes detached and reattached on the females to impregnate them. This process is very dangerous since females, produce much less acidity and process it slower than males. If successful, women lay leathery eggs that, until that moment, are stored in their breasts. The eggs are then placed in a mechanical harness to develop.

                                              

Spiritual beliefs give great importance to eyes. This is why Biomaton own coconut-sized glass eyes in their huts. Smaller, round glass containers are used to hold tiny amounts of chemicals. These containers become fragile when contacted by the Biomaton’s acidic bodily fluid, such as spit and other secretions, and are then thrown in a group of two or more to create specific effects: Smoke, fire, flash, stickiness amd others.

Wazur

The Wazur are a sentient plant life. They may seem humanoid, but they were not always like that. The last known continent to be discovered, far below the planet’s equator, was their little piece of heaven. They had thrived and flourished for millennia, completely oblivious to the other species. The Brotta were the first to find them and enslave a small part of the population only to find that they withered and died without freedom. Then a group of military Tan-Nak, burdened with the mission to find new strategic territories, arrived and discover the sylph race of seedlings. In an act of fear and disparity, their bodies began undergoing a reshaping process to imitate their visitors, supposedly to better communicate with them.

Simply put, the Wazur are your common plant life, but one that has developed a mind of its own. Ninety percent of the population of the continent are plant life forms which have developed legs and visual and vibrational senses.

Their bodies are networks of soft elastic fiber, the skin is even more so. They are small, but flexible and extremely quick.

The wazur’s face resembles a carved wooden mask in many of its features. This mask and surrounding skin covers a skull-like hard shell. The shell encompasses a soft brain tissue from which their whole fiber skeletal structure begins. A root-like complex also dilates from the shell to form their fictive hair.

Wazur breathe carbon dioxide by means of an angular, pyramid-like nose which contrasts with the rest of the facial features. Their mouth is used mainly for speaking, because they get their energy via photosynthesis. However, their tongue acts as a very powerful chemical recognition device. Any substance can be felt and described by the Wazur.

On their foreheads, they have a mirror-like oval formation. This is a protrusion of their skull that penetrates through the maskand is directly connected to the soft brain tissue. The “mirror” acts as a communication device between Wazur. Much like an infrared signal, this device sends information and their skulls act like a receiver. A two-way communication is made when both Wazur are facing each other. This makes up for unbeatable team work while in a skirmish.A team of wazur warriors in action is something to behold – swift, deadly, and acting as one. 

                               

Another form of communication is the genetic exchange which activates the birthing process. This exchange is described by the Wazur as a very satisfying out-of-body experience. After the female has received the genes she produces a large seed which is then placed in the ground for a beautiful birthing tree to cultivate. The tree then sprouts many fruit which contain small Wazur seedlings. After the fruit matures it drops off the tree branch to fall on large cushion-like leaves underneath and slide to solid ground, where it is collected by breeders. The Wazur do not see children as someone else’s progeny. They collect and take care of seedlings as a group, the tree produces more than a handful of offspring.

The wazur body can regenerate, much like a lizard’s tail. This lets them regrow a whole limb in a matter of days. In fact, a wazur can survive even a decapitation, provided the head is then permanently rooted to the ground to be kept alive.

They have long legs, but that is only because they are digitigrade. The foot and heel arelocked in a vertical position and take up a third of the leg. This mode of walking on their toes makes them nimble and silent in their legs. When needed, however, the ankle joints can be released to move into a plantigrade position, which allows them to perform leaps and accelerate rapidly.

The “Neyd” wazur are a subspecies genetically modified by the Tan Nak by splicing the birthing tree with a Neyd tree. These Wazur can be short fused. Their physical appearance is more of an old tree, because of their quickly hardening skin which then peels off.

Since the Wazur are surrounded by quadruped plants, they use them as cattle and even graft useful objects directly onto them. Wazur can be seen riding a rhinoceros-like creature with a plant-grown throne grafted directly to it. This way if the add-on is damaged it will self-repair by tapping into the host creature’s life force.


Cyionic

In this world where bizarre is normal, the Cyionic are the odd species.


These beings are literally created by two Queen mothers which use them as every day laborers. Their bodies are arsenic-based which predisposes them to an alloy shell. Alloys, wires and mercury plasma mimic a biological body. Most of them are created without a personality. They start off featureless with a singular sensation encompassed by their hyper sensitive hair fibers. The top skin layer is a cushiony, elastic alloy covered by hair fibers shaped like hooks. These metallic hairs are used to connect the Cyionic to a number of technological devices that are placed directly onto the skin and held there by the combined strength of the hairs. These devices enable them to function as any other creature by giving them visual and vibrational input but these upgrades go far beyond basic senses

Their heads have a wheel-shaped organ placed halfway through the skull. This is their brain, and it spins as they process thoughts and commands.

Another fascinating aspect of their lives is that they consume metals for nutrition. The metals are dissolved and distributed around the body to feed their alloy base. If a single metal is consumed in larger quantities the outer skin of the Cyionic becomes saturated with that metal. The metal’s properties apply to the Cyionic which has its upsides and downsides.

They live on top of narrow mountains called “Sky islands” by the Biomaton. Cyionic and Biomaton share a continent but are divided by height. Cyionic have no need for interaction with anyone else but themselves. The Biomaton praise the technologically advanced species as demi-gods.

The flora and the fauna of this worldcan easily be confused since both have specimens who act as the other.

There is a great variety in life forms, based on various base elements and structures: exo-skeletal silicon based creatures; tree shaped mammals; metallic plants; reptilian quadruped plants;  acid-loving swarms of flies; and rainbow colored plant sharks - just to name a few.

We have been working on several ideas including

- NFC chips in the base of the Miniatures for storing character information (easily accessible through a phone)

- Laser pointer tripod with changeable tip, projecting combat rulers for range weapons, grenades and mines etc.


- Mechanical, pressure activated, tiled platform which can be arranged and rearranged with several types traps (under the tile). Acts as a booby-trapped dungeon.

- A Camera + Projector device which will:

  • Scan the battlefield from above
  • Project it on a computer screen
  • GM can then project combat rulers directly onto the battlefield
  • Can also place hidden landmines that will not be projected on the field until someone walks into its range.

We know these ideas sound overly ambitious but they are not impossible.


We are prepared to ship out as soon as we have the plastic figures. But the book itself will not be ready. We have many new illustrations to make and will refine the systems with your help. 

Check out our twitch channel @ www.twitch.tv/MeKhanIXtv

And since we want YOU to be part of this process, we have decided to ship the game in a two phases.

Phase 1: Estimated Delivery – between February and April 2016

We will ship all the plastic models immediately after production. You will also receive a pdf file containing the latest systems so you can playtest with us and give us your feedback.

Updates to those systems will be resent by email on a regular basis.

Phase 2: Estimated Delivery – August 2016

Ship out the Core Manual and paper materials as soon as they are ready.


                Risk and Challenges

As a start up company we know that mistakes will be made along the way. We feel confident that no unnecessary delays will occurs since we will be manufacturing our products locally with the help of a experienced plastic manufacturer and book publishers. We can not outsource the game since we will be expecting the utmost quality. Rest assured we are working with professionals who will guide us through difficulties.
Our Core Manual however is more susceptible to delays due to proof reading, editing and most importantly adequate artwork and content structure. We want only the best for outr contributers! Because of that we have decided to send regular updates of the manual on PDF to all that have contributed beyond the "Core Manula + Dice perk", that way you can not only track our progress, but also play along with us.

     Thank you for contributing!

                   PRESENTS



               

Exordium is a "Pen and Paper Role-play" game
(PnPRPG) dedicated to boost gameplay experience through both explicit narration
and an abundance of illustrations, allowing the players to be fully submerged
into the world while they reenact the roles of sentient species of their
choosing. Furthermore the book provides numerous game systems to enhance the
role-playing experience: professions, character development, pseudo real-time
battles, quick quest creator and so on.



A “Pen and Paper RPG” is a form of
tabletop role-playing game in which the participants describe their characters'
actions through speech. The players determine the actions of their characters
based on their in-game personality and those actions succeed or fail according
to a formal system of rules and guidelines. Within the rules, players have the
freedom to improvise; their choices shape the direction and outcome of the
game. Actions taken by the players are considered by the almighty Game Master and
he or she determines an appropriate outcome.




MeKhanIX is an
independent start-up company based in Silistra, Bulgaria. Our main goal is to
design and develop alternative gameplay variants to Pen and Paper RPG as well
as board games.
The MeKhanIX team currently consists
of three people:
Volen "Will" Valentinov - Head of MeKhanIX, Lead game designer and
writer of Exordium.
Nikolay "Nihon" Kalchev - Lead concept artist, digital sculptor and
co-designer of Exordium.
Preslav "Valserp" Yordanov - Lead hard surface designer, specializing in lightening and
rendering.




Since we strive for impeccable details on both our
Core Manual and Miniatures, we have decided to keep the manufacturing local,
which will help our small town’s economy as well. Outsourcing the game may lead to critical and
irreversible mistakes. These mistakes can result in a lower quality product and
we really cannot have that. Our manual will be printed by a
local publisher and our plastics, injection molded by a local manufacturer.
For the miniatures we aim for high definition
details, for that reason we chose 3D printing. But not any 3D printer can do HD
quality. To fine print the miniatures as you see them below, we will be using
SLA and MultiJet printing. These printers can produce details as low as 20
microns (0.02 mm/0.0008 in) to achieve even the smallest of details.
Outside
our team, we will be closely working with Engineers, publishing, modeling and
3D printing professionals to ease the process and clarify any unknown factors
and errors along the way.


Meticulously
detailed chronicles of the world for total immersion.  Descriptions ranging from terrestrial biomes,
landforms, territorial dominions, flora and fauna - down
to behavior of species, culture and traditions, technologies and science.
Simple,
quick quest generation. The
Game Master section is equipped with lots of diverse quest templates
to mix-and-match together engaging adventures in minutes. Also
includes tips on how to create exciting and alluring campaigns.
Strategic
battles. “Pseudo real-time” battles are
achieved through an initial action phase to establish tactics for the turn
and a simultaneous resolution of all actions in their speed order.
Tactical
Miniature system with Miniature set included in the Collector’s edition. Specially designed to mimic real physical interaction
between objects and give the players additional actions during combat.
Snap-on
modular buildings included in the Collector’s edition. Modular inner and outer walls, and corners equipped with
small magnets to conjoin together forming multilevel structures. “Cover”
objects such as bricks, pipes and barriers are also included.

                                        After many years of game testing various RPGs we have
concluded that battles in a pen and paper game can get a bit (very) tedious. Because
of this, a primary aim for us has always been a more trimmed and direct battle
system. We recommend using the miniature figures and inanimate objects made by
us to ease the process but they are not mandatory and can easily be substituted
by drawn maps and simple game pieces. The “Exordium Core Manual + Dice” perk is
all you need for that good-old, genuine “Pen and Paper” feeling.
For these reasons we have split the gameplay into 3
modes.
Role-playing in Scenario Mode
The scenario mode is the pure pen and paper
experience. The game lets you dive into a world of endless wonders as one of six
master species while having the freedom to decide your own fate. Exploring,
evolving, gathering experience and equipment from tasks, quests and epic
campaigns.
“Scenario” to “Combat”: Transition Mode
A system dedicated to converting scenario actions to
combat actions and vice-versa, this is a simplified combat mode designed
for all you true pen and paper lovers out there. This version of gameplay still
uses the “pseudo real-time” battle system but is simplified and it does not
require miniatures and a battlefield, just your character sheet and dice.
Battling in Combat mode
The lightweight battle system is designed for
ease-of-use and puts rules and enforcement on action cards, freeing the
Game Master from a lot of bookkeeping. However the GM still has control over
the battle, as usual his or her word is law.
As hinted by the miniatures and terrain objects,
the system is heavily reliant on true physical dimensions. All objects have
number statistics - such as strength, endurance, weight etc. - and abilities - reflection,
ricochet etc. - required for interactions.
Besides the interaction factor, our system
depicts another rather simple yet very functional aspect. Strategies and
actions are all dependent on split second, simultaneous turns, previously mentioned
as the PR (pseudo real-time) system. How does that work, you wonder?
        Here is how:
Step 1: At the beginning of each round
every participant in the battle chooses their initial action.
Actions are represented by “action cards” , also
included in the Core Manual as blank templates since actions change statistics
and abilities as your character levels. Each action card has an initiative stat
which represents a time span (0=Instant, 1-10=Normal, 11=Delayed).
Step 2: The action cards are then
placed by initiative in ascending order (the lowest being the fastest to
happen).
Step 3: The actions are then resolved in
the order of initiative. A player can change their mind and choose another
action depending on a few base rules:
If switching with another action card, the
player must NOT have resolved his initial action yet.
If choosing a “reaction” action card, the rules on
the card must be explicitly followed.
Other card types, such as control cards, split-second
cards, and dodge cards are also available to use as long as their rules apply.
Step 4: Check for “delayed” actions.
Any action that requires over 10 initiative is
considered delayed. The rules state that actions of up to 10 initiative can be
resolved in a single round. Delayed actions take longer than that and must
continue executing in the next one. For this reason the action is then placed
again but this time its initiative is decreased by 10.
After resolving the delayed action the player can
choose one more action to take that round. That action cannot be another
delayed action and takes the +initiative as it is being slowed by the first
action. (Tokens will be made to ease this process.)
Example:
A Madruk is reloading a Mortar but this
is a delayed action with a “16” initiative value. The first 10 initiative from
that action takes up the whole first round and the leftover 6 is carried to the
next one. 
As he completes his action, he decides to
fire it, which is another 4 initiative (6+4). The fire action is placed on the
10 marker and then executed.
But wait, there’s more! The mortar is a formidable
weapon, but a rather slow one. The “Fire Mortar” action card also has a secondary
initiative stat, this time for reaching the target.
 Example:
The Mortar is fired in the air and it
takes 2 more initiative to land. This places the blazing armament on the 2
initiative marker in the 3rd round. It is then resolved with the rest of
the actions from that round.
Why is the system so deep in the timing
aspect?
Timing is everything in battles. Species like the
Wazur are incredibly fast and agile which makes them not only the quickest
to act in battle, but are also able to execute two or even three actions in a single
round.
Within the rules, the system actually allows for
a lot of freedom. Actions interact with one another and can be executed in a
combo or fused together to form a new one (an aspect we will talk about during
play tests on our upcoming channel broadcasts at www.Twitch.tv/MeKhanIXtv ).
 No-Miss Factor
For efficient, quick battling, there is no missing
due to a bad die roll, but it is still possible to miss. The “no-miss”
rule applies only if the target is somehow immobilized or unwilling to move or
dodge the attack.
How does this help the battle?
First, unnecessary die rolls are forfeit unless
the action specifically calls for it. Secondly, many battles systems give you
the opportunity to defend while your character is also in offence. Our systems
rely on the logic that during execution of one (initial) action, say, a kick,
you cannot also use dodge action unless the first action never happened OR the
initial action has a built-in dodge ability.
In the gameplay, the actions string together and
resolve in amazingly complex ways with endless tactical options.                                            ClassesClasses in Exordium are split into 2 categories:
Professions and Elite
Professions unlike Elite are a humble beginning for
every character, Pilot, Engineer, Hunter, but even they can get a little
strange - Bio Technician, Elementalist, Warrior, Druid, Monk, etc. 
Some elites however are more than just bizarre. The
sentient creatures of this world go to great lengths for wisdom and power. By gathering
excessive knowledge they have combined expertise and perpetually evolved
into adepts of their own making.
The Elite classes are also species specific, which
means that no two master species of the same Elite class shares the same
appearance but only similarities.                                                        Locus                                                        Omega
                                                           Titan
                                                             Warmachine

Exordium is a fascinating new
sci-fi realm with a pinch of fantasy, carefully designed to turn a new page in
Pen and Paper RPGs.
The world is filled with amazing
alternative life forms, incredible new minerals, mesmerizing landscapes and
much more. Six master, sentient speciesrule
the planet, but their existence is entangled in a deep, never ending war caused
by lust for dominance, immeasurable cruelty and quite often a “behavior
barrier”. But this is not the complete story, as this world has signs of love,
compassion and kindness emerging from underneath the violence and hatred. Scientists of this world theorize that the planet was
created by three separate fireballs; they inflamed celestial gas
clouds which rapidly formed the hard planetary mass. This quick
solidification relative to the chemical structure of the fireballs created
uneven landmasses, some rich in crystallized minerals, others on
metallic cinder. They also say the fireballs then collided shortly after,
to form what is today the sun. Close observation of the sun backs this theory
by revealing three district territories, burning in different colors.
The outer layer of this planet consists
of sundry gasses in uneven quantities, creating a prism effect which leads
to a difference in sunlight color around the globe.“…Unlike
religious and spiritual beliefs, Tan-Nak scientists theorize that even though
the species are very diverse to the point where their base elements do not
match, they share a common ancestor. Proof for this are similar physical
conditions and disorders observed in each of the master species.”
Tan-Nak
Tangra’s first creations were the so
called Universal Beings named after him. Tangra’s name is a compilation of 3
words “Tan, Nak, Ra” – “Universal, Being, God”. It is heavily debated on which
word comes first, but the meaning “An almighty being of all that exists” is
commonly accepted throughout the three species worshipping Tangra – Tan Nak,
Brotta and Madruk.
The Tan-Nak are considered the first
and foremost specie. Their body shape is what the manuscripts describe as
inspiration for the lesser gods, a template for them to create from.
The Tan-Nak are mainly divided into
two subspecies:
Civilians
The Tan-Nak are pretty much the
default human race. Minor differences make them one of a kind.
They possess a thin white layer over
their eyeballs which act as a brightness enhancer. It also hides their iris
which is disconcerting for other species, who often accuse them of staring. Their
body hair can change colors through the duration of their lives. The colors can
be very bright and saturated.
High population rates, universal adaptability,
regeneration and longevity have kept them from being obliterated by the Brotta
for millennia.


A Tan-Nak can live for over half a millennium (militarized Tan-Nak live a third of that life span). On an average of a hundred years their bodies completely regenerate from an older exhausted version of themselves to a younger and more capable one. In this long process any defects are being mended and lost organs regrown; old teeth fall off and new ones erect.
Given enough time, a Tan-Nak can adapt to live in the throat a volcano, in the arctic tundra at sub-zero degree temperature without any clothing, and even underground without sunlight or sufficient breathable air. Furthermore, they are able to readapt again in a span of two decades.
Next-to-last in physical qualities, but first in population, the Tan-Nak can be found all over the world in all shapes and sizes. They are a force to be reckoned with.

Military




The Military Tan-Nak are modified to the point of no
return. Their lifespan is limited in order to enhance their muscular system as
well as their brain functionality. In their short lives, they undergo a
chemical enhancement called “pumping” through which chemicals are introduced to
induce development of additional muscular fibers and condition the brain to
learn quickly by skipping short term memory, in theory. A brutal, intense
breeding process leaves them underdeveloped. The majority of militaries have
facial disfigurements, lack of eyelid and lips, missing nose cartilage. The
“pumping” process leaves irreparable scars mostly on their backs. Tattooed
indicators of chemicals around the scared areas are also common.




A mask, a coat and an exo-suit are the uniforms they
wear while serving the military, until the day they expire. The masks purify
air, supply additional chemicals if needed and detects harmful airborne
substances. 
The suit designs began as a mechanical exoskeleton
but it was then deemed useless as it did not enforce further strength but
rather superseded it, slowed down the wearer and, very often, got in the way of
work. The new advanced carbon fiber exo-suit tightly enwraps the wearer and has
direct skin contact. It acts as a nerve system enhancer allowing the wearer to
use their full muscular potential. The coat top is made out of fire resistant
fibers and has the strength of a bulletproof vest. The layout of the coat
promotes freedom of movement and gives easy access to smaller equipment through
“hook and loop” fasteners and pockets.

Brotta

The Brotta are a silicon-based life form. They have
evolved and developed their culture in territories with high concentrations of
pure mineral formations.
 

                                             


The Brotta are the supremeconquering force of this world. They
are natural psychopaths and rarely care about the “why”. They do not feel
remorse and have no interest in peaceful negotiations, unless they have a
hidden agenda.
The Brotta are divided in three main subspecies. The
shape of their brains and base skin color is what makes them different. A
crystal-formed skeletal system is the base of their bodies. Their place in the
hierarchy is determined by the several minerals from which their bones are made
of. Royalty and power are especially reserved for those with a diamond-like
skeleton.





They are the tallest known sentient life form. 
They range from 3 to 3.7 meters (9 to 12 feet).
Their faces lackan
oral cavity. Instead they have an air duct connected to a second pair of
nostrils on the back of their neck for speech.
Crystal formations, superseding the chin area up to
the nose, grow outwards and pierce through the skin. They form beard-like ornaments.
Each Brotta has a unique set which is their version of a fingerprint.

                                           


Their arms are unusually long and their hands have
not one but two opposable thumbs, which gives them a good tight grip, and an
incision in the center of the palm. This triple split opening is surrounded by
a soft tissue. The tissuesecretes
compounds which dissolve hard minerals into liquid so that the sponge-like
tissue can absorb it. The bulges on their arms, just under the shoulders, are
small stomachs that process and distribute food.
Their legs are inverted and instead of feet they have
hooves, each split in three parts, two frontal and one on the back. They act as
three toes and help manage rough terrain.
The front of the torso isevenly covered by a
rib-like, dense bone structure. That is the birthing chamber. The back is
segmented and two rotation discs pivots allow lateral bending.
Since the Brotta liquidize their food, no excretory
system is present but instead, sweat out inept liquids through their hoofs and vaporize
gasses through their heads. It is not uncommon to see a Brotta with his scalp
burning blue with fumes.

A specially developed organ in their chest resembles
two rapidly beating hearts which are entangledwith one another. As the hearts beat
out of rhythm, a gyroscopic effect takes place. This mechanism helps the Brotta
to stand straight up and makes them hard to bring down, which makes their
overly tall stature deceptively stable.




In terms of labor, the Brotta rarely use their own
hands. Their hundreds of thousands of slaves do the work for them. From keeping
up the land and growing crystal food, to manufacturing items of use for the Brotta.
The only aspect they keep for themselves is their infamous mineral growing
techniques. By molecularly engineering mineral growth patterns the Brotta are
able to literally erect a building in under a month. Most of their technology,
also kept in secret, is again grow in specific shapes resembling circuit
boards. 
Their weapons and vehicles use energy syphoned by the
mineral deposits underneath their lands. Alas these technologies are useless
outside their old boarders.
Madruk
The Madruk are the embodiment of toughness. Besides a
thick skull, an overly muscular body, and a bad temper, they have shock
absorbing cartilage pads embedded under their skin. Even the females have them
to protect their more susceptible to pain body parts. Furthermore, their skin’s
derma is thick and rubbery, almost bulletproof. The epidermis is rough and
callous. 
The three breasted-body is the Madruk’s
distinguishable earmark. Women birth children in instances of three. Their
heads are bucket-shaped, and skull is unbreakable. Their teeth are wide enough to
be used as secret compartments, while two opposing pairs of them extend outside
the mouth. These teeth are razor sharp and are used to cut the tips of their
cigars. Their hands have three pairs of fingers, each pair mimics one larger
finger. Most Madruk never use these additional divisions. Enlarged feet plates
and hard toesprotect an unusual
organ which captures even the weakest of vibrations.                                             

The common Madruk are hot-headed,
violent, and usually very drunk. They are easily provoked and in
rare occasions so much so that their inner temperature rises to a
point where their derma starts to glow. While infuriated the Madruk are
extremely dangerous but also very fragile as their derma becomes soft
and easily damaged. This process is also called “Tempering” and is necessary to
harden the cartilage
pads of their younger offspring.                   The Madruk faction in power is composed of paranoid
anarchists and their ruling can only be compared to the late stages of
communism and slavery. They drive colossal vehicles, which run on hard fuel, hauling
tens of wagons which contain whole town establishments. This long caravan sets
camp when needed, and the wagons form up a circular defensive perimeter around
the settlement.
The fuel that drives their light escort motor
vehicles, “Kiriya”, is produced from a special fruit mixed with the mineralization
and purification of a moisture loving, pipe dwelling fungus. This liquid is
also congestible and very intoxicating. The word “Kiriya” is from an old Madruk
dialect and can mean not only “booze” but also – victory, a good trading deal,
attack and loot. 
Another faction of
Madruks, the “Highly Intellectual Society”, live in the cold territories far in
the north. They have established their mechanically-advanced cities and
factories away from the anarchists, but are being oppressed by them and forced
to produce much of their arsenal.                                        The
Madruk do celebrate a special day in the year when, they believe, Tangra gave
them life. For this reason a large lone tree is chosen to be engulfed in fire
and burns through the remainder of the night while the Madruks are gorging
around vast tables.BiomatonBiomatons are a
peculiar tribal race of bio-mechanoids. They were the first to create gunpowder
and fireworks, but are not credited for it.
Their biological
half has fused with a metallic mechanical harness to form an incredibly
beneficial symbiosis. Stories told by the elders unveil how this happened to
them. It’s told that
in the past the Biomaton were purely biological, a “Protomaton”. Their
infant bodies grew outwards from a leathery egg and formed the limbs. The story
goes that a protomaton female was running from an enemy tribe where her
offspring was kidnapped to be sacrificed by a shaman. She hid him in an old
scrap pile, which had fallen from the sky islands where the Cyionic reside. When
she came back to feed the infant, it had already started fusing with the
metallic components surrounding it, thus the first Biomaton was born. Since
then the Biomaton have established strict regulation to what components a
metallic harness can be comprised of, to enforce that no weaponry will be
directly fused and concealed by the body.
Instead of hair
they have segmented pipes which transfer nutrition to the brain and acidic
fluid from it. 
The metallically
encased spine is and organ of an upmost curiosity and the central balancing part
of their body. Its stable construction and flexibility allow the torso and arms
to rest freely on top of it. Their ribcage is at float and requires no
additional surrounding muscles.
The spine in
males curves backward from the chest to form a hunch and it is attached on the rare
of the pelvis. In females, it is quite the opposite: the spine arches forward
through the chest and it isattached in the foremost part of
the pelvis, forming a belly-like oval between the pair of egg-bearing breasts.
The males are
formed with one almost completely mechanical arm and their body develops a
biological counterpart which grows in size to balance out the weight for each
side of the chest. The legs are double-jointed and excellent for jumping and
running. Both male and female bodies are fully covered, even the metallic
parts, by a transparentprotective skin layer.
From biological
speaker-like organs to a mechanical hearing apparatus are what these Biomatons
are made of. An incredible one-of-a-kind symbiosis, but not without its
downsides. Their bodies produce two types of blood, one for the biological
parts and one for the mechanical. This creates an abnormal acidity levels,
mostly in the males which, if not cleansed properly, can cause acid-loving life
forms to swarm all over their bodies. The acid is generated in the skull,
transferred down the segmented hair, through the spineand finally extruded
from two waste canals just above their heals  (too brotta or not?). The acidic liquid
also neutralizes any foot prints or scents left by the Biomaton.
The male's pipes
detached and reattached on the females to impregnate them. This process is very
dangerous since females, produce much less acidity and process it slower than
males. If successful, women lay leathery eggs that, until that moment, are
stored in their breasts. The eggs are then placed in a mechanical harness to
develop.                                              
Spiritual beliefs give great importance to eyes.
This is why Biomaton own coconut-sized glass eyes in their huts. Smaller, round
glass containers are used to hold tiny amounts of chemicals. These containers
become fragile when contacted by the Biomaton’s acidic bodily fluid, such as
spit and other secretions, and are then thrown in a group of two or more to
create specific effects: Smoke, fire, flash, stickiness amd others.
Wazur

The Wazur are a
sentient plant life. They may seem humanoid, but they were not always like
that. The last known continent to be discovered, far below the planet’s equator,
was their little piece of heaven. They had thrived and flourished for
millennia, completely oblivious to the other species. The Brotta were the first
to find them and enslave a small part of the population only to find that they
withered and died without freedom. Then a group of military Tan-Nak, burdened
with the mission to find new strategic territories, arrived and discover the sylph
race of seedlings. In an act of fear and disparity, their bodies began
undergoing a reshaping process to imitate their visitors, supposedly to better
communicate with them.



Simply put, the
Wazur are your common plant life, but one that has developed a mind of its own.
Ninety percent of the population of the continent are plant life forms which
have developed legs and visual and vibrational senses.
Their bodies are
networks of soft elastic fiber, the skin is even more so. They are small, but
flexible and extremely quick. 
The wazur’s face
resembles a carved wooden mask in many of its features. This mask and
surrounding skin covers a skull-like hard shell. The shell encompasses a soft
brain tissue from which their whole fiber skeletal structure begins. A
root-like complex also dilates from the shell to form their fictive hair. 
Wazur breathe
carbon dioxide by means of an angular, pyramid-like nose which contrasts with
the rest of the facial features. Their mouth is used mainly for speaking,
because they get their energy via photosynthesis. However, their tongue acts as
a very powerful chemical recognition device. Any substance can be felt and
described by the Wazur.
On their
foreheads, they have a mirror-like oval formation. This is a protrusion of
their skull that penetrates through the maskand is directly
connected to the soft brain tissue. The “mirror” acts as a communication device
between Wazur. Much like an infrared signal, this device sends information and
their skulls act like a receiver. A two-way communication is made when both
Wazur are facing each other. This makes up for unbeatable team work while in a
skirmish.A team of wazur warriors in action is something to behold –
swift, deadly, and acting as one. 

                               


Another
form of communication is the genetic exchange which activates the birthing
process. This exchange is described by the Wazur as a very satisfying
out-of-body experience. After the female has received the genes she produces a
large seed which is then placed in the ground for a beautiful birthing tree to cultivate.
The tree then sprouts many fruit which contain small Wazur seedlings. After the fruit matures it drops off
the tree branch to fall on large cushion-like leaves underneath and slide to
solid ground, where it is collected by breeders. The Wazur do not see children
as someone else’s progeny. They collect and take care of seedlings as a group,
the tree produces more than a handful of offspring.


The wazur body
can regenerate, much like a lizard’s tail. This lets them regrow a whole limb
in a matter of days. In fact, a wazur can survive even a decapitation, provided
the head is then permanently rooted to the ground to be kept alive.
They have long
legs, but that is only because they are digitigrade. The foot and heel arelocked
in a vertical position and take up a third of the leg. This mode of walking on
their toes makes them nimble and silent in their legs. When needed, however,
the ankle joints can be released to move into a plantigrade position, which
allows them to perform leaps and accelerate rapidly.
The “Neyd” wazur
are a subspecies genetically modified by the Tan Nak by splicing the birthing
tree with a Neyd tree. These Wazur can be short fused. Their physical
appearance is more of an old tree, because of their quickly hardening skin which
then peels off.


Since
the Wazur are surrounded by quadruped plants, they use them as cattle and even
graft useful objects directly onto them. Wazur can be seen riding a
rhinoceros-like creature with a plant-grown throne grafted directly to it. This
way if the add-on is damaged it will self-repair by tapping into the host
creature’s life force.


Cyionic

In this
world where bizarre is normal, the Cyionic are the odd species.


These beings are literally created by two Queen
mothers which use them as every day laborers. Their bodies are arsenic-based which
predisposes them to an alloy shell. Alloys, wires and mercury plasma mimic a
biological body. Most of them are created without a personality. They start off
featureless with a singular sensation encompassed by their hyper sensitive hair
fibers. The top skin layer is a cushiony, elastic alloy covered by hair fibers
shaped like hooks. These metallic hairs are used to connect the Cyionic to a
number of technological devices that are placed directly onto the skin and held
there by the combined strength of the hairs. These devices enable them to
function as any other creature by giving them visual and vibrational input but
these upgrades go far beyond basic senses




Their heads
have a wheel-shaped organ placed halfway through the skull. This is their
brain, and it spins as they process thoughts and commands.
Another
fascinating aspect of their lives is that they consume metals for nutrition.
The metals are dissolved and distributed around the body to feed their alloy
base. If a single metal is consumed in larger quantities the outer skin of the
Cyionic becomes saturated with that metal. The metal’s properties apply to the
Cyionic which has its upsides and downsides.
They live
on top of narrow mountains called “Sky islands” by the Biomaton. Cyionic and
Biomaton share a continent but are divided by height. Cyionic have no need for
interaction with anyone else but themselves. The Biomaton praise the
technologically advanced species as demi-gods.


The flora and the fauna of
this worldcan easily be confused since both have specimens who act as
the other. 
There is a great variety
in life forms, based on various base elements and structures: exo-skeletal
silicon based creatures; tree shaped mammals; metallic plants; reptilian quadruped plants;  acid-loving swarms of
flies; and rainbow colored plant sharks - just to name a few.

We have been working on several ideas including
- NFC chips in the base of the Miniatures for storing character information (easily accessible through a phone)
- Laser pointer tripod with changeable tip, projecting combat rulers for range weapons, grenades and mines etc.



- Mechanical, pressure activated, tiled platform which can be arranged and rearranged with several types traps (under the tile). Acts as a booby-trapped dungeon.
- A Camera + Projector device which will:



Scan the battlefield from above


Project it on a computer screen


GM can then project combat rulers directly onto the battlefield


Can also place hidden landmines that will not be projected on the field until someone walks into its range.


We know these ideas sound overly ambitious but they are not impossible.




We are prepared to ship out as soon as we have the plastic figures. But the book itself will not be ready. We have many new illustrations to make and will refine the systems with your help. 
Check out our twitch channel @ www.twitch.tv/MeKhanIXtv
And since we want YOU to be part of this process, we have decided to ship the game in a two phases.
Phase 1: Estimated Delivery – between February and April 2016
We will ship all the plastic models immediately after production. You will also receive a pdf file containing the latest systems so you can playtest with us and give us your feedback.
Updates to those systems will be resent by email on a regular basis.
Phase 2: Estimated Delivery – August 2016
Ship out the Core Manual and paper materials as soon as they are ready.


                Risk and Challenges

As a start up company we know that mistakes will be made along the way. We feel confident that no unnecessary delays will occurs since we will be manufacturing our products locally with the help of a experienced plastic manufacturer and book publishers. We can not outsource the game since we will be expecting the utmost quality. Rest assured we are working with professionals who will guide us through difficulties.
Our Core Manual however is more susceptible to delays due to proof reading, editing and most importantly adequate artwork and content structure. We want only the best for outr contributers! Because of that we have decided to send regular updates of the manual on PDF to all that have contributed beyond the "Core Manula + Dice perk", that way you can not only track our progress, but also play along with us.

     Thank you for contributing!

story:
Who we are

We are Darklight Gaming LLC.  We are a U.S. veteran owned company, with other veterans on our team, and we've been working on a title, and we are at that point where it comes down to funding.  You have to have money, to make a great product!  Your contribution will help make our title bigger and better than it is now.  

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $20,000.  That money will go towards us being able to bring on more people, such as graphics and artists to help make our game look, feel, and play better than it does right now.  With our perks, you will get behind the scenes peeks at our games development, from start to finish, you can get early access to the game, shirts, beta/alpha access, and even more awesome things like getting to design a character that will be a big part of the game, or creating your own secret area side by side with the developers!  


Risks & Challenges

Being an indie company right now means that we have little funds except for the money out of our own pocket to create a finished and polished project.  We have the programmers we need, but we are struggling to obtain artists to help us create better assets to make our game content feel and look better.  We have the know how, experience, and capability,  but now we need to bring in the big guns to bring our game into the current standard for gaming!


If you are unable to help with a contribution, we would thank and appreciate any sharing of our campaign, to help spread the word!

story:
After the game is launched it will be available

FROM HERE: http://demonest.com

Demonest saluts You!



3 years ago we were playing online games in absolutely different world places and did not know each other. We met in social networks of online games - we not only played games, we dreamed of contributing to the world of games.

There was some inherited driver that finally let 5 smart people gather in one place. Dedication that each member of the team shown was tremendous. We were «sleeping» with the Game.

What basically distinguished us from other developers - was that each of us has only essential knowledge of design, programming, engine development, 3D models, texturing, animation, story writing. Except for our «Big Brother» - John Warkit who was the founder, soul and the heart of our team.

We gathered to make a dream possible, to prove that dedication to follow the dream can cross borders, unite people, overcome difficulties, reach targets.
We wanted to add fun and laughs to people's stressful lives.


How Many People Are On Our Team?

The team consist of 8 people: 2 developers C#/Java, 1 engine master, 2 Modellers & Animators, 2 designers, and 1 Project manager.
5 team members are full-time and 3 are part-time.




Who Funded The Development Before?

We paid for everything by our own cash: we rented office for two years, purchased computers, software, licenses, servers, office equipment, etc. We tried to spend less on human needs and put all the saved to the Game. Be sure that we used all our resources but we finally need help.

Two years of development consumed almost all our financial resources.




We Have Nothing More, But Only This Great Fantasy Game.

Every part of the game is well worked out during two years of hard work of our 8 team members. We spent more than 10 000 hours working together and we are still full of enthusiasm to finalize the Game!

An output should be amazing if you help us a bit!


We Need Your Help!

Please help us to our goal of $40,000! This will really help us make the final effort to make a deeply elaborated fantesy game which will be able to play
ABSOLUTELY FREE for people of ALL OVER THE WORLD in several languages.

NO CLIENT PROGRAMS to DOWNLOAD, the Game will be available
to PLAY DIRECTLY FROM BROWSER.


Glimpse Of The Work That Needs To Be Done:

The $40,000 will be used to fund the final expenses to launch the Game. And to say the least, we are more than excited to make this!

Be sure that every your contribution will find exact place in our game:
  • we will make the final compilation of the game engine
  • we will buy hardware parts for servers necessary to support fast play of many people simultaneously
  • add new 3D models of monsters, weapons, armor sets
  • pay for sounds from composers and additional drawings from artists



Target Funded: All mentioned over here will be finalized.

Acceleration: More fun, laughs, adventures, and team play with more locations, monsters, items, music, fantasy drawings, events.

All Plans Come To Life: All our fantasy ideas (believe there are a lot of them) that we wished to see in the Game will be created and added to Demonest.


When Will We Launch Demonest If We Get Funded?

We promise to start the game on the 1 of september 2015.
It could be reached after launching from here: http://demonest.com


Contribution Perks Delivery Schedule!

We appreciate everyone who contributes to our goal to finalize the Game which, again, will be FREE TO PLAY.

Perks Undying Respect, Sword of Triumph, Sword and Shield of Triumph, Ascension of Triumph and Karhar Armor will be available from the very first day of launching the Game (1st of September 2015).

Owners of Perks Personal Armor, and Legendary Pack will get all gifts of all mentioned above perks starting from the 1st of September 2015, but specific gifts of these sets will be available from the 1st of November 2015 because we will need some time to create unique personal gifts for each contributor.


What We Want To Give To The Community?



We would love to see new players discover Demonest and casual players get back into the Game!

By creating the Game we eliminated all we think is stressful and left all enough for laughs. We are making the game different and fun through new features.

After Demonest is started anyone will be able to get a fast fun of cleaning out the Kingdom from evil creatures which will definitely help reduce stress of hard working days.

Fantasy lovers will be able to plunge in deeply elaborated fantasy universe with 5 struggling orders, 2 fractions of Janur and Dragfar, and the Darkness, whose evil creatures look for anyone stayed alive to make dead.


«Big Work» Can Hardly Explain Shortly To What We Have Almost Done:

3D FIGHTING: The core of the Game is 3D combat between players' characters and creatures of Darkness (PvE) which can be met on vast territories of the Kingdom and of course combats between players (PvP).

Use tens combinations of blows and cool options to outwit the opponent and win the battle! Beat terrible creatures wherever met in Demonest, achieve evil's lair on the North and engage with servants of Darkness, deserve glory and put your name in the Chronicle of Demonest.



ATMOSPHERE: We prepared sounds and music to all locations and actions from bard songs to cementary fears, 3000 prepared images and interface elements, male and female main characters, 50 fully equipped and animated 3D mosters and raid bosses, hundreds of quests, fantesy stories and descriptions.



ITEMS: Possibility to search for the best combinations of equipment from thousands of unique elements available in 3D, sets with extra bonuses of light or darkness stamp, totems, rare artifacts, armor and weapon sets and special magic items, spells, elixirs, weapons with spiritual features.




CHARACTERS AND GAMEPLAY: More than 150 parameters per character (male or female), more than 60 parameters per each weapon, hundreds of interconnected features and events defining the game process with non-linear story, balanced gameplay. Ranks, achievements, reputation, skills. Ability to get resources, trade them with other players and NPC. Communication with other players: chat, forum, social networks. Experience peaceful or military style of the game.



MONSTERS: More than 100 monsters in more than 20 unique locations with different inhabitants and contructions such as marauders' camp, orcs' colosseum, rat holes, and many others. 20 parameters influencing the behavior of each monster. Social monsters summon disciples of the darkness at the moment of danger and attack together. The closer to the evil's lair, the more terrible and dangerous creatures can be met. Agressive monsters attack first without warning. The more dangerous is the defeated enemy, the better armor, weapon or artifacts can be obtained.



TEAM PLAY: Find friends and reach locations where only team players can defeat. Win raid bosses and defend locations. Join already existing community or create your own clan.

Develop clan halls, get clan resources, create clan weapons and armors, protect the honour of clan and fraction, participate in Clan Wars.




Help Promote Demonest!

Share, Like, Tweet, any bit helps! We will be regularly updating and promoting the Demonest on our social media sites.
