OK, here's round two !    From the top again, end to end, for a full understanding of our work efforts and this wonderful offer to get the this fund raising campaign off the ground;

Out of production for over 30 years, newly redesigned . . . presented now to the Sailor’s of the World . . . . The Sailor’s Game™  Sail’s Again !!

The Sailor’s Game™ is an exciting, educational & entertaining board game that challenges a players knowledge & ability in a competitive, around the world sailboat race. The Sailor’s Game™ presents a serious contest of judgment, strategy & general knowledge that will challenge the “Old Salts” & educate “New Hands” presenting 2,160 Questions over 6 categories.

The Sailor’s Game™ may be played by 2 to 5 individuals and/or teams. The game design encourages interaction among players with similar as well as different levels of seamanship, general knowledge, skills and life experiences.

The Sailor’s Game™ is a competitive “Race Around the World”, circumnavigating the continent of Antarctica, sailing through the Southern Ocean.

A BRIEF HISTORY: The Sailor’s Game™ was originally designed by Rod Stephens with friends and associates.  Rod Stephens, brother of Olin Stephens of world the renown naval architect firm, Sparkman & Stephens, was a noted naval architect, author and accomplished sailor.

The original The Sailor’s Game™ has been out of production since 1986. A group of lifelong sailor’s that work in whale research, scientific marine instrument design, marine research in whales and dolphin communications and ocean conservation, saw the game as something that needed to “come back” - and, be better, redesigned to meet requirements that make the game set a “very high quality”, vessel based product, and be a tough product that would last a lifetime and stow well aboard any vessel. And of course, stow well at home too.

So, the process began to bring a newly designed The Sailor’s Game™ back into production, which has taken several years, as it was done as side work by very busy people. Here’s what we changed to build a superior quality game set and meet mold, mildew resistant and waterproof standards, we felt this beautiful and timeless game title deserves.

THE CARDBOARD BOX IS GONE. It has been replaced with a clear poly chart tube using RED and GREEN vinyl “Running Caps” for air tight & waterproof stowage of the complete game set. It measures 3 inches in diameter and is 24 inches long. Shown here with the shipping box (4"x 4" x 25"). Total shipping weight is 4lbs.

THE CARDBOARD GAMEBOARD IS GONE; The new “canvas play” was created from scratch, using the original icons and verbiage, all digitally cleaned to a hi-res finish for production. The new “canvas play” artwork was mastered using several applications to arrive at a beautiful art piece for printing. The original cartoonish center art, depicting Earth, was replaced with an agronomic view of Earth as seen in a satellite photo image view from space. The 5 rows of diamond shaped “canvas play” “WAVES” are distributed 360º in 2, 20 point, 5 ring stars at 18º of separation with inside and outside points to comprise a total of 40 columns of 5 rows of “WAVES” at 9º of separation between them. There are 200 WAVES.

We added numbers to all columns of “WAVES” to enable a race, to be stopped, logged and “continued in the next port of call”, as a race, could take place over a long period of time.  The new “canvas play” is printed using a solvent dye process on “Old World Sailcloth” type material and is not only a beautiful piece of artwork, it’s WATERPROOF and cleans easily. The new “canvas play” is designed to roll up and stow nicely in the clear poly chart tube and rolls out and relaxes for a race challenge, quite well. The new “canvas play” measures 2 Feet LOA with a 2 Foot Beam. (24" x 24")

THE RACING YACHTS; The original “Racing Yachts” , were 2” solid cast, pewter, designed after 5 Sparkman & Stephens yacht designs. The original castings were not quite the quality we were seeking, so we enlisted the talents of a top jeweler/engraver in San Francisco, to clean the lines, sails, hulls and rebuild the keels of an original set and re-engrave the numbers on the sails; 1 ~ 5.  These new masters were used to make new molds for casting the new S&S “Racing Yachts” 

We then looked at polished NICKEL over the original pewter castings and decided to make the extra expenditure for the polished NICKEL design. They are literally beautiful (and heavy) and we feel they make up the perfect mate to wonderful, high quality set that will last a lifetime. Each of the “Racing Yachts” come in their own black velvet drawstring jewelry bag for protection. As with newly minted coins as “Proofs”, the “Racing Yachts” are packed poly wrapped, un-touched by human hands. After completing the development process and started the manufacturing process, we built a limited number of game sets for distribution and began to prepare marketing plans.  We came up with the idea to have sample racing yachts made in polished BRONZE, for the "CLASSIC VESSEL" look. Although more expensive to make, the results were very beautiful racing yachts, so we have added an option for polished BRONZE games sets.  We now offer these two sets: "Standard Edition in Polished NICKEL" racing yachts and "Classic Edition in Polished BRONZE" racing yachts.

Standard Edition in Polished NICKEL (above)

Classic Edition in Polished BRONZE (above)

THE GAME CARDS; The 360 card set of game cards, presenting 2,160 Questions & (2,160) Answers, are very close to the originals, with little change in the Questions & Answers, only to reflect removal of outdated content and addition some new to-date content, as well as the “Know Your Basic Knots” questions and new “penalties & hazards” that make the the race even more “challenging and risky”, even to the best of sailor’s.

The new cards shape has changed, making them a little longer and not quite as tall, allowing a nice fit in the chart tube, along with everything else. The game cards are printed on poly coated, mildew resistant 100lb. card stock.

BASIC KNOTS TO KNOW;  With the addition of the possibility of a question being drawn that requires a player to “tie a specific knot”, the game set includes 2, 24” lengths of SAMSON XLS Yacht Braid, and a 6” wood tie railing w/ mooring cleat with a “Know Your Basic Knots” reference plate for judging correctness by the other racers. The 6 Basic Knots are depicted graphically on the 2 sided waterproof "Basic Knots to Know" plate.

THE INFORMATION & RULES PLATES;  The 6 page “Information and Rules of Play”, 2 Page “Review of the Rules”, 2 Page "Basic Knots to Know” and the 2 sided "Game Log" are printed on iGage™ waterproof map making, 10mil media and are tough, tear-resistant and fully waterproof as well.

 

The Sailor's Game is an excellent addition to any yacht, power or sail, large or small and great to have at home as well.

The Sailor's Game is a hit at Yacht Clubs and with Armchair Sailor's as well.  The Sailor's Game presents questions based on world history and general knowledge as well, allowing for great enjoyment of play by non-sailor's as well.

 

The Sailor's Game makes for an impressive gift, that will greatly surprise any recipient.

 

FROM THE WEBSITE: "About" pdf                       www.thesailorsgame.com

The Sailor’s Game is an exciting, educational and entertaining board game that challenges a sailor’s knowledge and ability in a competitive, around the world sailboat race. The Sailor’s Game presents a serious contest of judgment, strategy and general knowledge that will challenge the “Old Salts” and educate “New Hands” . . . . . . . . 

The Sailor’s Game may be played by 2 to 5 individuals and/or teams. The game design encourages interaction among players with similar as well as different levels of seamanship, general knowledge, sailing skills and experience. 

The Sailor’s Game is a very competitive “Race Around the World”, circumnavigating the continent of Antarctica, sailing through the massive Southern Ocean presenting players with 2,160 questions drawn from 6 categories that include: Basic Seamanship,Yachts & Equipment, General Knowledge, Maritime History & Knowledge, Navigation and Advanced Seamanship. 

“Old Salts” may tackle questions on seamanship and navigation while “New Hands” learn the basics. Everyone gains familiarity with the nighttime sky, oceanography, etiquette, safety, maritime history, traditions of the sea and sailing strategies. 

The Sailor’s Game is an incredible maritime and world history learning tool as well as a fun test of strategy, whits and knowledge, for all players. 

 

"What's in the Box"

The Sailor’s Game Standard NICKEL Edition or Classic BRONZE Edition contains: a 24” by 24” waterproof, full colour game canvas printed on “Old World Sailcloth”, 5, 2” Tall, Solid cast polished NICKEL or BRONZE, Sparkman & Stephens Racing Yachts, each in a black velvet jewelry pouch, a 360 Game Card Set presenting 2,160 Questions (and 2,160 Answers), 2, 24” SAMSON XLS Yacht Braid lengths, a 6” wood tie railing w/ mooring cleat, waterproof/tear resistant “Information & Rules of Play”, “Rules in Review”, “Basic Knots too Know” and “Log Book” plates, all housed in a clear, poly chart tube with vinyl “Port & Starboard Running Caps” 

Designed to last, a lifetime . . . . . . . .

*** The Sailor’s Game™ ships in a 4” by 4” by 25” Box and Weighs 4 Pounds

 

NOTES FROM THE PRODUCER:  The Sailor’s Game STANDARD EDITION full game set features Polished NICKEL Sparkman & Stephens Racing Yachts.   The Sailor’s Game CLASSIC EDITION full game set features Polished BRONZE Sparkman & Stephens Racing Yachts.   All other contents of The Sailor's Game are identical, in both editions.

The Sailor's Game is not inexpensive to produced. We did not choose to use cheap materials or cut costs by using lower quality materials or production processes.  The Sailor's Game has been produced to highest possible standards and presents a quality product that will last a lifetime.

Additionally, the massive base of questions at 2,160, provides for a wide spectrum of knowledge bases for all players to participate in a sail race challenge that will educate as well as test, whits, general knowledge, the build of strategies and beyond, not to mention friendships and relationships.

The Sailor's Game IS NOT an APP. Nor a video game, nor has it been designed to be. The Sailor's Game is designed for people to be "together" in one place, at one time, together in a fun, social and entertaining atmosphere. Something that seems to be a bit lost in our today's modern society.  We think it's a good idea to "bring people together" again . . . . . what a novel idea.

Lastly, 100% of all funds received from the sale of The Sailor's Game are donated to and are to ennui to the benefit of The Whale Research Institute to support it's continuing efforts in marine research instrument design, engineering, builds, deployment and operation, Ocean conservation efforts and the open sharing and distribution of research materials to educational institutions and the general public, worldwide, at no cost to anyone.

Please visit our website to learn more.   www.whaleresearchinstitute.org

Thank you for your support and we hope you enjoy The Sailor's Game as much as we do. We're honored to be the producers of this wonderful product.

PRIVACY NOTICE:  In closing, you will notice, we do not participate as part of any social media sites. You can not "Like Us" on Facebook or 'Follow Us" on Twitter, etc.

Backers information with this campaign will be retained in complete confidence and will not be shared with any third party(ies) or other privacy invading entities in any way.
story_txt: OK, here's round two !    From the top again, end to end, for a full understanding of our work efforts and this wonderful offer to get the this fund raising campaign off the ground;Out of production for over 30 years, newly redesigned . . . presented now to the Sailor’s of the World . . . . The Sailor’s Game™  Sail’s Again !!The Sailor’s Game™ is an exciting, educational & entertaining board game that challenges a players knowledge & ability in a competitive, around the world sailboat race. The Sailor’s Game™ presents a serious contest of judgment, strategy & general knowledge that will challenge the “Old Salts” & educate “New Hands” presenting 2,160 Questions over 6 categories.The Sailor’s Game™ may be played by 2 to 5 individuals and/or teams. The game design encourages interaction among players with similar as well as different levels of seamanship, general knowledge, skills and life experiences.The Sailor’s Game™ is a competitive “Race Around the World”, circumnavigating the continent of Antarctica, sailing through the Southern Ocean.A BRIEF HISTORY: The Sailor’s Game™ was originally designed by Rod Stephens with friends and associates.  Rod Stephens, brother of Olin Stephens of world the renown naval architect firm, Sparkman & Stephens, was a noted naval architect, author and accomplished sailor.The original The Sailor’s Game™ has been out of production since 1986. A group of lifelong sailor’s that work in whale research, scientific marine instrument design, marine research in whales and dolphin communications and ocean conservation, saw the game as something that needed to “come back” - and, be better, redesigned to meet requirements that make the game set a “very high quality”, vessel based product, and be a tough product that would last a lifetime and stow well aboard any vessel. And of course, stow well at home too.So, the process began to bring a newly designed The Sailor’s Game™ back into production, which has taken several years, as it was done as side work by very busy people. Here’s what we changed to build a superior quality game set and meet mold, mildew resistant and waterproof standards, we felt this beautiful and timeless game title deserves.THE CARDBOARD BOX IS GONE. It has been replaced with a clear poly chart tube using RED and GREEN vinyl “Running Caps” for air tight & waterproof stowage of the complete game set. It measures 3 inches in diameter and is 24 inches long. Shown here with the shipping box (4"x 4" x 25"). Total shipping weight is 4lbs.THE CARDBOARD GAMEBOARD IS GONE; The new “canvas play” was created from scratch, using the original icons and verbiage, all digitally cleaned to a hi-res finish for production. The new “canvas play” artwork was mastered using several applications to arrive at a beautiful art piece for printing. The original cartoonish center art, depicting Earth, was replaced with an agronomic view of Earth as seen in a satellite photo image view from space. The 5 rows of diamond shaped “canvas play” “WAVES” are distributed 360º in 2, 20 point, 5 ring stars at 18º of separation with inside and outside points to comprise a total of 40 columns of 5 rows of “WAVES” at 9º of separation between them. There are 200 WAVES.We added numbers to all columns of “WAVES” to enable a race, to be stopped, logged and “continued in the next port of call”, as a race, could take place over a long period of time.  The new “canvas play” is printed using a solvent dye process on “Old World Sailcloth” type material and is not only a beautiful piece of artwork, it’s WATERPROOF and cleans easily. The new “canvas play” is designed to roll up and stow nicely in the clear poly chart tube and rolls out and relaxes for a race challenge, quite well. The new “canvas play” measures 2 Feet LOA with a 2 Foot Beam. (24" x 24")THE RACING YACHTS; The original “Racing Yachts” , were 2” solid cast, pewter, designed after 5 Sparkman & Stephens yacht designs. The original castings were not quite the quality we were seeking, so we enlisted the talents of a top jeweler/engraver in San Francisco, to clean the lines, sails, hulls and rebuild the keels of an original set and re-engrave the numbers on the sails; 1 ~ 5.  These new masters were used to make new molds for casting the new S&S “Racing Yachts” We then looked at polished NICKEL over the original pewter castings and decided to make the extra expenditure for the polished NICKEL design. They are literally beautiful (and heavy) and we feel they make up the perfect mate to wonderful, high quality set that will last a lifetime. Each of the “Racing Yachts” come in their own black velvet drawstring jewelry bag for protection. As with newly minted coins as “Proofs”, the “Racing Yachts” are packed poly wrapped, un-touched by human hands. After completing the development process and started the manufacturing process, we built a limited number of game sets for distribution and began to prepare marketing plans.  We came up with the idea to have sample racing yachts made in polished BRONZE, for the "CLASSIC VESSEL" look. Although more expensive to make, the results were very beautiful racing yachts, so we have added an option for polished BRONZE games sets.  We now offer these two sets: "Standard Edition in Polished NICKEL" racing yachts and "Classic Edition in Polished BRONZE" racing yachts.Standard Edition in Polished NICKEL (above)Classic Edition in Polished BRONZE (above)THE GAME CARDS; The 360 card set of game cards, presenting 2,160 Questions & (2,160) Answers, are very close to the originals, with little change in the Questions & Answers, only to reflect removal of outdated content and addition some new to-date content, as well as the “Know Your Basic Knots” questions and new “penalties & hazards” that make the the race even more “challenging and risky”, even to the best of sailor’s.The new cards shape has changed, making them a little longer and not quite as tall, allowing a nice fit in the chart tube, along with everything else. The game cards are printed on poly coated, mildew resistant 100lb. card stock.BASIC KNOTS TO KNOW;  With the addition of the possibility of a question being drawn that requires a player to “tie a specific knot”, the game set includes 2, 24” lengths of SAMSON XLS Yacht Braid, and a 6” wood tie railing w/ mooring cleat with a “Know Your Basic Knots” reference plate for judging correctness by the other racers. The 6 Basic Knots are depicted graphically on the 2 sided waterproof "Basic Knots to Know" plate.THE INFORMATION & RULES PLATES;  The 6 page “Information and Rules of Play”, 2 Page “Review of the Rules”, 2 Page "Basic Knots to Know” and the 2 sided "Game Log" are printed on iGage™ waterproof map making, 10mil media and are tough, tear-resistant and fully waterproof as well. The Sailor's Game is an excellent addition to any yacht, power or sail, large or small and great to have at home as well.The Sailor's Game is a hit at Yacht Clubs and with Armchair Sailor's as well.  The Sailor's Game presents questions based on world history and general knowledge as well, allowing for great enjoyment of play by non-sailor's as well. The Sailor's Game makes for an impressive gift, that will greatly surprise any recipient. FROM THE WEBSITE: "About" pdf                       www.thesailorsgame.comThe Sailor’s Game is an exciting, educational and entertaining board game that challenges a sailor’s knowledge and ability in a competitive, around the world sailboat race. The Sailor’s Game presents a serious contest of judgment, strategy and general knowledge that will challenge the “Old Salts” and educate “New Hands” . . . . . . . . The Sailor’s Game may be played by 2 to 5 individuals and/or teams. The game design encourages interaction among players with similar as well as different levels of seamanship, general knowledge, sailing skills and experience. The Sailor’s Game is a very competitive “Race Around the World”, circumnavigating the continent of Antarctica, sailing through the massive Southern Ocean presenting players with 2,160 questions drawn from 6 categories that include: Basic Seamanship,Yachts & Equipment, General Knowledge, Maritime History & Knowledge, Navigation and Advanced Seamanship. “Old Salts” may tackle questions on seamanship and navigation while “New Hands” learn the basics. Everyone gains familiarity with the nighttime sky, oceanography, etiquette, safety, maritime history, traditions of the sea and sailing strategies. The Sailor’s Game is an incredible maritime and world history learning tool as well as a fun test of strategy, whits and knowledge, for all players.  "What's in the Box"The Sailor’s Game Standard NICKEL Edition or Classic BRONZE Edition contains: a 24” by 24” waterproof, full colour game canvas printed on “Old World Sailcloth”, 5, 2” Tall, Solid cast polished NICKEL or BRONZE, Sparkman & Stephens Racing Yachts, each in a black velvet jewelry pouch, a 360 Game Card Set presenting 2,160 Questions (and 2,160 Answers), 2, 24” SAMSON XLS Yacht Braid lengths, a 6” wood tie railing w/ mooring cleat, waterproof/tear resistant “Information & Rules of Play”, “Rules in Review”, “Basic Knots too Know” and “Log Book” plates, all housed in a clear, poly chart tube with vinyl “Port & Starboard Running Caps” Designed to last, a lifetime . . . . . . . .*** The Sailor’s Game™ ships in a 4” by 4” by 25” Box and Weighs 4 Pounds NOTES FROM THE PRODUCER:  The Sailor’s Game STANDARD EDITION full game set features Polished NICKEL Sparkman & Stephens Racing Yachts.   The Sailor’s Game CLASSIC EDITION full game set features Polished BRONZE Sparkman & Stephens Racing Yachts.   All other contents of The Sailor's Game are identical, in both editions.The Sailor's Game is not inexpensive to produced. We did not choose to use cheap materials or cut costs by using lower quality materials or production processes.  The Sailor's Game has been produced to highest possible standards and presents a quality product that will last a lifetime.Additionally, the massive base of questions at 2,160, provides for a wide spectrum of knowledge bases for all players to participate in a sail race challenge that will educate as well as test, whits, general knowledge, the build of strategies and beyond, not to mention friendships and relationships.The Sailor's Game IS NOT an APP. Nor a video game, nor has it been designed to be. The Sailor's Game is designed for people to be "together" in one place, at one time, together in a fun, social and entertaining atmosphere. Something that seems to be a bit lost in our today's modern society.  We think it's a good idea to "bring people together" again . . . . . what a novel idea.Lastly, 100% of all funds received from the sale of The Sailor's Game are donated to and are to ennui to the benefit of The Whale Research Institute to support it's continuing efforts in marine research instrument design, engineering, builds, deployment and operation, Ocean conservation efforts and the open sharing and distribution of research materials to educational institutions and the general public, worldwide, at no cost to anyone.Please visit our website to learn more.   www.whaleresearchinstitute.orgThank you for your support and we hope you enjoy The Sailor's Game as much as we do. We're honored to be the producers of this wonderful product.PRIVACY NOTICE:  In closing, you will notice, we do not participate as part of any social media sites. You can not "Like Us" on Facebook or 'Follow Us" on Twitter, etc.Backers information with this campaign will be retained in complete confidence and will not be shared with any third party(ies) or other privacy invading entities in any way.

story:
“In the abyss of broken world, something crossed down from the sky to a new horizon of fate, ending upon a stumbled lights, trembling..  is it  could save us or just another bridge to misery ?”

Since ancient ages, in the darkest time of humanity on Etherim, there’s something that can’t be changed. A war, upon a lust and desire for a great and greater power, and then mentioned in every ruin.. the mark of God and Goddess, Crossfate.

Crossfate fell upon a chosen live in the world of Etherim, to lead a disaster to an end, to make people can share and giving. It’s a power for a puny human become one of Gods. The chance to create something or be something.

Upon this greatness and legend, since the fifth generation of Etherim Crossfate, a great war happens between powers, desire and terrors. Including the Order of Witches who gathered in a sacred hills and promise, the one who chase Crossfate most. The symbol of destruction and curse, now back again after thousand years of silent.

In the comeback of the witches, here comes the protagoinst, Vanessa. a valiant, brave, though and rough. A violent but caring, a type of someone who can be hates human but so protective over weak things. Meet with the enigmatic espers who lost in the depth of Illusion forest named Kara. Both must survive from the disastrous spirit explosion, and find the fact both was related to Crossfate, alongside with another fifteen destined marks.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Vanessa, a tough girl with complicated personality. Someone who's always managed to draw the Gods' interest, even before she was given a name.


At the age of 12, a young valkyr, whose name was Trance, decided to descend from Arch Divina with the intention to solely end Vanessa's life. Judging the sins of a dangerous and forbidden entity.

However, unexpectedly, the little girl was given a second chance in the form of new life and memory. It is still unknown for what happened between the girl and the valkyr, thanks to this matter, Vanessa grew into an independent, strong girl.


Until she reached 19 years old, Vanessa who was still in denial state, ready or not will be dragged in a chain of unpleasant events focused around her. Exceeding the facts of her body, soul, and past life

The reality that she was going to take on was too unfathomable, even more than the mystery of the illusion forrest and the enigmatic land of Etherim itself.

*) the pic of the game realm shall be updated soon after we finished finalize it.

Play as the pretty tsundere Vanessa, a violent but caring, a naive savage in a broken  worlds and society

In her fate fightings, Vanessa would be crossed with another destined individuals who were also represent a certain fate written on their paths.  

*Kara, the second main protagoinst, we have two pov story!

**There's still 13 more playables characters, we'll update soon with a propper image. But if you want to see the alpha design, you can check gallery.

-----

Villain

-----

What's in the world happen around Vanessa and how can be this denial, naive-savage, a violent but caring girl must raise her weapon and struggling in a midst of war and conspiracy between legend, hope, terror and sacrifice. . .


The answer is. . .

Nachsichten Witches. .

the veteran from Crossfate Wars, they who seeks power of God to create an ideal world in different ways.

*)alpha design, there's still 6 more, excluding slot for anyone who pick the 'witches perk'. You can get involved directly with the story,


The war on witches never stop in every inch of the world, even on the darkside itself, there's always be a bloodshed of judgment, revenge and redemption. Resulting a pinch even they're surrendered in peace, the witches always be executed.

A cursed vampire-witch named Aleysha then comes with a plan to end their sufferings by ressurecting Helvetica and bring the witches to be great again.

The event centered on a vast yet so absurd Illusion forest, the place where our valiant brave girl just happen to passed by on her daily works at the same time as Nachsichten Witches start their sacred dark ressurection rituals.

This is where Vanessa start her worst days ever, meet with a silent traumatic esper girl named Kara. Both must survive from the chaos, nightmare and distortions. They even  find themselves marked with Destined Symbols of Crossfate, triggering the next epic battle misery again after thousands years of a fake peace.

------------------------------------------------

There's many mystery to resolve. Many faction and sides that join the war, alongside with its people with their own mark of destiny and problems.

Led them into the battlefield and end this another tragedy with all of your might!


"In the arcadia, below  your destiny, the next doom prophecies filled with blank pages. Is it no hope? or it's a chance to write something new? you decide."

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

And we, the developer team needs your supports to make this game finished as it must.

Every fund we receive, will be distributed to. . .

1. Game CG Arts

This game need a lot of epic and interesting art to support characters, moment and storyline. Some important event will be show a splash art like a visual novel to give certain impression.

And Etherim is a unique place and set, with Illusion forest in it, we need the background shown just like on concept. not to mention the ancient civilization and its ruins.

2. Soundtrack & BGM

To make the game more alive, we need good soundtracks, and for further development, important dialogue will be dubbed.

Below is the basic works of soundtracks of our development team.


We need more variation right, so why not start with supporting us to make this great!

3. System Engineer

We're using customized plugins for certain feature, like nelow we have concept of party manager using cards with symbol of destiny. You'll see locked characters in shadow before you recruit them.


This thing connected directly to storyline, where the destined individuals has been marked with symbols and a certain alchemist civilization make the prophecies based on this.

Another feature need to be worked with advanced plugin making skills, otherwise we will just focus on storyline and art if we didnt reach the goals.

4. Co-Writer

For your enjoyment follows the storyline. We dont want to make a bad impression with bad grammars on final built!

5. Animation Effects

A sets of specialized animation effects for the toppings!

Every backers will be rewarded fairly, and we might have another merchandise beside of shirts and wallpapers.. Maybe figurine, if we reach our goals!.

story:
The team here at No One Famous Studios is a small group of passionate game developers and gamers. We are a small indie studio based out of Austin, TX. Our focus is to create and develop games that are driven by unique game mechanics, interesting play styles, and games that can be picked up by anyone, but mastered by few. Above all we are driven to develop games that are all of these things and still fun to play for hours on end.

Siege the Day is our debut title, and a game we are excited to be developing. We chose Siege the Day as our first title because it wholly embodies the types of games we want to bring to gamers. This title takes a different approach to the tower defense genre, and will focus on attacking entrenched defenders, rather than simply building defenses. With no resource gathering elements, a unique upgrade and building system, and dynamic map generation, new challenges and strategies must be implemented in every match. These game mechanics will ensure that players can find fun and challenges every time they start a new match or play through the expansive campaign.

The team here at No One Famous Studios is incredibly small, comprised of only 3 people, each working full-time jobs. We are ambitious though, and have put every extra dollar and available hour we have into bringing Siege the Day to life. There is only so much we are able to do on our own, however. With your help through, we can bring a fully developed game to market. A game that is unique, challenging, and above all just plain fun to play.




Siege the Day is a real time tower offense game, reversing the main role of standard tower defense games. Each match will feature a dynamically generated map, as well as a limited amount of gold. Gold is used to fund and upgrade units. Players will start with a majority share of this gold, but will have difficultly acquiring more. These simple mechanics will require players to exercise strategy, discipline, and cunning as they discover the challenges they face in every game.

Siege the Day will also feature an original musical score. You can listen to the full theme song here:



Traditionally, tower defense games focus on players building up defenses—usually between waves of enemies—to fend off an oncoming horde. Siege the Day changes that and focuses on players building up armies and siege engines, to unleash on fortified defenders in real time. While offense will be a primary focus in the campaign, single and multiplayer matches will allow players to take on a more traditional role of defense, but still in a real time world.



One of the biggest features of Siege the Day is the randomly generated maps. Every time a player starts a new match a new map is generated. These maps choose a primary map type, and then build various terrain and biomes on to it. Map biomes and terrain are comprised of various types, including: plains, desert, forest, swamp, river, hills, mountain, and ocean. These various map elements can be combined in an endless number of ways, and with each biome and terrain having different effects on different units, they help create endless potential challenges.



If you are going to build siege engines, wood and stone are pretty important. If you are going to lay siege to the lands you are attempting to conquer, gathering materials like these is a given. That is why we decided to exclude resource gathering and generation in favor of one of the most historically important resources in siege warfare: Currency.
(Well that and food and water… which is a feature that might be included later on)



Instead of a complex and timely generation system to obtain the required amount of currency to invest in new units or upgrades, we opted for a unique way to fund your sieges. Players will start with a large amount of gold at the beginning of each match—based on the size of the playfield. Defense players will start with much more gold than the offense players, to give them an edge in building and setting up their defenses. All units and upgrades will be available for purchase from the start of the match for both players.

The starting gold represents nearly all of the gold in the match, and is extremely difficult to generate any other way. The only surefire way to generate more gold is through defeating enemy units. This will grant players a fraction of the gold their opponent used to purchase the unit.

This system is simple and easy, but requires much more strategy than it seems. While players can upgrade units fully almost immediately, this will completely eliminate their abilities to adapt to unexpected challenges. If their fully upgraded charge is repelled, they are left with nothing to continue on and will essentially eliminate themselves.


Strategies will need to be developed based on both known and unknown challenges. Challenges that will change with each map and each enemy.

Siege the day utilizes an upgrade system that complements the currency system. Base units have divergent discipline upgrades that will change major features of the unit. Each discipline having specialized secondary upgrades available. Players will be able to switch between unit disciplines, while maintaining all secondary upgrades. This allows players to choose the unit and discipline that will best meet their needs. Switching between disciplines will cost players gold, however. Requiring them to make their changes very selectively.



These two game modes comprise the easiest way to jump in and start playing Siege the Day. Players can choose between playing either the invading, army building offense or the fortifying, repelling defense. Single player matches will feature against an AI at a variable difficulty that players can set. Multiplayer matches will allow players to either challenge and battle friends through direct games, or be matched with another random player to test their skills against the world.



We wanted players to be able to jump in to a game quickly through either single player matches or multiplayer. For player who love a good story and want to watch their actions effect their world, Siege the Day includes an expansive and open ended campaign in which your decisions will have consequence and effect on both you and the lands you travel.

The story of the campaign follows players, a lord and protector of their lands. A threat to the realm has begun to develop. An unknown army, headed by a person only known as the Conqueror has begun laying siege to many of the neighboring lands. When this threat reaches your lands, you attempt to repel them. Your efforts are in vain, as the Conqueror proves to be too strong a foe. Impressed by your tenacity, and ability you are offered a deal. To join the Conqueror in claiming and unifying the lands under their banner. What lands will you conquer? What will become of their rulers? Are you loyal to your new lord, or will you attempt to take the world for your own?

This campaign is one of major features we absolutely love being able to include in this type of game, and are currently working on fleshing out hours and hours of campaign game play to immerse players in a deep and complex story.




Siege the day features 5 main base units: Infantry, Archer, Cavalry, Scout, and Siege Engines. Many of these units have various disciplines that players can use and upgrade to create an army for whatever challenges await. Each unit has specialties that will prove valuable to players in different ways.



  •  Infantry units are the loyal foot soldiers of your army. The most cost effective to purchase, and overall the most well rounded unit. Infantry units can be trained into various close combat disciplines, including: Light Infantry, Heavy Infantry, Spearmen, Pike men, and Phalanxes.


  • Archers are deadly ranged units that allow players to inflict massive damage before an enemy even draws close. While susceptible to close quarters combat, their various disciplines can prevent enemies from ever getting close enough. Archer disciplines include: Short bow, Longbow, Light crossbow, Heavy Crossbow, and Riflemen


  • Cavalry units are fast mounted units, designed to destructively clash with other foot units and breaking enemy lines. They are susceptible to the terrain they cross, but proper deployment makes them a force to be reckoned with. Calvary disciplines include: Light Calvary, Heavy Calvary, Dragoon, and Knight.

  • Scouts are the fastest units with the greatest sight. They can search areas and track enemy movements quickly and efficiently. While not fighters, if detected they can quickly escape through the land laying traps to stall and damage enemies.



  • Siege Engines are the greatest assets in any siege. Allowing attackers to bypass fortifications with Siege Towers and Ladders, level masses of enemies with Ballista, reduce walls and towers to nothing with catapults, or inflict massive damage to personal and fortifications with cannons. These instruments of war are costly to build, but invaluable in the field.





When laying out what we wanted to do with Siege the Day, there were many ideas, stories, and content that did not fit into the core development. Rather than leave these ideas behind we decided one of the most ambitious things we wanted to do with the game is the inclusion of new content after the game is released. Offering players new stories and features to continue expanding on their immersion in the game.

What content and stories will be released after the game? We have decided yet. This content will be developed after the game has been released, and will not be a part of the core development process. Our primary goal with this is to provide new short campaigns for players, to tell stories that we feel fit in with the world but not the main campaign. We plan on releasing this new content for at least 6 months after the game is released, but would love to be able to do a year or more of additional content.

As gamers ourselves were not fans of paid DLC, which is why this content will be added monthly, for free.




As we mentioned in the introduction, No One Famous Studios is a small team of 3 people. We are putting as much time and personal finances into this title as possible, but there is only so much we can do on our own. We are crowdfunding Siege the Day so that we can fully dedicate the time and resources necessary to develop this game without cutting corners or features. We want to provide a fully fleshed out and developed game, and we need your help to make it happen.

You might be wondering, if crowdfunding is critical to the development of Siege the Day, why we are asking for so little compared to other video game campaigns. Simply put, the amount we are trying to raise is what is needed to complete the core development. When we set the scope of what we want this game to be; the features that we wanted to make sure were included to make the game what it is, and we looked at what we could do ourselves, the whole of this campaign is what is missing.

We set this campaign to flex funding so that we can put any funds we raise towards core development. Every dollar over our original goal helps us fund additional features and content we want to include, but we want to be realistic with our goals and transparent with our intentions.

 


We wanted to make sure that backers who support us are not just left wondering about the status of the development or backer rewards. Therefore, all perk levels over $15 not only get you a copy of Siege the Day, but also grant you access to the Development schedule we will be putting online and updating Monday - Friday. This schedule will allow you to track that progress of the games development.

We are going to be adding a few more perks as the campaign continues, and we have several perks that will unlock as we meet our stretch goals. So make sure you check back frequently.

We’re putting as much financing into Siege the Day as possible, and with your help we can cover that last gap of funding required. All funds we raise will be broken down like so:

  • Development Costs: By far the biggest expenditure in developing a game. This is going to cover the costs of things like testing servers so we can make sure multiplayer works flawlessly, development utilities and services (electricity is strangely important for computers. Weird, right?), and man hours (we might buy a bag of chips if that’s ok.)

  • Distribution and Marketing: While we’re not above hand delivering your copy and handing out flyers, it’s not really the most cost effective or timely method. Funds here will help us get Siege the Day onto multiple platforms, and get the game to as many people as possible.
  • Support and Services: We plan to be around patching missed bugs, building new content, and ensuring multiplayer services work. These funds will help us keep up with everything after the game launches.



Game development and crowd funding both come with plenty of risks and challenges, and we want to make sure we address both. Not just risks and challenges we face in development, but also risks you miht be worried about.



“Will this game actually get released if I help fund it?”

Yes. Without exception, yes. We know you probably have worries about funding an unknown studio’s debut game, and you are not alone. This was one of the biggest questions that we had to ask ourselves when we first sat down to create this game. We determined what it would take and how to make it happen from funding to development to distribution. It is one of the reasons we set this campaign to flexible funding, so that no matter what your contribution helps us make this game a reality.



“How do I know you’ll actually release the game you say you will?”

We have maintained a scope of what we want Siege the Day to be at its core. The mechanics and game play that make it the game we want it to be. There are plenty of additional complementary features that we would like to include, but right now the core gameplay we described here is our only focus.



“Is this going to be another game that is an endless beta or never leaves early access?”

No. Absolutely not. Never. By maintaining our scope of what we want to do with Siege the Day we are also able to focus on the final product. We have cut a plethora of ideas that just wouldn’t be practical or would indefinitely extend development. If we want to add anything to the game, it will be after release, and it will be free.



“Why are you asking for so little? Aren’t games expensive to develop?”

They are very expensive, and we have been pouring as much of our personal finances into the development as we are able. Ramen has helped. We plan to continue to do that even after the campaign ends. We are just as invested in this as you are, but we want to be realistic about our goals. The reason we’re not asking for tens or hundreds of thousands of dollars is because it would be absurd. We don’t want to lose focus on our core development process by trying to add new features because we can afford to. All our stretch goals are things that we already want to include, and reaching those goals not only shows us you want those things as well, but helps us fund their development.



“What happens if you don’t reach your goal?”

We keep working. It could take us years to finally complete the game, but we will keep working until it’s done.


We are raising funds to help us complete the core development of Siege the Day. Alas, this means some features we want to include and think would make for an even more amazing game are just out of reach. We wanted to give you a chance to help us get these features into the game.



Reaching $10,000 will allow us to include a customization option. This option will allow you to create a battle standard to will be displayed on all of your units, and to opponents in match making. Reaching this goal will also unlock perks for unique banners that can only be accessed through this campaign.




We will now be able to provide monthly updates for up to 9 months. That’s 3 more months of free content.




We have the equipment, we have the talent, and with this goal we will have the funds to give voices to major campaign characters. Some of these characters… well they will be so much better with a voice.




Currently the campaign is set to be an expansive adventure, but upon hitting this goal it will become even more in depth. New worlds, new characters, and even more hours of play. This goal will unlock perks that will give you the option of appearing in the game.




We can provide a full year of updates to Siege the day with this goal. This means a full year of new content, new adventures, and new challenges.




Myth units were one of the units we had to initially cut when we started. Once we hit this goal these units are back into the game. Some are walking siege engines. Some are devastating rangers. Some are absolute tricksters. These units will add a whole new level of challenge.




Maps currently generate whenever a new match is started. Hit this goal and we can include a Map editing mode that will allow you to lay out whole worlds, as well as place units, and adjust game play settings that you can share with or challenge your friends in.




One of the Game modes that was benched as it was difficult to fit into our original scope was this asymmetrically challenge mode. One player will either play as a super army or super defender, against several other players. Resist the siege of multiple armies, or lay waste to many keeps.




We would love to get Siege the Day on every platform possible, but to get the game ready for console will take some serious work. Hit this goal and we’ll work on letting you lay siege on either your Xbox One or PS4.




We’re going to buy a bag of chips… maybe two.





Have a question, or confused about something above. We might have explained or answer your question here:

“Why are you asking for so little?”

Two reasons. First, we are still putting our own finances into Siege the Day. The amount were asking for is what we need to finish development. Second, we are a small startup studio and this is our debut game, we want to be realistic and not overreach or over promise.



“Are you using any game creation tool?”

Nope. Siege the Day is being created 100% from scratch. Even the game engine was created by us.



“Can I see more gameplay?”

Absolutely! We’re premiering the gameplay at RTX 2016 here is Austin, TX. If you’re going feel free to stop by and we’ll show you everything. After RTX we’ll be uploading more gameplay footage here.



“Your game doesn’t look finished.”

I’d hope not, otherwise there wouldn’t be a reason for this campaign. If you are referring the video or other media that don’t look like the typical marketing material, that is because we have focused on mechanics and gameplay so far, and the graphics are not quite to finished quality yet.



“Why the cartoon like style? Is this a kid’s game?”

Aesthetic choice. We wanted to create an easy to approach look to Siege the Day. Easy to approach doesn’t mean easy to master though.



“Is this going to be some mobile game ported to PC?”

Not at all. We would like to release a mobile version, but this is a full PC title.



“Are you going to have micro-transactions?”

It’s common in games lately to have some element that is micro-transaction based. We don’t want to have anything like that effecting our game. The only micro-transactions we’ve even considered were for unique banner symbols, and only so we could pay artists to create more.



“Are the $10,000 and $20,000 perks real?”

Absolutely. We see all of our backers as investors. If someone believes in us and what we can accomplish to that degree we would absolutely love to hear their opinions and give them a voice in our future developments and projects.



“Are you really going to just buy chips if you reach $1,000,000?”

Possibly. Mostly we just wanted to show that even at such a high goal we are keeping the scope of what we want to do. If we reach $1,000,000 there is plenty of things we’d love to do with Siege the Day, plenty of ideas we had to shelf we’ll revisit. But we don’t want to start promising more and more features to the point it is more than we can handle.



“I like the idea, but I’m not sure I want to back the campaign…”

Hey, that’s ok. We get it. Though if you like the idea, maybe consider checking out and supporting the game’s Steam Greenlight page. It’s free and helps us get the game on Steam. You can find the game here: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetai...

anyone, but mastered by few. Above all we are driven to develop games that are
all of these things and still fun to play for hours on end.

to be developing. We chose Siege the Day as our first title because it wholly
embodies the types of games we want to bring to gamers. This title takes a
different approach to the tower defense genre, and will focus on attacking
entrenched defenders, rather than simply building defenses. With no resource
gathering elements, a unique upgrade and building system, and dynamic map
generation, new challenges and strategies must be implemented in every match.

time they start a new match or play through the expansive campaign.

comprised of only 3 people, each working full-time jobs. We are ambitious
though, and have put every extra dollar and available hour we have into
bringing Siege the Day to life. There is only so much we are able to do on our
own, however. With your help through, we can bring a fully developed game to
market. A game that is unique, challenging, and above all just plain fun to
play.

the main role of standard tower defense games. Each match will feature a
dynamically generated map, as well as a limited amount of gold. Gold is used to
fund and upgrade units. Players will start with a majority share of this gold,
but will have difficultly acquiring more. These simple mechanics will require
players to exercise strategy, discipline, and cunning as they discover the
challenges they face in every game.Siege the Day will also feature an original musical score. You can listen to the full theme song here:

world.

potential challenges.

gameplay?”
Absolutely! We’re premiering the gameplay at RTX 2016 here
is Austin, TX. If you’re going feel free to stop by and we’ll show you
everything. After RTX we’ll be uploading more gameplay footage here. 


“Your game doesn’t
look finished.”
I’d hope not, otherwise there wouldn’t be a reason for this
campaign. If you are referring the video or other media that don’t look like the
typical marketing material, that is because we have focused on mechanics and
gameplay so far, and the graphics are not quite to finished quality yet. 


“Why the cartoon like
style? Is this a kid’s game?”
Aesthetic choice. We wanted to create an easy to approach
look to Siege the Day. Easy to approach doesn’t mean easy to master though. 


“Is this going to be
some mobile game ported to PC?”
Not at all. We would like to release a mobile version, but
this is a full PC title. 


“Are you going to
have micro-transactions?”
It’s common in games lately to have some element that is
micro-transaction based. We don’t want to have anything like that effecting our
game. The only micro-transactions we’ve even considered were for unique banner
symbols, and only so we could pay artists to create more.


“Are the $10,000 and
$20,000 perks real?”
Absolutely. We see all of our backers as investors. If
someone believes in us and what we can accomplish to that degree we would
absolutely love to hear their opinions and give them a voice in our future
developments and projects.


“Are you really going
to just buy chips if you reach $1,000,000?”
Possibly. Mostly we just wanted to show that even at such a
high goal we are keeping the scope of what we want to do. If we reach
$1,000,000 there is plenty of things we’d love to do with Siege the Day, plenty
of ideas we had to shelf we’ll revisit. But we don’t want to start promising more
and more features to the point it is more than we can handle. 


“I like the idea, but
I’m not sure I want to back the campaign…”
Hey, that’s ok. We get it. Though if you like the idea,
maybe consider checking out and supporting the game’s Steam Greenlight page.
It’s free and helps us get the game on Steam. You can find the game here: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetai...

story:
Short Summary

Let's be clear: I've already finished this video game. It's free and you can play it right now. I'd like to make a better one though, so if you like the concept of the game but think it could use some work, please consider helping me to do so. You wouldn't be paying me to make a game that I might never finish, you'd be paying an artist to make assets.

The game can be found here:

  • Website:
    • http://slizerbms.wordpress.com
  • Free Download:
    • http://www.indiedb.com/games/slizer-strategy/do...
  • Steam Greenlight:
    • http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetai...

What We Need & What You Get

The money will immediately go towards the artist to make the first map, at which point it will be posted here as an example of what the funding will go towards. If the art doesn't suit the game, we'll rework it. We don't need the full $1000 yet, just enough to pay our hard working artists for some preliminary examples. From there we'll fund the rest of the maps if it works out.

This will make a sequel/remake possible. I have a lot of ideas to improve the game, but they don't belong in the current game. This game has its own flavour, as will the sequel. They will improve gameplay, but they need better visuals to avoid the issues the first game had with public perception.

If you think this game has any potential, contributions will make it possible and viable for me to reach that potential. IF possible, all contributions will go towards a discount or full payment of the final product of the game, as well as beta access. NOTE: This hasn't been set up or verified yet! This is my goal though, as you'd better get your money's worth.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute monetarily but still think the game has potential, consider sharing this with people. I'd also like to get the current game onto Steam Greenlight, and that needs to get done before Greenlight is taken down.

[CURRENT PROGRESS]:

https://slizerbms.wordpress.com/2017/04/26/art-...

story:
In year 2181. scientists almost completely destroyed Earth because of experiments over warp technology. Earth is filled with dimensional gaps which makes life on Earth no longer possible. What’s left of population they move into big space station. Couple of scientists tried to took control over those dimensional gaps so they could move whole population in another dimension and start from the scratch, but experiment went terribly wrong.

We are focusing on extreme hard gameplay which will have dark SCI-FI environment based in BIG SPACE STATION. Most of the combat is based on melee, but through progress of story player will find ranged weapons which will help as well.

 

Level Progression – As the player collect experience points, he will unlock more melee skills

Dynamic Combat Mechanics – the closest combat mechanics is something between Dark Souls and Dead Space.

Another Dimension – Player can enter another dimension and bring items to into “real one”

Puzzles – Player must solve puzzles so he can progress storyline

Weapon mechanics - Player can have only 1 melee and 1 ranged weapon

Easter eggs – Funny things which will be secret for now :P

Level design is one of our priorities, for that act we are using architect which already developed basic idea of snowflake design. So that means that game will have 6 acts with beautiful and rich decorated dark SCI-FI environments. Needless to say that level designing will take the most of our time while developing the game.

Combat System:

Melee System – Our melee system is done but we need to put more skills and do a precise optimization. We have around 5 different attacks but we want to implement more of them. But for that we need to record animations with MOCAP (Motion Capture).

Ranged System – Animations for assault rifle and handguns are done, including mechanics but also as on melee system we need to do precise optimization and record animations for other ranged weapons (Shotguns, Rocket Launchers, Grenade Launchers…).

Dodge System – Completely finished but we are planning to implement more dodge animations, as well different dodge mechanics and precise optimization

 

Movement System:

Basic movement, running, jumping, falling down animations are already done, but we need to record more of them and do a precise optimization of all of them.

 

AI System

Basic artificial intelligence is capable of hearing, following and attacking from the close range. He can also patrol, evade and block attack.

 

Dialog System

We programed it but we still didn’t implement it.

 

As you know game developing is not 2 men job, so far in our team there are 2 people which are fully dedicated to Slider. But there is not enough time because we have our real jobs to do which we want to quit and be fully dedicated to the game. Our plans are to hire more programmers, level designers, 3D asset creators and SFX engineer. All money will be invested directly into game. And we will try as well try to get funding through different official sources (sponsorships) because we are not trying to get rich from this project. Let’s call it from gamer to gamer perspective ?.

As you can see/read we already have done tons of stuff. But we still need more help from you guys/girls so we can focus on our project and hire more people. Our goal is 75.000€ and with this budget we can completely finish the game.

 

We have our vision planned in every detail what we want to accomplish. We are not planning to make some money maker otherwise we will focus in multiplayer and build some P2W game. But no, that’s not our priority and never will be.

Any extra money we raise through our campaign will be put as well into development, even if we raise more we can even hire more people and finish it faster. But you got our point ?.

 

Well I can’t say how thankful we are if you are planning to support our project. We really want to finish this project and we are planning it for really long time and we think that now it’s best time to ask for your support. It will be a lot of dedicated work but with you guys/girls we can do it, because we love it as well.

story:
Gravity Spin


Concept

Gravity Spin is a single player mobile puzzle/platformer with a minimalistic style. The concept is simple: You are a ball in a maze and your goal is to reach the green block. How do you do that? You as a player posses the ability turn the direction of the gravity, but that is not all: on your way you will meet blocks that would restart the level, guns lasers or just moving objects.

Gameplay Video



Levels

The game is estimated to have at least 96 levels in at least two chapters (48 each) at the start, and receive more with updates. There will be three game-modes:
  1. Normal: every level is independent and you can skip the especially difficult ones by watching a 20 second long video.
  2. Series - available only if chapter is complete: you start at the first level in the chapter and you work your way to the top, only one small detail: you make a step back with every failure, so losing at level 30 will send you to level 29.
  3. Hardcore -  available only if chapter is complete: same as Series but this time no second chances. You have to complete an entire chapter from the first try - fail once and be sent to level one.

Vision

I see this game as being free experience not clouded by micro-transactions and advertisement, I plan to stick to the policy of players being abel to complete entire game without watching an add once. I hope to use advertisement only in three places: 
  1. Watch a video to unlock a skin that you received for completing a task.
  2. Watch a video to skip a level that does not allow you to move forward.
  3. Watch a video to support the developer and say "Thank you",
I also plan on avoiding any kind of power-ups, I even considered a name "Pure Skill" for that reason.

Long Term Plans

What Are my plans on Gravity Spin after the release:
  • New chapters
  • New intractables in levels
  • Steam release
  • Game Center and Google Play achievements
  • Facebook leaderboard and achievement sharing
  • Everyplay integration.

About Money...


Why do I need $2000?

To go live I need to have a tool to track the progress of players to make game more user-friendly and levels more balanced and have access to all engine features to boost overall performance. In order to do so I need to purchase a Unity Pro License, which costs $1500 ($2000 - 5%(IndieGoGo) - 5%(PayPal receiving) - 5-10%(PayPal paying) = $1500 + 5-10% for unexpected expenses).

What will I do with extra money?

All additional funds will go on supporting me as a young developer and securing the future for Gravity Spin. That means that the more money I collect the more projects I will be abel to create in the future and the more updates I will make for Gravity Spin. Note that by "supporting me as a young developer" I mean, if things go very good, purchasing hardware (computer), software (Blender, Photoshop etc) and hiring a crew.

What will happened if I do not reach your goal of $2000?

If the collected money are below $1000 I will use them to pay for Unity Pro Subscription (75$/month), If the collected money are above $1000 I would add them to money from family savings to purchase the Unity Pro.

Perks

As you can see I am on a low budget and cannot offer you anything other then "Alpha & Beta test Membership", gratitude and place in the credits. I apologize for that.

The Impact


How is this project important to me?

That project will define my life: if it succeeds, so will probably the game, that would mean that I can make a living of making such products, if not, I would be put in a situation where I would have to face the fact that my view on the games is undemanded and I am better look for another kind of employment.

How is this project important to you?

If campaign succeeds, you will have a completely free game. The game is going to be done in February and only going to lack levels. So the game will air no matter what, but if the campaign fails, it probably is not going to be free, going to have price for every chapter and probably not going to have more then 6 chapters in total. Also it would mean that I probably going to try something else, which means no other games will come from me.

Risks & Challenges


 I dealt with most of the problems before coming here so probably nothing will cause a delay. Here is the list of things that unlikely but could happened:

  1. I could get dragged into studying too much during February and March. That would mean delay in release.
  2. Issues during registration and publishing in App Store and Google Play, that could delay release for 1-2 weeks.
  3. Rise in Unity Pro price, I will handle it myself, if it happens in a short period of time between campaign completion and purchasing.
  4. Severe injury - could mean that campaign would be suspended, but for a minimal period of time.
You will be informed via twitter and youtube channel if any of the problems occur.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please, even if you do not invest any money, could you at least share that campaign with other people, sharing the link on Facebook or other social media would be enough.
