story:
Story

Bandits rob and kidnap the main character and after torturing, they put him in unconscious state into a boat. Strong water drags him far away and he opens his eyes in the open sea during the storm. He does not know where he came from and he does not know where to go. He just know that he must survive...

Platforms


Features

Most of the features can be seen in the video. Please check  it, if you would like to see them. They are optimized for mobile devices.

‣ Day-Night Cycle

There is day-night cycle in the game. The Sun and The Moon move and lighting, shadows are change.

   

‣ Different Weather Types

There are three weather types in the game. Please watch the video to see them better.

1. Stormy

Stormy weather occurs some days, randomly. It comes at night. You have to be prepared for it before. These nights are tough. Otherwise, you may lose your items or your character may die during the storm. Your boat may capsize, if you don't balance it. Balancing the boat is a mini-game in the game.

Rain and waves fill your boat. So, you should craft a cover for preventing them. In this way, you can also save your items. But, you have to play balancing mini-game whilst your character lying down again. Your boat must not capsize. You can use your cover for two times. It wears out and you have to craft it again.



Boat Balance Mini Game

2. Normal

It's sunny, ordinary weather. Sea is not too calm or too rough. Keep gathering resources and crafting items during this weather occurs. The night may be tough.


3. Calm

It may look peaceful. But, it usually occurs before the stormy weather and this may be a signal for you. 


‣ Animals

There are various sea creatures in the game.

1. Dolphin

Dolphins are friendly creatures. They move fast. Their sounds sometimes may be funny or creepy.

2. Whale

They may look friendly. But their huge body may create huge problems as well. Be careful, if they are near you.

3. Shark

Sharks are not going to be dangerous in the first version the game. A minigame about shark attacks is going to be implemented in the second version. 


4. Other

There are going to be 8 different types of fishes in addition to octopus and stingray. Some of them are slightly poisonous. If you eat them, you become ill. They don't kill you, instantly. You must cure yourself, if you eat a poisonous sea creature.

  


‣ Hunting & Resource Gathering

There are two holes on the boat for putting fishing rod and trawl. If you craft two fishing rod or trawl, you can use them at the same time. You have to remove them before the storm. Otherwise, you will lose them.


a. Fishing Rod

Fishing rod can be used for hunting a single fish. Crafting it, is easier than trawl. You can craft longer fishing line. This will increase your chance and you will "probably" get bigger fishes. Probability changes according to depth.  Also, fish hunting time will be shorter.

When you use a fishing rod, you have to check the sea depth (Sea depth is going to be on the screen). Otherwise, if fishing hook hit seabed, your fishing line will break off after a while. You have to adjust it.


b. Trawl

Representative picture about trawling

You can use trawl to hunt more than one fish and get resources which is on the seabed. You can get fishes, woods, plants, inorganic things, etc... Your trawl must hit the seabed. Otherwise, you will get only fishes. You have to check the depth. Also, your trawl is not big as the representative picture. You have 4 slots.
It is not going to be easy to craft a trawl. Needed resources can be gotten from the sea surface. Some objects are floating on the water. You need to grab them.


c. Floating Objects

Grabbing floating objects, is another way to gather resources in the game. As you know, all objects are not floatable.  So, you must craft a trawl to reach others. 
Grabbing floating objects, is going to be a minigame. You must chase the object with the cursor for a while and fill the grab bar, to grab it. This minigame will make grabbing more challenging and funnier.  While a valuable object is moving on the water near you, it will be thrilling for you. 



‣ Cooking

You can cook food  in the game. It is optional. But eating raw meat is not healthy. If you don't cook your food, you may become ill. Also, you have to track cooking. Otherwise, eating burned food is not healthy as well.


‣ Drinking Water

As you know, water is extremely important for life. But, sea water is not drinkable. If you drink it, you will die because of dehydration. Also, it has various microorganisms. You may be ill. 

In the game, you are free to drink it. But, if you drink too much sea water, you will die or become ill.

So, you must produce drinking water. Theory of it, is simple. "Boil the sea water, collect it as a drinking water"

Representative picture about producing drinking water


You can drink the collected water, safely.

Note: This process removes minerals from water. You can get minerals from food, alternatively. Long-run affects on health is scientifically controversial.


‣ Crafting

There is an inventory and crafting mechanism in the game. You are going to be able to craft new/better items with crafting system such as longer fishing line, boat cover, blanket, trawl, medicine, bucket, hammer etc... Also, you may find some original thrown items (radio,  lamp,  etc...), while you are trawling and you will be able to use some of them to craft new items.



‣ Character Stats

There are various character stats in the game.

Health: If your character is ill or drowning, health decreases. Eating and sleeping increases it. Also, sitting slightly makes it better.

Hunger: There are various foods in the game and their effects are different. Some of them(big fishes etc.) are filling.

Thirst: You can drink sea water (even though it causes dehydration, illness in the game) or you can produce drinking water with boiling method or you can collect rainwater in a bucket. It is up to you. But their effects are different.

Cold: Temperature changes according to hour and the weather in the game. It will be cold after midnight and if you want to sleep or sitting, you may need a thicker blanket or you can make a fire. Otherwise, you may freeze or become ill.

Energy: When you do something (crafting, etc.), you will lose energy in the game. But, refilling it, won't take too much time. You can get more energy with eating, sitting, sleeping.

Seasickness: The main character is not a sailor and he may have seasickness. Weather and boat bobbing affects this stat. You may vomit and lose your health because of this reason. After you get some experience, you will deal with this, easily.

Experience: Your experience increases with time and it affects almost all character stats. Seasickness will become rare and your character will resist tiredness, hunger, thirst and cold more. Also, your mental health will be better.

Mental Health: Being alone in the middle of the sea, is quite scary. At the beginning of the game, your character's mental health will be quite sensitive. He will be better with more experience. Creepy sea creature sounds, stormy weather, illness, hunger and other "negative things" make it worse.  Sleeping, sitting and eating makes it better.

When your character loses his mental health, he will start to hear weird imaginary sounds and see imaginary creatures, happenings. Daydreams, hallucinations may make things worse.

   

‣ Illness

The main character become ill according to character stats. It is probabilistic and there is no certainty. There are three kinds of illnesses in the game.

a. Temporary

It is not fatal and you don't need medicine to cure it. It will limit your character's actions (preventing crafting some items, etc.) for temporary.

b. Fatal

You must craft a medicine to cure. You will need some sea plants to do this.  Otherwise, you will die.

c. Fatal (Instant)

If your character stats are so bad (especially mental health). Your character may die because of heart attack. A scary daydream may impact his life.

‣ Character Animations

Sleeping: There is a sleeping system in the game. Energy level determines the sleeping time. If you are so tired, you will sleep long. If your energy is full, you can't sleep. Also, you may wake up because of the stormy weather. You must deal with the storm.

Sitting: Your character can sit to take a rest. Sitting increases your energy, makes mental health better, hunger and thirst increases slower.

Running/walking: It is default mode.

Drowning: If your character falls to the sea and he does not have a life vest, he will die. You have to craft a life vest. Crafted life vest will be a weak, disposable item. So, you can use it for one time.

Dying: The main character may die on the boat because of various reasons (hunger, thirst, illness, heart attack, etc.)

Afraid: Fear effects.


‣ HUD (Head-Up Display) [Pre-Alpha]

HUD shows you game clock, temperature, sea depth, home button, inventory, character stats button, D-Pad (for movement) and Joystick (for looking around). It is in pre-alpha stage and user feedback is very important about it.

Note: Image shows D-Pad and Joystick places roughly. Please check the controls section to see detailed information about them.

In default, the game uses 24 Hour Clock, Celcius scale and Metric system. 

Also, 12 Hour Clock,  Fahrenheit scale and Foot unit are supported.


‣ Controls

Controls are very important for games. Bad controller system can ruin it, entirely. It will be designed according to user comments. There are various devices and there may be another need for an alternative controller system.

In default, there will be D Pad which is for movement and Joystick which is for looking around.

D Pad is on the bottom left side of the screen (It is like a keyboard)
Joystick is on the bottom right side of the screen. (It is like a mouse)

Also, there is going to be support for left handed people. D Pad, Joystick positions are interchangeable. 


‣ Performance

Performance is very important for mobile games. So, low polygon models are used and shaders are optimized for mobile. ~50 drawcalls is recommended for mobile devices. (Very old mobile devices can handle ~20 drawcalls)  High end mobile devices can handle ~120 drawcalls, today. Generally, the recommended value is ~50. But most of devices can handle 80+ drawcalls, today.

During the storm, the game has 27 drawcalls.

While looking at the inside of the boat, it becomes 34.

Also, there are some meshes and materials which can be combined. This extra optimizations are going to be done at the end.


‣ Performance and Development

The game is in pre-alpha stage now and new contents are going to be added. But, performance won't change too much. Because almost all object are already placed into the boat. The game will be expanded, horizontally, not vertically.

I mean, new objects are not going to be loaded in the same scene. New contents will be seen in different times. A new event will start after another event.


‣ File Size and Development

File size is going to be bigger. Because new contents are going to be added. It is hard to say its final file size. But it won't be so big. The game is around 35 mb at the current state.


‣ Tutorials & Notifications

Elena is an imaginary sailor in the game. She is going to help you and give you some hints about the game when you need. You are going to be able to disable this feature if you want.


‣ Leaderboards & Achievement

The game will use Apple Game Center, Google Play Services and more to store the most survived players. Also, there will be achievements.

    


‣ Social Media

Players will be able to share their achievements on Facebook and Twitter in the first version. If the community request more, new social media sites will be added later. 

   


Risks

The game is tested on iOS and Android devices and there is no problem. But, there are some issues about shaders on Windows Phone. So, Windows Phone version of the game needs extra work and it may be delayed.


Development Tracking

You can track the development daily from this page.
https://trello.com/b/yIDQ64PZ/pocket-survival-w...


Release

  • The first version will be released in December 2015 (in worst case scenario).
  • The game is going to be published on App Store(iOS), Google Play Store(Android), Amazon Store(Android), Windows Store(Windows Phone).
  • Backers who use custom Android devices which can't access Google Play or Amazon Store, are going to download the setup file(APK), directly. (This case is exceptional for Android) 
  • Backers are going to receive an unique serial number which unlocks paid features (full version, start boost, etc.)


Stretch features

Pocket Survival v1 ($5000)
‣ All features which are meant in the text, are going to be implemented

Pocket Survival v2 ($6000)
‣ The boat is going to be upgradeable
‣ Shark attack minigame
‣ Cold Waters Biome 
      • Frozen Water
      • Icebergs
      • Ice Breaker upgrade for the boat
      • New Animals (Penguin, Seal, Salmon)
      • Snowy Weather
      • New crafting recipes for preventing cold

Pocket Survival v3 ($7000)
‣ Whale attack minigame
‣ Hot Waters Biome
     • Submarine volcanoes
     • Submarine volcanoes minigame
     • 8 different tropical fishes
     • Boat upgrade for preventing sun exposure
     • New items and crafting recipes for this biome

Pocket Survival v4 ($8500)
The main character loses his mind for temporary in this chapter and starts to see imaginary things.

‣ Nightmare feature is going to be added to the sleep system.
‣ Black Waters Biome
     •  Horror themes (creepy sounds, water, non-stop rain)
     •  New imaginary creatures (ghost, leviathan, witchcrow) 
     •  Witchcrow mini game
     •  Ghost battle minigame
     •  4 different creepy fishes
     •  New items and crafting recipes for this biome

Pocket Survival v5 ($10000)
Backers are going to determine the last biome. The most requested biome is going to be added and it is going to bring 2 minigames, new themes, items and crafting recipes, as well.

Pocket Survival PC ($50000)
If the community like and support the game, PC version of the game is going to be implemented and graphics, physics systems are going to be changed, completely.

‣ High quality water and water dynamics.
‣ High polygon objects and better textures.
‣ Physically based rendering
‣ New weather system
‣ Better physics 
‣ Better shaders, lighting, shadows

Players are going to be able use their mobile savegame in the PC version or or vice versa.

Also, "Pocket Survival" name is going to be changed. Because, it won't fit in the pocket!


Hope you like it,

Thanks!
story_txt:
StoryBandits rob and kidnap the main character and after torturing, they put him in unconscious state into a boat. Strong water drags him far away and he opens his eyes in the open sea during the storm. He does not know where he came from and he does not know where to go. He just know that he must survive...PlatformsFeatures
Most of the features can be seen in the video. Please check  it, if you would like to see them. They are optimized for mobile devices.

‣ Day-Night Cycle
There is day-night cycle in the game. The Sun and The Moon move and lighting, shadows are change.
   
‣ Different Weather Types

There are three weather types in the game. Please watch the video to see them better.


1. Stormy
Stormy weather occurs some days, randomly. It comes at night. You have to be prepared for it before. These nights are tough. Otherwise, you may lose your items or your character may die during the storm. Your boat may capsize, if you don't balance it. Balancing the boat is a mini-game in the game.
Rain and waves fill your boat. So, you should craft a cover for preventing them. In this way, you can also save your items. But, you have to play balancing mini-game whilst your character lying down again. Your boat must not capsize. You can use your cover for two times. It wears out and you have to craft it again.

Boat Balance Mini Game
2. Normal
It's sunny, ordinary weather. Sea is not too calm or too rough. Keep gathering resources and crafting items during this weather occurs. The night may be tough.



3. Calm
It may look peaceful. But, it usually occurs before the stormy weather and this may be a signal for you. 


‣ Animals

There are various sea creatures in the game.
1. Dolphin
Dolphins are friendly creatures. They move fast. Their sounds sometimes may be funny or creepy.




2. Whale
They may look friendly. But their huge body may create huge problems as well. Be careful, if they are near you.


3. Shark
Sharks are not going to be dangerous in the first version the game. A minigame about shark attacks is going to be implemented in the second version. 


4. Other

There are going to be 8 different types of fishes in addition to octopus and stingray. Some of them are slightly poisonous. If you eat them, you become ill. They don't kill you, instantly. You must cure yourself, if you eat a poisonous sea creature.


  

‣ Hunting & Resource GatheringThere are two holes on the boat for putting fishing rod and trawl. If you craft two fishing rod or trawl, you can use them at the same time. You have to remove them before the storm. Otherwise, you will lose them.



a. Fishing Rod
Fishing rod can be used for hunting a single fish. Crafting it, is easier than trawl. You can craft longer fishing line. This will increase your chance and you will "probably" get bigger fishes. Probability changes according to depth.  Also, fish hunting time will be shorter.


When you use a fishing rod, you have to check the sea depth (Sea depth is going to be on the screen). Otherwise, if fishing hook hit seabed, your fishing line will break off after a while. You have to adjust it.



b. Trawl
Representative picture about trawling

You can use trawl to hunt more than one fish and get resources which is on the seabed. You can get fishes, woods, plants, inorganic things, etc... Your trawl must hit the seabed. Otherwise, you will get only fishes. You have to check the depth. Also, your trawl is not big as the representative picture. You have 4 slots.
It is not going to be easy to craft a trawl. Needed resources can be gotten from the sea surface. Some objects are floating on the water. You need to grab them.



c. Floating Objects

Grabbing floating objects, is another way to gather resources in the game. As you know, all objects are not floatable.  So, you must craft a trawl to reach others. 
Grabbing floating objects, is going to be a minigame. You must chase the object with the cursor for a while and fill the grab bar, to grab it. This minigame will make grabbing more challenging and funnier.  While a valuable object is moving on the water near you, it will be thrilling for you. 


‣ CookingYou can cook food  in the game. It is optional. But eating raw meat is not healthy. If you don't cook your food, you may become ill. Also, you have to track cooking. Otherwise, eating burned food is not healthy as well.




‣ Drinking Water

As you know, water is extremely important for life. But, sea water is not drinkable. If you drink it, you will die because of dehydration. Also, it has various microorganisms. You may be ill. 
In the game, you are free to drink it. But, if you drink too much sea water, you will die or become ill.
So, you must produce drinking water. Theory of it, is simple. "Boil the sea water, collect it as a drinking water"Representative picture about producing drinking water
You can drink the collected water, safely.
Note: This process removes minerals from water. You can get minerals from food, alternatively. Long-run affects on health is scientifically controversial.


‣ Crafting

There is an inventory and crafting mechanism in the game. You are going to be able to craft new/better items with crafting system such as longer fishing line, boat cover, blanket, trawl, medicine, bucket, hammer etc... Also, you may find some original thrown items (radio,  lamp,  etc...), while you are trawling and you will be able to use some of them to craft new items.

‣ Character Stats

There are various character stats in the game.Health: If your character is ill or drowning, health decreases. Eating and sleeping increases it. Also, sitting slightly makes it better.Hunger: There are various foods in the game and their effects are different. Some of them(big fishes etc.) are filling.Thirst: You can drink sea water (even though it causes dehydration, illness in the game) or you can produce drinking water with boiling method or you can collect rainwater in a bucket. It is up to you. But their effects are different.Cold: Temperature changes according to hour and the weather in the game. It will be cold after midnight and if you want to sleep or sitting, you may need a thicker blanket or you can make a fire. Otherwise, you may freeze or become ill.Energy: When you do something (crafting, etc.), you will lose energy in the game. But, refilling it, won't take too much time. You can get more energy with eating, sitting, sleeping.Seasickness: The main character is not a sailor and he may have seasickness. Weather and boat bobbing affects this stat. You may vomit and lose your health because of this reason. After you get some experience, you will deal with this, easily.Experience: Your experience increases with time and it affects almost all character stats. Seasickness will become rare and your character will resist tiredness, hunger, thirst and cold more. Also, your mental health will be better.Mental Health: Being alone in the middle of the sea, is quite scary. At the beginning of the game, your character's mental health will be quite sensitive. He will be better with more experience. Creepy sea creature sounds, stormy weather, illness, hunger and other "negative things" make it worse.  Sleeping, sitting and eating makes it better.



When your character loses his mental health, he will start to hear weird imaginary sounds and see imaginary creatures, happenings. Daydreams, hallucinations may make things worse.   


‣ Illness

a. TemporaryIt is not fatal and you don't need medicine to cure it. It will limit your character's actions (preventing crafting some items, etc.) for temporary.

b. FatalYou must craft a medicine to cure. You will need some sea plants to do this.  Otherwise, you will die.

c. Fatal (Instant)If your character stats are so bad (especially mental health). Your character may die because of heart attack. A scary daydream may impact his life.

story:
Short Summary

I am a sport loving fan, and had the privilege to travel to various countries, attending different games in different arenas under different climatic conditions.

The Bandaluza is the ultimate in contemporary spectator support. Inspired by the exuberance of South American carnival, this lightweight, double-handled banner takes its name from the Portuguese words bandeira (flag) and luz (light).

We have been granted the rights and bandaluza has been made an official product for the Rio2016 Olympic and Paralympic games.

The banduluza would be a spectator use and take home memorabilia, also helping create the perfect carnival environment

Besides being part of an ever lasting legacy to see a product you help fund in the Olympics and Paralympics, and to be able to say “I was part of that”, because we see you as part of the bandaluza family, we are part of something greater……



What We Need & What You Get

We need about $350,000 to make 100,000 units of the bandaluza.
The funds would be used in the following way:

Manufacturing / Logistics - This makes up for 85% of fund, We plan to produce 100,000 units of the bandaluza during the games.

Distribution - 5% of the funds will be allocated towards the internal distribution of products, with limited infrastructure in country, getting the products to our distribution partners is key to attaining Market coverage.

Marketing / Temp Work force - 10% allocated to the creation of our workforce and marketing materials are needed to create and enhance product and brand awareness in Rio and other Brazilian cities.

To show are appreciation we also will include our lumi-fan as part of gifts, this can be seen in our different packages.

The Impact

With 200 different countries, 42 different events in 32 different arenas, 7.5 million tickets and the expectation of 4-5 million external visitors to Rio(Source: Rio2016.com)

We have been granted the license to provide our innovative products during the Olympic and Paralympic games, Rio 2016.

The host nation Brazil, is renowned for its colorful, carnival and party capital of south america, with a population over 180 million people.

We are targeting sales to 4% of the travelling fans coming to the games, excluding the home nation crowd

This is an innovative product never been seen, in its shape, size or form.

The Bandaluza is the only product that would be integrated into the total landscape of the events.

It is priced competitively and more affordable than other official products.

The bandaluza is one of the very few in-play merchandise that one can buy and use immediately and yet still keep to become a memorabilia.

It creates the euphoria of a fun, colorful and carnival like sporting environment, promoting love, peace and happiness.

Charity Work: We are giving a percentage of our proceeds to various sporting charities and foundations, like the red cross, to help combat the zika virus epidemic in brazil, like the football for hope, the solidarity sports organization, which help young children …. we will be giving back

Risks & Challenges

Direct

These are other official products, which would be sold in the stadiums and fan zones.

They include products like flushes, mugs, cups, hats, stickers, Coasters, bags, scarves, shirts, footwear and clothing apparels.

InDirect

Snacks, drinks and consumable products set up in the arenas and stadiums.

Other non-official merchandise.

There is a mandate with the IOC and Brazil Government to crack down on non-official products, making licensed products more available to the population and expected visitors.

The Bandaluza is one of the most reasonably priced official product available.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us to make this dream come true!!!!

Even if you cant help financially, please help spread the word 

  •  make some noise about our campaign. #Bandaluza
  • please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
1. EVENT DRIVEN COMMUNITY SPACE

"SO YOU WANT TO GO TO A REAL PARTY?"

Geekz and Gamez is a new kind of comic and game store: an event-driven community space. Where tournaments are held, battle are fought, friends are found, people are welcomed and revels are made. We cater to all fandoms, geek related hobbies, and a wide variety of tabletop and card games.

At Geekz and Gamez, you will have the opportunity to attend and participate in a number of fun events and tournaments, including:


2. RETAIL INNOVATION

"WE WANT TO BE THE VERY BEST, LIKE NO ONE EVER WAS!"

All other comic, card, and hobby stores are basically a teenage boy’s closet. They have a dark, dingy, smelly, uninviting atmosphere with stuff crammed to the ceiling. These places are typically so disorganized, cluttered, and confusing that most casual customers just want to get out as quickly as possible.

When entering Geekz and Gamez, customers will find:

3. INCLUSIVE AND SAFE ENVIRONMENT

“NOTHIN’S GONNA HARM YOU, NOT WHILE I’M AROUND”

It is a widely known fact that certain demographics, specifically women, do not feel welcome in geek and gaming environments. They are belittled and harassed every time they attend a convention or tournament.

At Geekz and Gamez, we emphasize an inclusive and safe environment for all members of the geek community. Trolls are not welcome in our store and at our events. We believe that fandoms and games are for everyone and will consistently represent that belief every day.




4. FANDOM OBSESSED

"YOU FAIL TO RECOGNIZE THAT IT MATTERS NOT WHAT SOMEONE IS BORN, BUT WHAT THEY GROW TO BE."

At Geekz and Gamez, we go beyond selling merchandise and hosting Magic tournaments. We care deeply about the geek community and want to help build up each fandom (in-store and online) by hosting fandom events, online forums, and meet-ups for fandoms including:

  • Potterheads: Harry Potter Fans
  • Whovians: Doctor Who Fans
  • Brown Coats: Firefly Fans
  • Trekkies: Star Trek Fans
  • Bronies: My Little Pony and Friends Fans
  • Other fandoms include: Wayward Sons, Trainers, Tributes, Ringers, Furries, Sherlockians, Twihards, Assassins, Oncers, Whedonites, Boneheads, Psychos, Gaters, Avengers, X-Philes, Truebies, Hooligans, Scoobies, Gleeks, Loki’s Army, Phans, and so on…

5. COOL MERCH

"IT'S SO FLUFFY I'M GONNA DIE!"

We carry the latest games, expansions, accessories, pop culture paraphernalia, and work from local artists and crafters. If we don’t have what you want, we’ll find it. Here are just a few kinds of product you’ll find at Geekz and Gamez:


6. SUPER KNOWLEDGABLE EMPLOYEES

"IF YOU'RE GOOD AT SOMETHING, NEVER DO IT FOR FREE."

Every single one of our team are active members of various niche communities. We educate our employees on all of our product and events to better serve you. We have a screening process to make sure our staff are:






REINVENTING THE COMIC SHOP AND GAME STORE

Between the two of them, Robert and Marty have visited thousands of comic and card shops all over the world and they have found one consistent problem with each and every one of them.

Upon first entering a comic, card, or geek/hobby store, the customer is hit by a smell. It’s as if an alarm goes off. They are smelling the age of the product in the store, old food remains, dust, the stench of a rarely cleaned bathroom, body order from all of the gamers who have come through, and the carpet that has never been cleaned. As the customer’s eyes adjust, they find themselves squinting in a dimly lit room the size of Harry’s cupboard under the stairs. There is wall-to-wall, floor-to-ceiling merchandise crammed into every nook and cranny. Boxes that have never been opened are piled to the ceiling containing merchandise awaiting its turn to be displayed. Backorders are piled behind the counter, proof that many customers never return. It feels as if the whole room is pressing in on you like a trash compactor on the Death Star. The owner is sitting behind the counter, watching TV or shooting the breeze with a buddy. The customer is lucky to get a “What’s up”, let alone an offer of assistance. Like a choose your adventure novel, the customer may make a hasty exit, wait another 30 minutes to catch the owner’s attention, or cautiously stroll through the stacks of teetering merchandise trying to find the one thing they came in for. Regardless of which path they choose, the customer has never been more grateful for the sun searing their eyeballs and the faint scent of gasoline on the wind as they free themselves from their temporary imprisonment.

That’s why Robert and Marty want to start Geekz and Gamez. They have a vision of a welcoming, safe, clean, friendly environment.

Upon entering Geekz and Gamez, the faint hum of the T.A.R.D.I.S. greets the customer. A fresh and pleasant aroma fills the air, one devoid of body odor and with clear evidence that the store and its facilities are immaculately cared for. The customer is pleased to find that their eyes don’t need to adjust because the store is brightly lit with natural lighting. The customer takes a moment to take in their surroundings and finds that they have entered a new world. It is as if they have stepped into a life-size comic book. The customer is greeted with a friendly, “Hello! Welcome to Geekz and Gamez! Can I help you?” As the customer begins to browse the merchandise, they find that everything is neatly displayed in an engaging, but not overwhelming, way. They hear snippets of conversations from other customers discussing the latest movie, television show, or philosophy behind their favorite book. There is a group of students playing a board game at a table, while another young customer is receiving advice from an experienced trading card game player on what elements their deck needs for tournament play. A light on the door of the podcast booth in the back of the store indicates that there are fun and creative projects happening just inches away. There may be a cosplay workshop or live performance taking place. The customer is not only able to find what they came for, but have discovered several new items of interest and have learned about an upcoming event pertaining specifically to their fandom. This is a place they can spend an afternoon, perhaps make some new friends, and get advice on their Cosplay, LARPing, or game of choice and suggestions for new things to try.


EVENTS! EVENTS! EVENTS!

Our events are at the core of everything we do. With our events, podcasts, webseries, and gaming tournaments, we want to change the status quo. The retail part of the store is important, but engagement with the community and challenging established societal norms (within communities including Hollywood, conventions, gaming tournaments, and cosplay events) is at the heart of Geekz and Gamez. We celebrate local performance artists, filmmakers, aspiring professional gamers, live-streamers on Twitch or Youtube Gaming, Improv Groups, and those who think both inside and outside the box (the box is bigger on the inside, after all). We will have equipment available for these aspiring creative types to practice, hone their craft, and market their own brand of genius. We will have plenty of in-store events. But, that’s not all. We will be hosting large-scale events and tournaments, sponsoring local geek related clubs and teams, and organizing Cosplay and LARPing events.


ALL GEEKS AND GAMERS WELCOME - NO EXCLUSIONS

There have been a number of events which have happened within the geek and gaming communities which have left certain demographics, females in particular, feeling alienated. By and large, the geek and gaming communities seem to assume they are male-dominated, which simply isn’t the case. Female voices within these communities are significant and growing louder and more impactful every day. We cannot change the industry without recognizing that one simple fact. Women matter, they have a voice, and they are a powerful force within the industry. It is crucial that we at Geekz and Gamez lead by example in the way we do business. We cater specifically to women and other marginalized groups within these industries and will not tolerate any person who demonstrates a demeaning, offensive, or discriminatory attitude in word or action within our store, online, and at our events.

When we talk about “Inclusive and Safe”, we mean that we don’t tolerate discrimination. We want to be sure that at our events, in our online forums, and in our store, everyone is welcome. There is no elitist attitude. We expect a certain behavior and tolerance from everyone involved with Geekz and Gamez from staff to customers. No harassment is tolerated. Period.


CALLING ALL SUPER FANS!

A fandom is the community that surrounds a TV show, movie, book, etc. At Geekz and Gamez we celebrate fandoms and believe that every fan should have the right and opportunity to discuss and express their passion for their favorite book, movie, TV show, game, manga, anime, etc. Geekz and Gamez is a place where people are encouraged to wear their cosplay. Even our staff is encourage to wear cosplay. There are many events catered to specific fandoms in the works which have never been done before. Our customers are encouraged to get involved with our events, hang out in the store and talk about what they love, display their fan art, and receive our assistance in building their own community.


LOCAL ARTISTS & OTHER TALENT

At Geekz and Gamez, we love featuring local artists, sculptors, craftsman, and performance artists. Artists with unique merchandise they’ve created will have the opportunity to have that merchandise displayed and sold in our store. Improv groups are invited to play and perform on our stage. Beat poets are welcome to come and wax philosophical about Pokémon. If people have ideas for web series and podcasts, we want to work with them. Think of Geekz and Gamez as a platforming for representing your fandom, for displaying your own brand of genius, for being the best geek you can be.



Thank you for taking the time to support Geekz and Gamez!

There is a common understanding that nerds are academically driven, geeks are hobby driven, and dorks are those who understand the difference. Robert Smith and Marty Sferrazza are a couple of the biggest dorks you will ever meet.

Robert discovered the joys of both geeking and gaming at a very young age playing Dungeons and Dragons during recess while cross-stitching Nintendo characters with his friends. Robert has been preparing to open this store for years. He has his Bachelors of Science degree in Business with an emphasis in Management and Marketing. He also has an Associate’s degree in Event Management and Marketing as well as Web Development and Graphic Design and is a trained event management specialist. As a former professional TCG player, tournament judge and tournament organizer , Robert is very familiar with event and tournament structure and the needs of the players. Robert has even judged professional cosplay and costuming events as well as taught hundreds of workshops on gaming, costuming and crafting.

When Marty was little, he enjoyed dressing himself and his dog in battle gear and going on adventures. He has a Bachelor’s of Science in Business with an emphasis in Project Management and Visual Communications. Marty has also participated in and judged professional trading card game tournaments and has years of sales experience. He is a jack-of-all-trades but a master of nothing but geeks and games. He can’t help but share his love of life and this lifestyle.

Erin is a longtime theater geek and board gamer. When she was young, she and her little sisters would dress up, put her parent’s musical soundtracks on the record player and put on elaborate productions. Erin is a professional actor and writer, currently finishing her Bachelor’s degree at University of California, Irvine in Dramatic Arts. She also has an Associate’s Degree in Theater. Erin has years of retail and customer service experience. She works in a more creative support role for Geekz and Gamez.

story:
What is Galex Games?

Galex Games is set to be a full service gaming center located in Valdosta, GA. Galex Games will provide a location for gamers of all genres to gather and expand their collections.


We are working towards providing four main areas of service, an Internet Cafe where you can get High Speed Unlimited Wi-FI, a LAN Center where you can access high end computers, consoles to play your favorite video games, and a Card Shop. Additionally we will be hosting various tournaments and events across all areas of operation.


Our goal is to earn enough funding to secure the location and get it operational by November 2015.


What We Need & What You Get:


We have set a goal of $7500 to secure all the remaining necessary elements to provide the best service possible. The more we raise, the more advanced computers and services we will be able to provide. Anyone that donates more than $10 will have their name permanently featured on our website, and if you donate over $50 we will permanently emblazon your name in our store as a thank you for donating. For those looking to receive our eternal gratitude we are providing limited premium options, for $1000 you can get either a year of Card Tournaments or a year of LAN Tournaments for free. For $2000 you can get both LAN and Card Tournaments for free.


There is only one $5000 perk, with this you can get the whole center to yourself for one day, you can do almost anything as long as it is legal! Events are subject to approval and blackouts.  


The Impact:

We chose Valdosta, Ga due to its lack of a similar Gaming Center and its position as a more peaceful gateway to the Southeast. Located within a few minutes walk from the local University campus and minutes from interstate 75. This gives both the local community and those traveling through the area a location to both relax and have a good time, play games with friends, and have some fun competitions.


We want this gaming center to be for the gamers and by gamers, so when you donate over $25 you have the ability to help us design the location and provide input on current and future events.


Risks & Challenges:


We have been running our current business, Andromeda Industries since April of last year. With the expertise of all of the amazing individuals helping with this project we are confident that this center will become a premier location for the entire Southeast region


Right now the biggest challenge we face is finding the remaining funding required to actually open the doors, along every step of the way we have been advised by the local Small Business Development Center as well.


Other Ways You Can Help:

If you cannot donate, then there's still ways you can help out! One thing you can do is to share this campaign to help us spread the word out to as many people as possible. Also you can like our Facebook page and following us on twitter!

story:
THE DAILY DOT:  Arena Online Partners with Team Dragon Knights!

THE DAILY DOT:  Arena Online to Launch $1 Million Amateur League Circuit



Arena Online will be the first FULLY AUTOMATED Tournament Platform for players of ALL skill levels. We will run the most frequent, efficient and smoothest tournaments known to esports players. 

Our platform launches with the universally popular League of Legends, but our plan is for many more games to follow. In fact, if you aren't a League of Legends player, you can have a vote on which game comes next with a donation to our first tier.


JOINING ARENA ONLINE:

10 Facts about Entering Our LOL Tournament Platform

BETA ACCESS comes with all tiers over $5 and will have you competing for payouts as early as November 2015. 

PAYOUTS include cash, Scholarships, Riot Points, Skins, Gear and other really cool prizes from our sponsors!

THE TOURNAMENT PERKS are Pre-Qualified for our $25,000 IndieGoGo Tournament Series in FEB 2016 & include Beta Access tournaments

TOURNAMENT CREDITS are in several or our perks and can be used for entry into pay-to-enter tournaments. READ MORE about Tournament Credits & Qualifier Points. 

THIS WILL BE THE ONLY place to gain access to our tournament platform until our next open enrollment towards the end of Q1 - 2016.


We Guarantee Payouts of $1 MILLION in our 1st Year of FREE-TO -ENTER LoL Tournaments!

1. This is the Guaranteed Prize Pool for our FREE-TO-ENTER Tournaments available as soon as February 2016. 

2. The first opportunity to get your piece of that $1M is through the $25k Indiegogo Inaugural Tournament "Early Access Perk".

3. Our Tournaments are for Players of ALL Skill Levels ... Not Just Elite-Ranked Players. YOU have the chance to WIN!

4. CLICK HERE FOR A GRAPHIC SHOWING OUR PAYOUT BREAKDOWN





Platform Screenshots:

Tournament Dashboard with Featured Tournaments, Events, and News. 


 We will host daily tournaments that will range from: FREE to enter, pay to enter at 1/2 a Tournament Credit, up to 10 Credits to enter. You will also be able to use Qualifier Points to enter certain tournaments!


When you enter a tournament we will match you with a team of similarly skilled players, which you'll see this screen. You can communicate over VOIP with your teammates instead of typed chat, right through our platform! 




1. Entering a tournament will be as easy as joining a Solo Queue game in League of Legends. 

2. There will be a healthy mix of on-demand tournaments & scheduled tournaments that are FREE to enter, with a chance to earn cash and assorted prizes. 

3. For those that live life boldly, there will be tournaments with a nominal entry fee.

4. Automating our tournaments means that teams are match based on their skills, and not by a dude with a whiteboard. We will give players the tournament experience they deserve. Compete against players of your own skill level, and let us handle the rest.

5. Don't believe we can do it? Have you seen our LOL stats site:  http://lol.arenaonline.com



WANT TO KNOW SPECIFICS ABOUT OUR TOURNAMENTS?

BLOG: Entry into our $25,000 Inaugural Tournament
Read our Tournament Rules

We want to bring the thrill of eSports to the masses by allowing players to participate in a structured tournament environment where players achieve more than just winning a 1-off tournament. 

Our players work towards being:
    Tournament of Champions
    Player of the Year
    Tournament MVPs
    Stats Leaders




Guarantee yourself a closed Beta seat and help us create our tournament platform. Those that support us will get to work closely with our developers and offer feedback.

Take advantage of our $25,000 Guaranteed INDIEGOGO Tournament. The more backers we get for this tier, the more tournaments we will add to the series, with each tournament having its own range of player skill levels and its own $25,000 prize pool.

Learn more about our Tournament Rules on our website.


We are a team of entrepreneurial gamers focused on creating a rich tournament experience for all types of gamers.  You may even know us from our stats website we just released at http://lol.arenaonline.com.





This is an opportunity for us to engage the most vital piece of our success, the community. We are coming to you because we want to build this with you, exactly the way you want it. This is an opportunity for us to work together, with open lines of communication. What is more powerful than thousands of minds coming together to build the ultimate tournament experience?

This is also an opportunity for you as gamers and eSports enthusiasts to make your voice heard, and show the world that there is a huge demand for something like this, and we want to be a part of that. We truly appreciate your support: without the support of the community, there is no Arena Online.

There are many ways that you can help us bring E-sports to E-veryone, whether that means you simply follow us on TWITTER or FACEBOOK, pledge $1 or pledge $1,000, it all means so much to us. Together, we can facilitate an even faster growth of eSports and make it accessible to all.





We know that there are a lot of questions regarding  our tournaments and how they will be run. Please visit our FAQ page and Tournament Rules page to learn more. As other questions pop up, we will be sure to add them here!
FAQ: http://www.arenaonline.com/faq
Tournament Rules: http://www.arenaonline.com/rules
Tournament Legal Stuff: http://lol.arenaonline.com/tls
Blog Explaining Tournament: http://blog.arenaonline.com/crowdfunding-tier-preview-entry-into-our-25000-inaugural-tournament-series

QUESTIONS FROM OUR FANS:

We want to make playing Arena Online Tournaments a worthwhile event for the player. In order for this to happen, we needed to create several different types of tournaments that range from ...

 Completely FREE
 Cash Entry
 Invitation Only
 Ladder Events

We will have micro tournaments that only last a couple of hours, to major tournaments that will last 6 or more hours. We are also offering a wide range of prizes from Qualifier Points, to gear, to cool digital rewards such as tiered badges, digital trophies, profile skins, Riot Points (for League of Legends) and the king of all prizes, cash!

We will have stat leaderboards as well. Who has the highest win %? Who is the highest ranked player? Who tops the money list or the Qualifier Points leaderboard? Who is the best Mid Laner? We will have all of these leaderboards and more, with awesome prizes and rewards for those that reach the top.


What is a Tournament Credit?
Tournament Credits are the form of currency used on the Arena Online Tournament Platform. The value of a Tournament Credit is $1.00 US. They can be purchased to enter tournaments that require Tournament Credits, and redeemed to make a cash withdrawal. However, Tournament Credits purchased through IndieGoGo are not redeemable for cash, and can only be used to enter tournaments. Tournament Credits that are won in tournaments, and future purchases directly through Arena Online are redeemable for cash.
Why are Tournament Credits that are purchased through IndieGoGo not redeemable for cash?
The IndieGoGo campaign will allow us to grow and develop a better tournament platform for you. Due to the nature of the campaign, we do not want players to immediately request a withdrawal, and encourage those players to participate in tournaments. Future purchases of Tournament Credits directly through Arena Online will be redeemable for cash.
If I am under 18 years old, can I still participate in cash tournaments?
Cash tournaments that offer an alternate form of payment, such as Riot Points or college scholarships,  are eligible for entry. Each tournament will have its own set of rules and payout schedule, so be sure to check out the tournament to see if your are eligible! You can also participate in any tournament that does not offer cash prizes, and we will have a lot of those!

I see that it costs $50+ to enter the inaugural tournament, will your platform always be that expensive to play?

We wanted to offer something special to kick-off our crowdfunding campaign, so we thought that a giant tournament for a $25,000 payout would be worthy of your donation. In the future, most of the tournaments on our platform will either be free to play or a nominal entry fee of a few dollars. We're in this to build something beneficial for you guys, not to drain your bank accounts dry.

How soon can I start competing on your platform? 

Just about every tier features "Closed Beta Access" that will get you into the platform and playing our free tournaments as soon as NOVEMBER 2015. Those that choose to enter our IndieGoGo Inaugural Tournament Series, this will be our first tournament with a major payout that will also qualify the top 4 placing teams (in each bracket) automatically into our Summer Invitational. After this IndieGoGo campaign, we will not open up further Beta Signups until later in the year. 




Risks and challenges

At Arena Online, we want to provide the ultimate tournament experience for everyone. The more seamless we make it for you, the more complex it becomes to develop for us. Fortunately, we have a team of exceptionally skilled developers and leaders who are not only bent on creating this platform through your voice, but have years of experience developing matchmaking platforms similar to ours for some of the largest games in the world. We are confident in our ability on delivering a tournament platform that will meet your expectations.

The team has been hard at work developing the platform, and we are committed to our Open Beta release date of February 2016 and the kickoff of our inaugural INDIEGOGO Tournament. We are confident that we will be able to hit that timeframe based on the development trajectory that we are currently on.

As with any major development project such as ours, there are unforeseen bumps, roadblocks, complications, bugs and a myriad of other things that could come up and ultimately delay the release of the platform. In the event that this does happen, you will be the first to know and we will work feverishly to try and get back on schedule. We will be here to support our community as much as we can, as your satisfaction is our number one goal.

Through funding on INDIEGOGO, we will be able to scale our staff and develop and add more features faster. We will be able to rigorously test the platform and produce a quality product for you. If we exceed our target goal, we will be able to guarantee more towards our tournament prize payouts, add more game titles faster and add even more cool features.

We have devoted a lot of our own time and resources to get Arena Online started. We sacrificed a lot because that is how much we believe in this. Just like you, we want to create something that the gamers want, and make it the best it can be. Since starting development we have successfully raised a seed round, but this is only the beginning. With your help we can go bigger, be better and develop faster. Help us create an amazing tournament platform!

story:
Initially, we had an idea to make 3D RTS game that is not focused on building your base. But instead, to focus on building your units with the available resources.

With that in mind, we thought of something different to build a unit. Not by recruiting them like most generic strategy game, but by LITTERALLY building them.

What this means is, whenever you cut down a tree, it will produce a scaffold, which you can arrange in certain combination to make a unit.

This way, you can experiment with how you arrange them, because every units in the game have different arrangements. 

Battle Rumble is a 3D real time strategy game with unique unit creation system. In this game, you have to stack the scaffolds, which you can gather from cutting down trees all around the map, in a certain arrangement to build your unit.

Each unit has their own arrangement. There are many unit classes you can build upon as well as vehicles to help you win the battle with your friends.

  • Battle your enemies in a colorful and immersive world to prove who is the strongest.
  • Experiment with combining your resources to build different kinds of units. 
  • Each units comes with their own unique skills and capabilities.
  • Customize your units with cosmetic items acquired through playing so you can boast while you roast your enemies.

Depending on the perks you choose, you will get the following rewards above for contributing and helping us with this game project.
Here is a picture of the T-Shirt

The Hoodie

Exclusive Additional Tower Model

More pictures of the rewards will be released soon, so stay tune guys!

Stretch Goal 1 : If we reach at least $30,000 dollar with our campaign, we will release another playable race, The Orc

Stretch Goal 2: If we reach at least $40,000 dollar with our campaign, we will include more units to be build in the game, including Mage class, Melee Mecha, Ranged Mecha to name a few. These new units will also have their counterpart in Orc class which will be completely different.

Stretch Goal 3: If we reach at least $50,000 dollar with our campaign, we will release a completely new game modes which we will reveal later on.



We are small independent game development company based in Surabaya, Indonesia. We believe that video game is both an art, because it involves wide range of artistic style for it's graphics and a passion, because it has already integrated in the lifestyle of today's society, where so many people around the world enjoys many kinds of video game.

Currently we have a small but dedicated team with high passion in gaming. We are a group of avid gamer, we love playing video games, we love making ourselves look stupid in it and we want to commit ourselves fully to deliver fun and enjoyable games for everyone.

While we have already started the development of this game even before this campaign is published, our team is still small and so is our funds. We have to split our team to manage other client based project to support funding for this game.

And this is where you can help us. With your contributions, we can together finish this game and have fun playing it. Also, we will proudly say in any conference or media coverage that this game can only be completed thanks to all of you, our contributors!

Every contribution you make will benefit us greatly. It will enable us to add more team members to speed up the development process and to purchase additional hardware equipment, computers and software to help us in making this game.

So, please help us reach our goal of at least $25,000. If it reach more than that, it will be used to speed up the development process and potentially add more units and game features as we can afford more than we have expected.

Q: Why crowd funding?

A: We have been working on this project for several months now, but we felt that our progress is quite slow because our small team. That's why, we want to ask for your help through crowdfunding services to increase our team size and therefore, speed up the process. It will also help us to get new and better equipment to support our team's needs

Q: Are you aware of the risk and challenges in making RTS game?

A: Yes, we aware that there are so many RTS games out there which are very good. But we are also confident in our own project, because we have something which differentiate our product from any other product, in this case, the unit creation systems that is unlike any other RTS games out there.

Q: Why don't you try to get funding from investor or game publisher?

A: We want to be independent and we don't like to be rushed when we work on something. If we have investor or game publisher backing us up, we would have to be ready to meet their standard and deadline, which could result in buggy or incomplete game if we rush things out and that would surely disappoint many of our customers who expect the best from us.

Q: When will the rewards be delivered

A: Product keys (alpha, beta, final game) will be delivered when each respective phase is released. Digital goods such as digital poster or wallpaper and OST will be sent to your email as soon as it ready. Physical goodies will be bundled with the physical copy of the complete game, so it will be delivered when the game is finished.

Lastly, we want to give our big thank you to Indiegogo which enables us to do crowdfunding campaign to help fund our project and we also would like to thank all of you guys, for checking our campaign and make any contributions for this project!

Currently we have a small but dedicated team with high passion in gaming. We are a group of avid gamer, we love playing video games, we love making ourselves look stupid in it and we want to commit ourselves fully to deliver fun and enjoyable games for everyone.

While we have already started the development of this game even before this campaign is published, our team is still small and so is our funds. We have to split our team to manage other client based project to support funding for this game.
And this is where you can help us. With your contributions, we can together finish this game and have fun playing it. Also, we will proudly say in any conference or media coverage that this game can only be completed thanks to all of you, our contributors!
Every contribution you make will benefit us greatly. It will enable us to add more team members to speed up the development process and to purchase additional hardware equipment, computers and software to help us in making this game.
So, please help us reach our goal of at least $25,000. If it reach more than that, it will be used to speed up the development process and potentially add more units and game features as we can afford more than we have expected.

Q: Why crowd funding?
A: We have been working on this project for several months now, but we felt that our progress is quite slow because our small team. That's why, we want to ask for your help through crowdfunding services to increase our team size and therefore, speed up the process. It will also help us to get new and better equipment to support our team's needs
Q: Are you aware of the risk and challenges in making RTS game?
A: Yes, we aware that there are so many RTS games out there which are very good. But we are also confident in our own project, because we have something which differentiate our product from any other product, in this case, the unit creation systems that is unlike any other RTS games out there.
Q: Why don't you try to get funding from investor or game publisher?
A: We want to be independent and we don't like to be rushed when we work on something. If we have investor or game publisher backing us up, we would have to be ready to meet their standard and deadline, which could result in buggy or incomplete game if we rush things out and that would surely disappoint many of our customers who expect the best from us.
Q: When will the rewards be delivered
A: Product keys (alpha, beta, final game) will be delivered when each respective phase is released. Digital goods such as digital poster or wallpaper and OST will be sent to your email as soon as it ready. Physical goodies will be bundled with the physical copy of the complete game, so it will be delivered when the game is finished.
Lastly, we want to give our big thank you to Indiegogo which enables us to do crowdfunding campaign to help fund our project and we also would like to thank all of you guys, for checking our campaign and make any contributions for this project!

story:
--------------------------------------------------------------

Prometheus e-shop for the PPCB Maker. 

---------------------------------------------------------------
”PPCB Maker” is an exciting suitcase for people who make at home their own prototype PCB’s and need professional finishing.

              

Unill now, we need 3d printing for prototypes, laser or inkjet printers for personal printing and personal electronic prototypes for our electronic patents

“PPCB Maker” solves this issue!! The First complete, versatile Desktop Printed Circuit Boards for your working table.

For everyone, hobbyist to professional,  PCB designers,  have now a necessary and an incredible innovative tool.

Now, technology is available for anyone, without expensive risk, without delay .

Make any electronic prototype for what you like to bring in life. Make any arduino breakable board, any open hardware PCB, specific and detailed  electronic circuit, print them with  accuracy in your copper board.

The compact size (46cm×33cm×22 cm - 18,11 inch × 13,00 inch × 8,66 inch), with all items going inside in a suitcase when you not use them, gives you more free space in your working table and make “PPCB Maker” portable .

The processing includes just 3 steps.
1) The “PPCB Maker” in a suitcase,
2) the silkscreen 
3) the etching tank.
All this knowlegde comes 50% from graphics art methods and the other 50% comes from electronics methods .

“PPCB Maker” is a desktop and portable suitcase to make prototype electronic boards.

The “PPCB Maker” suitcase has 2 side exposing UV lamps located up and down in the suitcase.The “PPCB Maker” can handle: lithography film, plasticrice paper, transparency film for laser or inkjet printer, polymer film . A “PPCB Maker” uses a vacuum air pump to make the absolutely perfect contact between the film and the copper board, as well as between the film and the silk screen mesh.

The “PPCB Maker” suitcase has a versatile use, it can expose 1 or 2 side photosensitive copper boards.

It can expose the silkscreen mesh, it can expose and dry the UV soldering & UV curable mask. The “PPCB Maker” can receive  full A4 size 210mm x 297mm copper boards, photosensitive copper boards and silkscreen frames.

The silkscreen can print the most thin electronic circuits, and it can moreover print the  soldering mask, and the UV curable mask for finishing protection.

   

The etching tank uses bubbles and motion when removing the unused copper from the Electronic Circuit Boards. It can use ferrous chloride, or hydrochloric acid with hydrogen peroxide + water in proportion 3:3:15 .

The whole and complete process is being shown in a video, photos and operation instructions for the users are available as a DVD in perks.


3 Ways how to use “PPCB Maker”

1) Exposition of 1 or 2 side photosensitive copper inside the “PPCB Maker”.

2) Exposition of the silk screen photosensitive mesh frame .

3) Exposition of the soldering mask and of the UV curable mask for drying them.

4)Exposition of the conductive UV ink for non copper pcb's.


PPCB Maker the experimental prototype going to be Open Souce Hardware  near end May and in the first days of june we open the prototype experimental PPCB maker in  http://blog.promitheas.net/?p=51,                                                                        and : http://prometheusce.blogspot.gr

PPCB experimental prototype , operation and adapters.


PPCB experimental prototype , silkscreen ppcb maker, silk screen adaptor , vacuum, UV exposure lamps,



PPCB experimental prototype , pcb's ppcb maker, pcb adaptor , vacuum, UV exposure lamps,


Image from gallery, early experimental prototype.


The funds collected from this campaign will be used for:

Production finishing. We make extensive testings in our prototypes, we have  some engineering and electrical modifications which can refine the external shape of the “PPCB Maker”.

The additional components  :  Interior modification, the silk screen frame and etching tank  of the “PPCB Maker” will require a modification of the dimensions.

Technical materials: such as the mesh, the  most appropriate  UV lamps, the electronic starter for the UV lamps.

The “PPCB Maker” suitcase inside has a complex modification that will ensure the “PPCB Maker” custom components can be mass produced in the highest possible quality.

Raw Materials– The “PPCB Maker” also uses raw materials like UV inks for curing mask and stencil mask, photosensitive paste, films and transparency paper, etc.  Since these are high quality components, we will test them before final the release, and we will purchase larger quantities to keep our prices low for customers.

Final assembly – The last step in production is the large scale assembly for all custom components, the assembly of all custom components can be made by the Social Cooperative Enterprise named “Prometheus” .

Shipping – “PPCB Maker” fulfillment team from “Prometheus” SCE  can  organize and handle the mass shipment of thousands of orders worldwide. For the shipping we cooperate with DHL International.

If we don’t reach the goal, we will complete only the requested claiming perks. And the “PPCB Maker” will continue to be sold in Prometheus SCE’s e-shop. 


Until now, a lot of people experimented how to make their own PCBs. Now, this requirement of necessity is met by the “PPCB Maker”.

For industry:  a complete prototype proof, assembly component, bug-free printed circuit board, ready for mass production. Only the Gerber file is needed .

For the PCB designer: “PPCB maker” offers the flexibility to create the prototype and improve the presentation of their work as soon as possible.

For the PCB hobbyist: is given the opportunity to make a completely own PCB with professional finish.

For the first time, all the methods and the tools needed to make a complete PCB Prototype are in one suitcase.

Technical Information for “PPCB Maker”



PPCB Maker PDF information : brosure prospect


When you select a Perk remember to add shipments, they can announced after the end of the campaign, because we need mass amount for shipment to reduce shipping costs. DHL International will handle the shipping and deliveries.

-------------------------------------------------------------

Prometheus e-shop for the PPCB Maker.

--------------------------------------------------------------

Some issues concerning the tests before releasing the product. Such one is the most suitable UV curable ink, the most suitable soldering mask paste , also we need to extent  testing of the silkscreen mesh for printing extra light line circuits and soldering pate, We need to solve the topology of any parts inside “PPCB Maker” suitcase for ergonomic and more useful use. Multilayer with UV materials and conductive materials is for extended feature, also printing graphene ink for plastic sensors

According with milestones we are going to solve the above problems in the first 4 months June – September 2015.

Thank you so much for checking out our project!!!
You don't need to use your money to help us; we can use your excitement and support:

  • Get the word out there and let your friends know about the “PPCB Maker”!
  • Share our campaign on social media!

  •  Share with your friends and family!

  • You can share about “PPCB Maker” via your professional network 
  • The Indiegogo social tools could help!
  • Remember that if we don't reach our goal, then we won't get funded to complete the “PPCB Maker”

We appreciate every single one of you. Your support for us is invaluable.


Q: What you can do with “PPCB Maker”?                                                                                   

A: 1) Prototype PCBs, one or two sided, with photosensitive surface.

    2) Prototype PCBs, one or two sided with silkscreen printing.

    3) You can cover the boards with curable mask.

    4)  You can cover the boards with soldering mask.

    5) Make flexible boards.

Q: What materials can we use in “PPCB Maker”?

A: 1) Conductive inks or paste.

    2) Photosensitive pastes (silkscreen).

   3) Graphic arts film, transparent paper.

   4) UV inks.

Q: Can I use transparent film or paper for printers?

A: Yes, you can use paper or transparent film for laser and/or inkjet printers.

Q: What do I need to make plain copper PCBs to photosensitive PCBs?

A: You only need the “PPCB Maker” and a silkscreen frame to apply the photosensitive ink in one or two-sided PCB.

Q : -Can the suitcase create PCBs with vias and through-holes?
A: PPCB Maker don’t make vias , and need different tool for that.

Q: -How heavy is it?
A: Approximate near 5 Kg the suitcase with component inside.

Q: -Who do you see as your typical user?

A: PPCB Maker is for people who like to make printed circuit boards at home with profesional finishing.

story:
The idea behind Virtual Screams is to offer theme park style Haunt experiences using the new Oculus Rift virtual reality headset.

I've built my career the past 10 years as a video game Environment Artist, and I'm currently the art lead for SchoolofDragons.com, before I started my career in video games I worked at Disneyland in Attractions and then in the Entertainment Department for almost 13 years. My goal is to bring my past experience in both theme park design and video game development to make an unique virtual reality experience which I plan to offer on the Oculus Rift.  (http://www.oculusvr.com/) The Oculus Rift will be available for purchase in Quarter one of 2016 and must be purchased separately as it is not a part of this campaign.


Our first VR experience will make its premier at Scare LA (scarela.com) August 8-9th at the Pasadena Convention Center.

The Phobia Simulator

 Designed to simulate and cure phobias and anxieties for their patients the Phobia Simulation chamber is the newest edition to the Phobos Laboratories.

You are the next volunteer for testing and you will soon learn that sometimes the thing to fear...is fear itself.


Risks and challenges

I've been working in the video game industry for 10 years and I've been through many tight deadlines and challenging projects as an Art Lead. So I have experience tackling large projects like the haunted mazes we will be building for Virtual Screams. The best way to be successful is to surround yourself with good people, and I'm lucky to have a great team of fellow Game Developers who are committed to help make this project happen.

A facebook page for this project has already been set up on which we will post updates and images of the progress on current mazes and projects. So you will be able to check in on our current progress as the mazes get closer to completion.

https://www.facebook.com/virtualscreams

We have a grand vision for what the Virtual Screams experience could be and that is where you come in. We are demoing our current progress at the ScareLA convention for free this August 8-9th at the Pasadena Convention Center in California. After the convention we will post videos of the reactions we get from the haunt enthusiasts who experience the Demo there as well as keep you up to date on our progress  moving forward with new content.

So make a pledge and help make Virtual Screams a reality!

Thank you,

Ryan Batcheller

story:
What is G.A.U.S.S.?

G.A.U.S.S. is the Grand Amiibo Ultimate Smash Series, a collection of amiibo tournaments of a variety of formats grouped for one purpose, to figure out who is the ultimate amiibo trainer! The purpose of this fundraiser is to allow the amiibo community to contribute directly to the GAUSS prize pool and make this a truly epic tournament series.

Why contribute?

By contibuting to this fundraiser, you'll be increasing the prize pool for GAUSS, helping Splice cover the costs of the awesome trophmiibos he's made, and, potentially, helping yourself increase the prize pool for yourself if you are able to make it to the Final GAUSS-down tournament! Oh... and did I mention the awesome perks we have arranged?

The Perks

  • D-tier: You will be given the GAUSS Donator title on the Splicestream Discord and access to the Mad GAUSS, the channel only for Donators where we can make plans to make GAUSS bigger and badder than ever!
  • C-tier:  In addition to D-tier perks, you get a GAUSS amiibo stand and flag to show off  your support for GAUSS. Additionally if we hit $1000 we will print more flags for trainers who win tournaments, reach the Final GAUSS-Down tournament, and other milestones to have more things to put into your GAUSS stand.
  • B-tier: Love that snazzy custom Splice jersey shirt that has his name and the number 11 on it? Well, you can get one two and join Team GAUSS. Each jersey will be customized with your gamer-tag and number of your choice! Check it out, it's pretty cool. Also you'll get the D-tier perks.
  • B+ tier: Want both the shirt AND the amiibo stand? Simply sign up for the B-tier and be sure to get the C-tier add-on perk to get the stand for half the price of just signing up for C-tier itself! By Grabthar's Hammer, what a savings!
  • A-tier: Only 10 of these will be given away: The official GAUSS-theme Wii Fit Trainer amiibo! Each amiibo has been custom painted by Splice himself and numbered to indicate the order in which they were purchased. Currently the amiibo you see in pictures is only in stage two of preparation (silver base and green figure) but when it's done the trainer's hair and clothing will be painted in white and silver respectively. Oh, and additionally you'll get the perks of D-tier.
  • S-tier: Legends speak of the secret S-tier. How do you get it? By grabbing A, B & C-tier all at the same time! That's right! If you bought them all separately it would cost you $128 but by selecting A-tier and getting the B & C-tier addons you can get all three for an even $100! Join S-tier only if you can handle being an extreme baller (and don't worry, unlike Bowser and Incineroar, we won't ban you). Additionally, those who join S-Tier won't just get the GAUSS Wii Fit Trainer amiibo, customized shirt, amiibo stand, GAUSS support flag, and Mad GAUSS access. They will also recieve the Certificate of Authentication that certifies that, yes, this was not only was the amiibo hand-painted and hand-shipped by Splice, but that your amiibo was handled with utmost care and sung sweet lullabies as it was packed. And I'm not even kidding. I plan to put much more work into this Certificate of Authentication than I really should. Angels will weep when they read this thing.

Prize pool

The more money we raise, the bigger the prize pool will get with 1st place getting more and even more players getting rewarded. However, how much money is available in the pool is all dependent upon what perks people sign up for as different tiers have different costs and blah blah blah. Therefore, the numbers you see before you are estimates but no matter how little or how much we raise, once we subtract out costs, the entire funding will go to the prize pool. Below are our estimates of what we think is possible. These are Splice's most conservative estimates to be safe so if the prize pool ends up being significantly higher, that's why.

  • $450- 1st-4th get prizes, $70 total prize pool. 1st gets $35
  • $575- 1st -6th get prizes. $125 total prize pool. 1st gets $50
  • $750- 1st-8th get prizes. $205 total prize pool. 1st gets $70
  • $1000- 1st-12th get prizes. $335 total prize pool. 1st gets $100
  • $1400- 1st-16th get prizes. $490 total prize pool. 1st gets $100
  • $1500- 1st-16th get prizes. $525 total prize pool. 1st gets $135

Again, these are just CONSERVATIVE ESTIMATES. Prize pools are likely to be bigger at each pay level but Splice is trying to underpromise and overdeliver when it comes to the prize pool :)

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Promote GAUSS on social media by making clips of fun or amazing moments
  • Share GAUSS content on various Discords you run
  • Send amiibo to Splice's PO Box for future Trophmiibo

Thanks so much for your time! We'll see you shortly! All perks will be mailed out in November when we know exactly how many people are interested in what items.
