Oh, and additionally you'll get the perks of D-tier.
S-tier: Legends speak of the secret S-tier. How do you get it? By grabbing A, B & C-tier all at the same time! That's right! If you bought them all separately it would cost you $128 but by selecting A-tier and getting the B & C-tier addons you can get all three for an even $100! Join S-tier only if you can handle being an extreme baller (and don't worry, unlike Bowser and Incineroar, we won't ban you). Additionally, those who join S-Tier won't just get the GAUSS Wii Fit Trainer amiibo, customized shirt, amiibo stand, GAUSS support flag, and Mad GAUSS access. They will also recieve the Certificate of Authentication that certifies that, yes, this was not only was the amiibo hand-painted and hand-shipped by Splice, but that your amiibo was handled with utmost care and sung sweet lullabies as it was packed. And I'm not even kidding. I plan to put much more work into this Certificate of Authentication than I really should. Angels will weep when they read this thing.


Prize pool
The more money we raise, the bigger the prize pool will get with 1st place getting more and even more players getting rewarded. However, how much money is available in the pool is all dependent upon what perks people sign up for as different tiers have different costs and blah blah blah. Therefore, the numbers you see before you are estimates but no matter how little or how much we raise, once we subtract out costs, the entire funding will go to the prize pool. Below are our estimates of what we think is possible. These are Splice's most conservative estimates to be safe so if the prize pool ends up being significantly higher, that's why.

$450- 1st-4th get prizes, $70 total prize pool. 1st gets $35
$575- 1st -6th get prizes. $125 total prize pool. 1st gets $50
$750- 1st-8th get prizes. $205 total prize pool. 1st gets $70
$1000- 1st-12th get prizes. $335 total prize pool. 1st gets $100
$1400- 1st-16th get prizes. $490 total prize pool. 1st gets $100
$1500- 1st-16th get prizes. $525 total prize pool. 1st gets $135

Again, these are just CONSERVATIVE ESTIMATES. Prize pools are likely to be bigger at each pay level but Splice is trying to underpromise and overdeliver when it comes to the prize pool :)

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Promote GAUSS on social media by making clips of fun or amazing moments
Share GAUSS content on various Discords you run
Send amiibo to Splice's PO Box for future Trophmiibo

Thanks so much for your time! We'll see you shortly! All perks will be mailed out in November when we know exactly how many people are interested in what items.

story:
You are The BIG Trouble in

You fight as a kaiju while humans and their ground defenses attempt to take you down.  

                                                         
 
Test your kaiju’s strengths, learn its weaknesses, and adapt your fighting style to achieve supreme victory. Some of the kaiju will use only the keyboard while others will use a keyboard and mouse combination. When you are a novice player, you may need to restart the game repeatedly until you master your kaiju's moves and tactics. 
 
You descend upon Earth and reap utter destruction in this giant monster arcade style game. Select your kaiju and start obliterating everything in your path. Pay attention to your health and power bars, as some kaiju are unable to heal. 
 
 
 
 
 

Part of our inspiration for The Kaiju Offensive came from a Godzilla game that we didn’t like. We enjoy playing giant monster games and were discussing them and realized that we hadn't seen any that appealed to us in a long time. So, we made it our goal to make a kaiju game everyone could thoroughly enjoy playing.

Suspicious Ducks is a very small indie game development team. There are two of us, but we are fully committed to developing our game. We have been working on The Kaiju Offensive for more than a year now. We have a playable pc version of our game with four kaiju. It is not available to the public yet. We would like to add more kaiju, maps and human bosses to the game, however we need financial support in order to continue working on it. We are planning a March 2019 delivery date. This date is based on the project reaching minimum funding goals. 

The size of the game and the delivery date will be dependent on the degree to which the project is funded. However, a larger project may result in a later delivery date of the final game. We will do everything in our power to deliver the game on time. We don't have an advertisement budget, so we have taken on the daunting task of advertising. Our friends and family have been a tremendous help in sharing information and playing the demo on social media. 

Disclaimer:  Please note our backers are very important to us and we want to include them in the design and gameplay of The Kaiju Offensive. We will incorporate their game ideas as much as we deem feasible. However, we reserve the right to reject ideas that we find unsuitable. The final decisions will be at Suspicious Ducks’ discretion.

If you just can't contribute financially, that doesn't mean you can't help.

Download and play the demo: 

        https://drive.google.com/file/d/1qEa7zWp93FXoeJ...

Please share this page and tell your friends about our demo and game. 

Make some noise about our campaign on social media.

Please use Indiegogo share tools.

Follow Us on Social Media:

https://www.facebook.com/Suspicious-Ducks-34847...

http://razorsedgegames.org/the-kaiju-offensive/

https://twitter.com/SuspiciousDuck5

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCsOD54qg2YZxZ4...

We appreciate all the support you can give us. Thank you!

story:
Change The Game!

Welcome to GameWithMe. We are here to disrupt the gaming world with a new eSports broadcasting experience that is focused on providing the best experience for our streamers and our members. Our focus is not on censoring what our streamers say and what they do. Our mission is to change the game. Join us on this awesome journey. 

Innovation - That's The Name of the Game

GameWithMe was created to provide the best user experience on the market. This is shown in our focus on eSports and cooperative gaming.

Innovative Design - 

When you stream or view on GameWithMe, you won't be inundated with silly animations and sounds which distract you from the gaming experience. You're looking for a more mature gaming experience and we give it to you

VS Mode -

We love tournament gaming. The biggest part of the tournaments that we don't like is that many of the top gamers can't make it to the tournaments. There are many barriers to participating in physical tournaments. Travel expenses, obtaining a visa, travel time, and lack of previous exposure. We felt that there needed to be a way for gamers to prove their skills to the world without having to fly across the world. Enter Player 2.

VS Mode allows for 2 gamers to broadcast together at the same time, playing the same game on one screen, regardless of geographic location. We gamify this even more by allowing for the viewers to vote for their favorite gamer  via monetized votes that not only provide a popularity pulse for the streamers, but also feed into a progressive pool that the streamers can choose the percentages that the winner gets, from splitting the pot 50/50 or winner take all.

Tournament Gaming -

Our exclusive VS Mode, opens the door to having real online tournaments which happen completely online. Gamers from different continents can participate in these tournaments opening the door to participate in physical tournaments. GameWithMe is also focused on creating collegiate eSports tournaments as well. 

In our opinion, skill is the most important aspect of eSports. GameWithMe Tournament Gaming gives skill more importance than where you are located. We will be partnering with corporate sponsors to create tournaments that have large prize pools playing the best games on the market. We feel like the games played in eSports currently are not wide enough, and want all games to have the opportunity to show who is the best.

 

It's Dangerous to Go Alone, Take This.

GameWithMe is a community, and we are looking for early adopters to join us on this adventure. Together we are much stronger than we ever could be alone. The funds that we raise here will be used to further development, improve support, market the site and create new innovations.

Since we are targeting a December 12th launch date, everyone that backs the site via Indiegogo will be able to use their tokens on our live beta site and after the official launch. Our payout structure is to send more money to the streamers and not to the shareholders of the largest companies in the world. 

We can't do this alone, we need your help.  

Changing The Game, One Streamer At A Time

Right now, the gaming broadcast market is dominated by a company that doesn't respect their streamers like GameWithMe does. It's apparent in the name of the company. Our founders want to create a real gaming community. This is something that the competition doesn't want to have. They want to have a few top gamers that they turn into stars and take advantage of the efforts of the rest. 

The vision of GameWithMe is to give all gamers to be stars, based on their skills and how entertaining they are; not the patch of soil that they live on. There are no borders in the virtual world.

What Could Go Wrong?

First of all, we are taking on the biggest company in the world. This company owns the top streaming service on the planet. They have an unlimited budget for marketing and for development, but their lack of innovation on the site proves that they are complacent. This is because there is not a viable option that is created by gamers or streaming experts. Our CEO has over 12 years in the online streaming market and is bringing all of this expertise into GameWithMe to create an experience that the gaming world has been begging for. 

We are David taking on Goliath and while we relish the underdog role, we still need your help, and we will never lose sight of our roots. 

Other Ways You Can Help

While we know that not all people can support us financially, that doesn't mean you can't be a part of the journey. Here are a few other ways that you can help us to ensure success:

  • Share this project on your social media to increase visibility - Getting the word out to others is just as important as financially backing us. Since we are just getting started, visibility is one of the most important commodities for us at the moment. We appreciate all of the help that we can get. 
  • Become a streamer on GameWithMe - Streaming on GameWithMe is a great way to be a part of the journey. Not only do we pay our streamers a fair amount, but we actually care about our streamers. This is reflected in the level of our support. We will do everything we can to make our streamers be heard and happy. 
  • Become a member of GameWithMe - Streamers are only half of the equation. We want members that are looking for the best user experience in eSports and gaming. GameWithMe is focused on providing the best service and support to our members, as well as to our streamers. Innovation is nothing without support. 

We are looking forward to changing the game with YOU!

story:
Summary

Who we are:

We are Veterans who make games, it's that simple. 

We are Sue Bean Studios, and Indie Dev Company completely Veteran owned and operated. Our mission statement:

"Showcase what Indie's and Veterans, are capable of."

 

Thanks to the awesome support from Indiegogo and our followers, we were able to release our first game, HIVE, now available on Steam. This time, we have a project that's just as close to our hearts. 

Law of War: Night Ops is a multiplayer, tactical FPS focused on the difficulties of night-time operations, both with and without NVG's (night vision goggles). 

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

We are asking for $1,000. Here's the breakdown:

  • $100 - Steam publishing fee
    • This gets our game on one of the most highly trafficked game portals in the world. Our last game gets 20,000 views on steam, on average, daily. 
  • $125 - LLC fee in the state of North Carolina
    • This finally gains us the credibility of being a state recognized LLC, which means more opportunity for investors, and putting our team on a more dedicated payroll. 
  • $500 - Marketing
    • That 20,000 views daily for HIVE? That's without any external marketing. This time, we want to roll out deluxe additions, Google and Youtube advertising, and much, much more. 
  • $200 - Playtesters
    • We want to deliver the best product possible. This means hiring the best play testers, and ironing out the bugs - before it goes mainstream. 
  • $75 - A dedicated server
    • We don't know how many players may be online at one time, but we want to be prepared. So for LoW, we are going to be hosting on our own dedicated server, so the end-user never runs into any issues. 

 

Market Research

 

The gaming market is booming, that's no secret, especially the multiplayer genre. 

Games like PUBG and Fortnight saw millions of players in their first month alone. We expect a steady growth pattern following a 500 player first quarter. 

Not only that, but we are the only Game Dev studio who is completely Veteran owned and operated. Who better to release war games? 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Money is tight, we all feel the effects of the pandemic, and other factors, throughout 2020. We understand you may not be able to contribute to the project financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help get the word out. 

If you like this project, or others, share the campaign on social media, or even word of mouth! Let everyone know about the Veterans who make games.

story:
Welcome to the next generation of Cyberpunk virtual reality. Patrol the streets and the skies, solving mysteries, fighting crime, or giving in to corruption and your own desires. The choice is yours.

Pledge now for immediate access to the development build for SteamVR, Oculus and Windows MR headsets in October and a full retail release copy in 2020.

Development build keys will be emailed out to you as soon as possible. As this is a manual process, it may take up to 12 hours to receive your key. Thanks for your patience.

LOW-FI is the street name given to those who cannot merge with The Platform, a ubiquitous virtual reality simulation where most of the population now live their lives. You are a low-fi police officer that has recently been transferred to a particularly crime ridden section of city-block 303. The only inhabitants of note in your jurisdiction are other low-fi, and human intelligence (or below) artificial life forms who have remained among the citizens after the AI singularity.

 Somewhere, there is a crime happening. You're the law around here, what's your idea of fun? There's plenty to keep you occupied. From investigating the death of the man you're replacing as sheriff to the "white collar" crimes and petty street stuff. It's up to you what you allow, and who or what you pursue.

Officially, almost everything the low-fi do is a crime. Meme-punks hacking ad-boards to show their dissent, crypto-kids hijacking everything with a CPU for monetary gain. Maybe you can get a piece of that... You could use the extra creds.

It's rough out there, but there's still fun to be had.

You could hit the arcade... maybe the casino... shake somebody down, or just play some games. 

 

"Robo-sexuality" has been outlawed... even between consenting, sentient beings. Low-fi lovers forced underground. You could look into that...

You ever wonder what it's like on the other side? I mean, what's happening on The Platform? Is it the Utopian dream the media says it is, or some kind of nightmarish brave new dystopia?

Maybe you can to find out... maybe you're happy just getting by out here. You've got the run of the place. I'm sure you'll do what's right...

 

LOW-FI is a massive open-world sandbox style adventure with action elements.

The emphasis is on exploration and character driven stories. Like a holodeck program, the player is free to explore the city, further narratives, or just hang out in the arcades and back alleys spending their hard earned credits.

Moral grey areas can be explored via player choice in most situations through actions or dialogue trees. You can for example chose to take a bribe rather than arrest a criminal, or even frame a third party for personal gain. Who's going to stop you?

You are free to fly around your entire jurisdiction (section 303). Credits are awarded during your shift for both time and for duties (busts, etc.). Credits can be used at black market shops, dark web delivery systems, vending machines etc., for anything from ship upgrades to bribes or just some decorations for your capsule apartment.

We want LOW-FI to feel like a real world. Completely non-linear and open ended with plenty to see and do.

  • Massive non-linear open world
  • Hundreds of crimes and stories to solve and explore complete with branching narratives and dialogue
  • Procedural markets with thousands of purchasable item possibilities
  • Interactive Photo-realistic NPCs
  • 3D positional Audio
  • Augmented Reality within Virtual Reality with multiple overlay programs
  • Companion NPCs (biological and synthetic)
  • Gun-play (Optional)
  • Arcade Mini-games
  • Playable on min-spec VR capable PCs

We have already implemented many locomotion and comfort mechanics to the game to suit most player VR preferences. The ship flights sections have various tunneling options as well as control fine tuning.

Ground based methods include:

  • Fast or slow smooth turning
  • Snap Turning
  • Smooth Walk (Head oriented)
  • Smooth Walk (Controller oriented)
  • Teleport
  • Zoom Teleport
  • Arm Swing movement
  • Cloudstep 

 

We've already spent a lot of time fleshing out the world of LOW-FI using only the profits from our previous title TECHNOLUST. There are already many dense areas to explore and an entire city to patrol. Most of the work has gone into nailing the cyberpunk atmosphere and getting the basics in place. We've learned a lot over the past 6 years of VR development and think that now is the time to take things to the next level.

Right now, you can fly over the entire city with all the major PC VR hardware.  Many of the key systems are in place. Many locomotion and comfort options are in place. There's some gunplay, a drone companion that follows you through the streets as your A.R. HUD highlights points of interest and information about your surroundings.

Now is the time for YOU to step up and bring the next generation of virtual reality to life. With your pledge, not only will you get immediate access to the world of LOW-FI on the VR platform of your choosing, but you'll also become part of the history of the future. 

VR is in desperate need of lush worlds for players to explore. The time for tech demos and mini games is over. It's time for VR to start fulfilling its true potential. The potential shown to us in the great Sci-Fi works of the past and present. 

The more funding LOW-Fi receives from Kickstarter, the closer we will be to the cyberpunk holodeck future we've been dreaming of for years.  With extra funds comes more content, higher quality sound, art, animation and talent. Help us bring VR to next level.

LOW-FI is a massive open-world sandbox style adventure with action elements.
The emphasis is on exploration and character driven stories. Like a holodeck program, the player is free to explore the city, further narratives, or just hang out in the arcades and back alleys spending their hard earned credits.
Moral grey areas can be explored via player choice in most situations through actions or dialogue trees. You can for example chose to take a bribe rather than arrest a criminal, or even frame a third party for personal gain. Who's going to stop you?
You are free to fly around your entire jurisdiction (section 303). Credits are awarded during your shift for both time and for duties (busts, etc.). Credits can be used at black market shops, dark web delivery systems, vending machines etc., for anything from ship upgrades to bribes or just some decorations for your capsule apartment.
We want LOW-FI to feel like a real world. Completely non-linear and open ended with plenty to see and do.




Massive non-linear open world
Hundreds of crimes and stories to solve and explore complete with branching narratives and dialogue
Procedural markets with thousands of purchasable item possibilities
Interactive Photo-realistic NPCs
3D positional Audio
Augmented Reality within Virtual Reality with multiple overlay programs
Companion NPCs (biological and synthetic)
Gun-play (Optional)
Arcade Mini-games
Playable on min-spec VR capable PCs



We have already implemented many locomotion and comfort mechanics to the game to suit most player VR preferences. The ship flights sections have various tunneling options as well as control fine tuning.
Ground based methods include:

Fast or slow smooth turning
Snap Turning
Smooth Walk (Head oriented)
Smooth Walk (Controller oriented)
Teleport
Zoom Teleport
Arm Swing movement
Cloudstep 

 


We've already spent a lot of time fleshing out the world of LOW-FI using only the profits from our previous title TECHNOLUST. There are already many dense areas to explore and an entire city to patrol. Most of the work has gone into nailing the cyberpunk atmosphere and getting the basics in place. We've learned a lot over the past 6 years of VR development and think that now is the time to take things to the next level.
Right now, you can fly over the entire city with all the major PC VR hardware.  Many of the key systems are in place. Many locomotion and comfort options are in place. There's some gunplay, a drone companion that follows you through the streets as your A.R. HUD highlights points of interest and information about your surroundings.
